verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen in deserto Sinai, in tabernaculo fœderis, prima die mensis secundi, anno secundo egressionis eorum de terra Ægypti, dicens :
verses.english: The Lord spoke to Moses in the desert of Sinai, inside the tabernacle of the covenant. This happened on the first day of the second month, in the second year after they had left the land of Egypt. The Lord said:

verses.latin: Tollite summam universæ congregationis filiorum Israël per cognationes et domos et familias suas, omnium masculorum per nomina singulorum,
verses.english: "Take a census of the entire assembly of the children of Israel, organizing them by their lineages, households, and families. Count all the males, one by one, by their individual names.

verses.latin: a viginti annis et supra, omnium qui possunt exire ad bella Israël, et numerabitis eos per turmas suas, tu et Aaron.
verses.english: Count all those who are twenty years old and older—everyone in Israel who is capable of going out to war. You and Aaron are to count them by their divisions.

verses.latin: Eruntque vobiscum principes de singulis tribubus, de domibus et familiis suis.
verses.english: And with you there will be a leader from each tribe, representing their own households and families."

verses.latin: Hæc sunt nomina virorum : De Ruben, Elisur filius Sedeur.
verses.english: These are the names of the men: From the tribe of Reuben, Elizur the son of Sedeur.

verses.latin: De Simeon, Salamiel filius Surisaddai.
verses.english: From the tribe of Simeon, Salamiel the son of Surishaddai.

verses.latin: De Gad, Eliasaph filius Duel.
verses.english: From the tribe of Gad, Eliasaph the son of Duel.

verses.latin: De Juda, Nahasson filius Aminadab.
verses.english: From the tribe of Judah, Nahashon the son of Aminadab.

verses.latin: De Issachar, Nathanaël filius Suar.
verses.english: From the tribe of Issachar, Nathanael the son of Zuar.

verses.latin: De Zabulon, Eliab filius Helon.
verses.english: From the tribe of Zebulon, Eliab the son of Helon.

verses.latin: De Joseph, princeps filiorum Ephraim, Elisama filius Ammiud.
verses.english: From the sons of Joseph, the leader of the tribe of Ephraim: Elishama the son of Ammihud.

verses.latin: De Manasse, Gamaliel filius Phadassur.
verses.english: From the tribe of Manasseh, Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur.

verses.latin: De Benjamin, Abidan filius Gedeonis.
verses.english: From the tribe of Benjamin, Abidan the son of Gideon.

verses.latin: De Dan, Ahiezer filius Ammisaddai.
verses.english: From the tribe of Dan, Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai.

verses.latin: De Aser, Phagiel filius Ochran.
verses.english: From the tribe of Asher, Pagiel the son of Ochran.

verses.latin: De Nephthali, Ahira filius Enan.
verses.english: From the tribe of Naphtali, Ahira the son of Enan.

verses.latin: Hi sunt nobilissimi congregationis, principes tribuum et familiarum suarum, duces exercitus Israël.
verses.english: These men are the most esteemed of the assembly, the leaders of their tribes and families, the heads of the army of Israel.

verses.latin: Quos, assumptis Moyse et Aaron, et congregata universa multitudine, recensuerunt per familias, cognationes et domos suas, et nomina singulorum, a viginti annis et supra,
verses.english: Moses and Aaron took these leaders, and then they assembled the entire multitude of Israel. They counted them by their families, lineages, and households, recording the names of each individual, all those who were twenty years old and older,

verses.latin: sicut præceperat Dominus. In deserto Sinai,
verses.english: just as the Lord had commanded them to do. This census took place in the desert of Sinai.

verses.latin: Numerati sunt de Ruben, primogenito Israël, per cognationes et familias suas, atque domos patrum, et nomina singulorum capitum, masculi omnes a viginti annis et supra, qui poterant exire ad bella,
verses.english: From the tribe of Reuben, Israel's firstborn son, the count was taken. They were enumerated by their lineages and families, by their ancestral households, and by the names of each head. All the males who were twenty years old and older, capable of going out to war,

verses.latin: quadraginta sex millia quingenti.
verses.english: numbered forty-six thousand five hundred.

verses.latin: De filiis Simeon, per cognationes et familias suas, atque domos patrum, recensiti sunt per nomina singulorum capitum, masculi omnes a viginti annis et supra, qui poterant exire ad bella,
verses.english: From the sons of Simeon, enumerated by their lineages and families, by their ancestral households, and by the names of each head. All the males who were twenty years old and older, capable of going out to war,

verses.latin: quinquaginta novem millia trecenti.
verses.english: numbered fifty-nine thousand three hundred.

verses.latin: De filiis Gad, per cognationes et familias suas, atque domos patrum, recensiti sunt per nomina singulorum, a viginti annis et supra, qui poterant exire ad bella,
verses.english: From the sons of Gad, enumerated by their lineages and families, by their ancestral households, and by the names of each individual. All those who were twenty years old and older, capable of going out to war,

verses.latin: quadraginta quinque millia sexcenti quinquaginta.
verses.english: numbered forty-five thousand six hundred and fifty.

verses.latin: De filiis Juda, per cognationes et familias suas, atque domos patrum, recensiti sunt per nomina singulorum, a viginti annis et supra, qui poterant exire ad bella,
verses.english: From the sons of Judah, enumerated by their lineages and families, by their ancestral households, and by the names of each individual. All those who were twenty years old and older, capable of going out to war,

verses.latin: septuaginta quatuor millia sexcenti.
verses.english: numbered seventy-four thousand six hundred.

verses.latin: De filiis Issachar, per cognationes et familias suas, atque domos patrum, recensiti sunt per nomina singulorum, a viginti annis et supra, qui poterant exire ad bella,
verses.english: From the sons of Issachar, enumerated by their lineages and families, by their ancestral households, and by the names of each individual. All those who were twenty years old and older, capable of going out to war,

verses.latin: quinquaginta quatuor millia quingenti.
verses.english: numbered fifty-four thousand five hundred.

verses.latin: De filiis Zabulon, per cognationes et familias suas, atque domos patrum, recensiti sunt per nomina singulorum, a viginti annis et supra, qui poterant exire ad bella,
verses.english: From the sons of Zebulon, enumerated by their lineages and families, by their ancestral households, and by the names of each individual. All those who were twenty years old and older, capable of going out to war,

verses.latin: quinquaginta septem millia quatuorcenti.
verses.english: numbered fifty-seven thousand four hundred.

verses.latin: De filiis Joseph, filiorum Ephraim, per cognationes et familias suas, atque domos patrum, recensiti sunt per nomina singulorum, a viginti annis et supra, qui poterant exire ad bella,
verses.english: From the sons of Joseph—specifically from the sons of Ephraim—enumerated by their lineages and families, by their ancestral households, and by the names of each individual. All those who were twenty years old and older, capable of going out to war,

verses.latin: quadraginta millia quingenti.
verses.english: numbered forty thousand five hundred.

verses.latin: De filiis Manasse, per cognationes et familias suas, atque domos patrum, recensiti sunt per nomina singulorum, a viginti annis et supra, qui poterant exire ad bella,
verses.english: From the sons of Manasseh, enumerated by their lineages and families, by their ancestral households, and by the names of each individual. All those who were twenty years old and older, capable of going out to war,

verses.latin: triginta duo millia ducenti.
verses.english: numbered thirty-two thousand two hundred.

verses.latin: De filiis Benjamin, per cognationes et familias suas, atque domos patrum, recensiti sunt per nomina singulorum, a viginti annis et supra, qui poterant exire ad bella,
verses.english: From the sons of Benjamin, enumerated by their lineages and families, by their ancestral households, and by the names of each individual. All those who were twenty years old and older, capable of going out to war,

verses.latin: triginta quinque millia quatuorcenti.
verses.english: numbered thirty-five thousand four hundred.

verses.latin: De filiis Dan, per cognationes et familias suas, atque domos patrum, recensiti sunt per nomina singulorum, a viginti annis et supra, qui poterant exire ad bella,
verses.english: From the sons of Dan, enumerated by their lineages and families, by their ancestral households, and by the names of each individual. All those who were twenty years old and older, capable of going out to war,

verses.latin: sexaginta duo millia septingenti.
verses.english: numbered sixty-two thousand seven hundred.

verses.latin: De filiis Aser, per cognationes et familias suas, atque domos patrum, recensiti sunt per nomina singulorum, a viginti annis et supra, qui poterant exire ad bella,
verses.english: From the sons of Asher, enumerated by their lineages and families, by their ancestral households, and by the names of each individual. All those who were twenty years old and older, capable of going out to war,

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen et Aaron, dicens:
verses.english: And the Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron, giving them instructions:

verses.latin: Filii Israël ponent tentoria, singuli per turmas et cohortes suas, atque vexilla: ex adverso tabernaculi fœderis circum circa.
verses.english: The sons of Israel are to set up their tents, each man in his own camp, divided by their regiments and under their own tribal banners. These camps are to be arranged all around the tabernacle of the covenant, facing it.

verses.latin: Ad orientalem plagam in latere orientis, tribus Juda castra metata erunt, per turmas suas: et princeps filiorum Juda, Naasson filius Aminadab.
verses.english: On the eastern side, towards the sunrise, the tribe of Judah shall pitch their camp, organized by their own divisions. The leader of the sons of Judah will be Nahshon, the son of Amminadab.

verses.latin: Et omnis summa pugnatorum de tribu ejus, septuaginta quatuor millia sexcenti.
verses.english: The total count of all the fighting men from his tribe was seventy-four thousand six hundred.

verses.latin: Juxta quem statim ponent tentoria de tribu Issachar, princeps eorum Nathanaël filius Suar.
verses.english: Immediately next to them, the tribe of Issachar shall pitch their tents. Their leader is Nathanael, the son of Zuar.

verses.latin: Et omnis summa pugnatorum de tribu ejus, quinquaginta quatuor millia quadringenti.
verses.english: The total count of all the fighting men from his tribe was fifty-four thousand four hundred.

verses.latin: Juxta hæc castra de tribu Zabulon, princeps eorum Eliab filius Helon.
verses.english: Next to these camps will be the tribe of Zebulun. Their leader is Eliab, the son of Helon.

verses.latin: Et omnis summa pugnatorum de tribu ejus, quinquaginta septem millia quadringenti.
verses.english: The total count of all the fighting men from his tribe was fifty-seven thousand four hundred.

verses.latin: Omnes, qui numerati sunt in castris Juda, centum octoginta sex millia quadringenti, per turmas suas: hi primi movebuntur.
verses.english: The total number counted in the camp of Judah—which includes Judah, Issachar, and Zebulun—was one hundred eighty-six thousand four hundred fighting men, all organized by their divisions. These are the first groups that will set out when the camp moves.

verses.latin: In castris filiorum Ruben ad meridiem, princeps eorum Elisur filius Sedeur.
verses.english: To the south, the camp of the sons of Reuben will be stationed. Their leader is Elizur, the son of Shedeur.

verses.latin: Et omnis summa pugnatorum de tribu ejus, quadraginta sex millia quingenti.
verses.english: The total count of all the fighting men from his tribe was forty-six thousand five hundred.

verses.latin: Juxta quem statim ponent tentoria de tribu Simeon, princeps eorum Salamiel filius Surisaddai.
verses.english: Immediately next to them, the tribe of Simeon shall pitch their tents. Their leader is Shelumiel, the son of Zurishaddai.

verses.latin: Et omnis summa pugnatorum de tribu ejus, quinquaginta novem millia trecenti.
verses.english: The total count of all the fighting men from his tribe was fifty-nine thousand three hundred.

verses.latin: Juxta hæc castra de tribu Gad, princeps eorum Eliasaph filius Duel.
verses.english: Next to these camps will be the tribe of Gad. Their leader is Eliasaph, the son of Deuel.

verses.latin: Et omnis summa pugnatorum de tribu ejus, quadraginta quinque millia sexcenti quinquaginta.
verses.english: The total count of all the fighting men from his tribe was forty-five thousand six hundred fifty.

verses.latin: Omnes, qui numerati sunt in castris Ruben, centum quinquaginta unum millia quadringenti quinquaginta, per turmas suas: hi secundi movebuntur.
verses.english: The total number counted in the camp of Reuben—which includes Reuben, Simeon, and Gad—was one hundred fifty-one thousand four hundred fifty fighting men, all organized by their divisions. These are the second groups that will set out when the camp moves.

verses.latin: Et moveri tabernaculum fœderis, cum castris Levitarum, quod erit in medio aliorum castrorum: sicut ponent, ita et auferent: singuli per loca et ordines proprios.
verses.english: Then the tabernacle of the covenant will move, along with the camp of the Levites, who are responsible for it. The Levites' camp will be positioned in the very center of all the other tribes' camps. Just as they carefully set up their camps, so too they will carefully take them down, each individual following their specific place and designated order.

verses.latin: Ad occidentalem plagam in castris Ephraim, princeps eorum Elisama filius Ammiud.
verses.english: To the west, the camp of Ephraim will be stationed. Their leader is Elishama, the son of Ammihud.

verses.latin: Et omnis summa pugnatorum de tribu ejus, quadraginta millia quingenti.
verses.english: The total count of all the fighting men from his tribe was forty thousand five hundred.

verses.latin: Juxta quem statim ponent tentoria de tribu Manasse, princeps eorum Gamaliel filius Phadassur.
verses.english: Immediately next to them, the tribe of Manasseh shall pitch their tents. Their leader is Gamaliel, the son of Pedahzur.

verses.latin: Et omnis summa pugnatorum de tribu ejus, triginta duo millia ducenti.
verses.english: The total count of all the fighting men from his tribe was thirty-two thousand two hundred.

verses.latin: Juxta hæc castra de tribu Benjamin, princeps eorum Abidan filius Gedeonis.
verses.english: Next to these camps will be the tribe of Benjamin. Their leader is Abidan, the son of Gideon.

verses.latin: Et omnis summa pugnatorum de tribu ejus, triginta quinque millia quadringenti.
verses.english: The total count of all the fighting men from his tribe was thirty-five thousand four hundred.

verses.latin: Omnes, qui numerati sunt in castris Ephraim, centum octo millia centum, per turmas suas: hi tertii movebuntur.
verses.english: The total number counted in the camp of Ephraim—which includes Ephraim, Manasseh, and Benjamin—was one hundred eight thousand one hundred fighting men, all organized by their divisions. These are the third groups that will set out when the camp moves.

verses.latin: Ad aquilonem, in castris Dan, princeps eorum Ahiezer filius Ammisaddai.
verses.english: To the north, the camp of Dan will be stationed. Their leader is Ahiezer, the son of Ammishaddai.

verses.latin: Et omnis summa pugnatorum de tribu ejus, sexaginta duo millia septingenti.
verses.english: The total count of all the fighting men from his tribe was sixty-two thousand seven hundred.

verses.latin: Juxta quem statim ponent tentoria de tribu Aser, princeps eorum Phegiel filius Ochran.
verses.english: Immediately next to them, the tribe of Asher shall pitch their tents. Their leader is Pagiel, the son of Ocran.

verses.latin: Et omnis summa pugnatorum de tribu ejus, quadraginta unum millia quingenti.
verses.english: The total count of all the fighting men from his tribe was forty-one thousand five hundred.

verses.latin: Juxta hæc castra de tribu Nephthali, princeps eorum Ahira filius Enan.
verses.english: Next to these camps will be the tribe of Naphtali. Their leader is Ahira, the son of Enan.

verses.latin: Et omnis summa pugnatorum de tribu ejus, quinquaginta tres millia quadringenti.
verses.english: The total count of all the fighting men from his tribe was fifty-three thousand four hundred.

verses.latin: Omnes, qui numerati sunt in castris Dan, centum quinquaginta septem millia sexcenti: hi novissimi movebuntur.
verses.english: The total number counted in the camp of Dan—which includes Dan, Asher, and Naphtali—was one hundred fifty-seven thousand six hundred fighting men, all organized by their divisions. These are the last groups that will set out when the camp moves.

verses.latin: Hæc est summa filiorum Israël, qui numerati sunt per exercitus suos, sexcenta tria millia quingenti quinquaginta.
verses.english: This is the grand total of the sons of Israel who were numbered and organized by their armies: six hundred three thousand five hundred fifty fighting men.

verses.latin: Levitæ autem non sunt numerati inter filios Israël: sicut præceperat Dominus.
verses.english: However, the Levites were not counted among the fighting men of the sons of Israel, just as the Lord had commanded.

verses.latin: Fecerunt ergo filii Israël omnia, quæ præceperat Dominus Moysi: sic castra metati sunt, et sic profecti per turmas et familias et domos suas.
verses.english: Therefore, the sons of Israel did everything exactly as the Lord had commanded Moses. This is how they pitched their tents for camp, and this is how they marched out, each group organized by their divisions, families, and households.

verses.latin: Hæc quoque sunt generationes Aaron et Moysi, in die qua locutus est Dominus ad Moysen in monte Sinai.
verses.english: These are the priestly lineages of Aaron, and these are the descendants of Moses. These records begin from the day the Lord spoke to Moses on Mount Sinai.

verses.latin: Et hæc nomina filiorum Aaron: primogenitus ejus Nadab, et Abiu, et Eleazar, et Ithamar.
verses.english: These are the names of Aaron’s sons: Nadab, his firstborn, then Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.

verses.latin: Hæc nomina filiorum Aaron sacerdotum, qui uncti sunt, et quorum rite initiatæ manus, ut sacerdotio fungerentur.
verses.english: These are the names of Aaron’s sons, who were consecrated as priests. Their hands were formally initiated for the sacred office, so they could carry out the duties of the priesthood.

verses.latin: Mortui sunt enim Nadab et Abiu, quando obtulerunt ignem alienum coram Domino in deserto Sinai: absque liberis: et sacerdotio functi sunt Eleazar et Ithamar coram Aaron patre suo.
verses.english: Nadab and Abihu, however, died when they offered unauthorized fire before the Lord in the desert of Sinai. They died without leaving any children. Therefore, Eleazar and Ithamar carried out the priestly duties in the presence of their father, Aaron.

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Adduc tribum Levi, et sta eam in conspectu Aaron sacerdotis, ut ministrent ei, et suppleant ea quæ pertinent ad cultum.
verses.english: Bring forward the tribe of Levi. Place them before Aaron the priest, so they can assist him and attend to the duties that pertain to worship.

verses.latin: Et custodiant tam vasa tabernaculi testimonii, quam quæ ad cœremonias pertinent, ut ministrent filiis Israël.
verses.english: They must also guard the sacred vessels of the Tabernacle of the Testimony and everything pertaining to the ceremonies, to serve the children of Israel.

verses.latin: Cuncta quæ pertinent ad cultum tabernaculi, et filiorum Israël, custodient.
verses.english: They will be responsible for all the duties related to the worship in the Tabernacle, and for the service of the children of Israel.

verses.latin: Dabisque Levitas Aaron et filiis ejus, ut serviant sibi.
verses.english: You are to assign the Levites to Aaron and his sons, so they can assist them in their service.

verses.latin: Aaron vero et filios ejus constitues super cultum sacerdotii: quicumque alienus accesserit, morietur.
verses.english: But Aaron and his sons, you shall appoint them to oversee all the sacred duties of the priesthood. Any outsider who approaches to perform these duties will be put to death.

verses.latin: Et locutus est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Ego tuli Levitas a filiis Israël pro omni primogenito, qui aperit vulvam in filiis Israël, eruntque Levitae mei.
verses.english: Behold, I have chosen the Levites from among the children of Israel, in place of every firstborn male who opens the womb among the children of Israel. So the Levites shall be considered mine.

verses.latin: Meum est enim omne primogenitum: ex quo percussi primogenita in terra Ægypti, sanctificavi mihi quicquid primum nascitur in Israël, ab homine usque ad pecus: mei sunt: ego Dominus.
verses.english: For every firstborn belongs to me. From the day I struck down all the firstborn in the land of Egypt, I consecrated for myself everything firstborn in Israel, from man to beast. They are mine. I am the Lord.

verses.latin: Et locutus est Dominus ad Moysen in deserto Sinai, dicens:
verses.english: And the Lord spoke to Moses in the desert of Sinai, saying:

verses.latin: Numera filios Levi per domos patrum suorum et familias, omnem masculum ab uno mense et supra.
verses.english: Count the sons of Levi according to their ancestral households and families. Count every male from one month old and upward.

verses.latin: Numeravit igitur Moyses, ut sibi fuerat imperatum, filios Levi.
verses.english: So Moses counted the sons of Levi, just as he had been commanded.

verses.latin: Et fuerunt hi filii Levi per nomina sua: Gerson, et Caath, et Merari.
verses.english: These were the sons of Levi, by their names: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.

verses.latin: Filii Gerson: Lobni et Semei.
verses.english: The sons of Gershon were Libni and Shimei.

verses.latin: Filii Caath: Amram, et Isaar, Hebron et Oziel.
verses.english: The sons of Kohath were Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.

verses.latin: Filii Merari: Moholi et Musi. Hæ sunt cognationes Levi per domos et familias suas.
verses.english: The sons of Merari were Mahli and Mushi. These are the clans of Levi according to their households and families.

verses.latin: A Gerson stirps Lobni et Semei: haec sunt familiæ Gersonitarum.
verses.english: From Gershon came the clans of Libni and Shimei; these are the families of the Gershonites.

verses.latin: Numerati sunt de masculis ab uno mense et supra, septem millia quingenti.
verses.english: Those counted among the males, from one month old and upward, numbered seven thousand five hundred.

verses.latin: Hi erant post tabernaculum ad occidentem, qui tendebant tentoria sua.
verses.english: These Gershonites would pitch their tents behind the Tabernacle, to the west.

verses.latin: Et princeps familiarum Gersonitarum, Eliasaph filius Lael.
verses.english: The chief of the Gershonite households was Eliasaph, son of Lael.

verses.latin: Et ad custodias ejus pertinebant tabernaculum fœderis, et operimentum ejus, atque vela quæ in introitu tabernaculi fœderis sunt.
verses.english: Their responsibilities included guarding the Tabernacle of the Covenant, its covering, and the curtains that are at the entrance of the Tabernacle of the Covenant.

verses.latin: Ac vela atrii, et cortina in introitu atrii tabernaculi, cuncta quæ ad altare pertinet, funes tabernaculi, ac vasa universa supellectilis ejus.
verses.english: Also, the curtains of the courtyard, and the curtain at the entrance of the courtyard of the Tabernacle, all that pertains to the altar, the ropes of the Tabernacle, and all the vessels of its furnishings.

verses.latin: A Caath stirps Amramitarum et Isaaritarum, et Hebronitarum, et Ozielitarum: haec sunt familiæ Caathitarum per cognationes suas.
verses.english: From Kohath came the clans of the Amramites, the Izharites, the Hebronites, and the Uzzielites. These are the Kohathite families according to their clans.

verses.latin: Numerati sunt omnes masculi ab uno mense et supra, octo millia sexcenti: habebant custodiam sanctuarii.
verses.english: All the males counted, from one month old and upward, numbered eight thousand six hundred. Their specific duty was the care of the sanctuary.

verses.latin: Filii Caath tendebant tentoria sua ad meridianam plagam tabernaculi.
verses.english: The sons of Kohath would pitch their tents on the south side of the Tabernacle.

verses.latin: Et princeps familiarum cognationis Caathitarum, Elisaphan filius Oziel.
verses.english: The chief of the Kohathite households was Elizaphan, son of Uzziel.

verses.latin: Et sub eorum custodia erant arca, et mensa, et candelabrum, altaria, et vasa sanctuarii in quibus ministrant, et velum.
verses.english: Under their care were the Ark, the table of showbread, the lampstand, the altars, the vessels of the sanctuary used for ministry, and the veil (separating the Holy Place from the Holy of Holies).

verses.latin: Et princeps principum Levitarum, Eleazar filius Aaron sacerdotis, qui erat super diligentiam custodum sanctuarii.
verses.english: And the chief of all the Levitical chiefs was Eleazar, son of Aaron the priest. He had oversight over those who were responsible for the sanctuary’s care.

verses.latin: A Merari stirps Moholitarum et Musitarum: hæ sunt familiæ Meraritarum per cognationes suas.
verses.english: From Merari came the clans of the Mahlites and the Mushites. These are the Merarite families according to their clans.

verses.latin: Numerati sunt de masculis ab uno mense et supra, sex millia ducenti.
verses.english: Those counted among the males, from one month old and upward, numbered six thousand two hundred.

verses.latin: Princeps familiarum cognationis Meraritarum, Suriel filius Abihel: hi tendebant tentoria sua ad aquilonem tabernaculi.
verses.english: The chief of the Merarite households was Zuriel, son of Abihail. These would pitch their tents to the north of the Tabernacle.

verses.latin: Et sub custodia eorum erant tabulæ tabernaculi, et vectes, et columnæ, ac bases, et universa vasa ejus atque supellex.
verses.english: Under their care were the frames of the Tabernacle, its bars, its pillars, its bases, and all its associated vessels and furnishings.

verses.latin: Et columnæ atrii per circuitum cum basibus suis, et paxillis, et funibus.
verses.english: Also the pillars of the courtyard all around with their bases, their tent pegs, and their ropes.

verses.latin: Castra Moysi et Aaron ante tabernaculum, id est, ad orientem, tenebant omnes masculi de stirpe Caath, custodientes cœrimonias sanctuarii pro filiis Israël.
verses.english: Moses and Aaron, and the males from the priestly lineage of Kohath (Aaron’s sons), made their camp before the Tabernacle, that is, to the east. They guarded the sacred ceremonies of the sanctuary on behalf of the children of Israel.

verses.latin: Omnes masculi Levitarum quos numeraverunt Moyses et Aaron juxta sermonem Domini per familias suas, ab uno mense et supra, fuerunt viginti duo millia.
verses.english: All the Levite males, whom Moses and Aaron counted according to the word of the Lord, by their families, from one month old and upward, numbered twenty-two thousand.

verses.latin: Et dixit Dominus ad Moysen: Numera primogenita masculorum de filiis Israël, ab uno mense et supra: et habebis summam nominis eorum.
verses.english: And the Lord said to Moses: 'Count all the firstborn males among the children of Israel, from one month old and upward, and you will have the total number of them.'

verses.latin: Tollite summam filiorum Caath de medio Levitarum, per familias et domos suas,
verses.english: Take a census of the sons of Kohath from among the Levites, according to their families and their ancestral houses,

verses.latin: a triginta annis et supra usque ad quinquaginta annos, omnium qui ingrediuntur ut ministrent in tabernaculo fœderis.
verses.english: Count all those from thirty years old and above, up to fifty years old, who are qualified to enter and perform sacred service in the Tabernacle of the Covenant.

verses.latin: Hic est ergo cultus filiorum Caath in tabernaculo fœderis: Sancta sanctorum.
verses.english: This, then, is the sacred duty of the sons of Kohath regarding the Tabernacle of the Covenant: the Holy of Holies.

verses.latin: Ingredientur Aaron et filii ejus, quando movenda sunt castra, et deponent velum, quod ante fores est, et involvent eo arcam testimonii.
verses.english: Aaron and his sons shall enter when the camp is to move. They will take down the veil that is before the entrance, and with it, they will cover the Ark of the Testimony.

verses.latin: Imponentque desuper operimentum hyacinthini coloris, et involvent vectes ejus.
verses.english: On top of the Ark, they will place a covering of blue material, and then they will put the carrying poles through its rings.

verses.latin: Mensam quoque propositionis, et vasa ejus, ac libamenta et scyphos, et crateras ad liba fundenda, velabunt vestimento hyacinthino:
verses.english: They will also cover the table of the showbread—and its items, and its offerings, and its cups, and its bowls for pouring libations—with a blue cloth.

verses.latin: et desuper expandent pallium coccineum, quod rursum tegant operimento pellium hyacinthinarum, et inducent vectes.
verses.english: And over that, they will spread a scarlet covering, which they will then cover with a protective covering of blue skins. Then they will insert its carrying poles.

verses.latin: Tolent et candelabrum luminum cum lucernis et forcipibus et emunctoriis suis, et cunctis vasis olei, quæ ad cultum ejus pertinent.
verses.english: They will also take the lampstand for the lights, along with its lamps, its snuffers, its trays for wicks, and all its oil vessels, which pertain to its sacred service.

verses.latin: Et involvent omnia simul in vestimento hyacinthino, et ponent super currum.
verses.english: They will wrap all these items together in a blue covering and place them on a cart.

verses.latin: Altare aureum, et vestem qua operitur in ministerio, et unctionis oleum, et thus compositionis, et omnia vasa quæ pertinent ad ritum ejus,
verses.english: The golden altar, and the garment with which it is covered during divine service, and the anointing oil, and the incense of composition, and all the vessels that pertain to its ritual,

verses.latin: involent vestimentis hyacinthinis, et superponent currui.
verses.english: they will wrap in blue coverings and place on the cart.

verses.latin: Detrahentque cineres de altari, et involvent illud vestimento purpureo:
verses.english: They will remove the ashes from the altar and then cover it with a purple garment.

verses.latin: et ponent supra cuncta vasa quæ in ministerio ejus sunt, videlicet ignium receptacula, et fuscinulas, atque tridentes, et uncinos, et cribra. Cuncta vasa altaris operient simul operimento pellium hyacinthinarum, et inducent vectes.
verses.english: And they will place over it all the items used in its service: specifically, the fire pans, the meat forks, the three-pronged hooks, the shovels, and the fire baskets. They will cover all the altar's vessels together with a protective covering of blue skins, and then they will insert the carrying poles.

verses.latin: Cumque involverint Aaron et filii ejus sanctuarium et omnia vasa ejus, peractis castrorum itineribus, tunc intrabunt filii Caath ut portent: et non tangant vasa sanctuarii, ne moriantur. Hæc sunt onera filiorum Caath in tabernaculo fœderis.
verses.english: Once Aaron and his sons have finished covering the sanctuary and all its items, as the camp journeys are completed, then the sons of Kohath will enter to carry them. However, they must not touch the items of the sanctuary directly, lest they die. These are the burdens of the sons of Kohath regarding the Tabernacle of the Covenant.

verses.latin: Ad officium Eleazari filii Aaron sacerdotis pertinent, oleum ad concinnandas lucernas, et incensum compositionis, et sacrificium sempiternum, et oleum unctionis, et eorum quæ in tabernaculo sunt, et in universis vasis sanctuarii, custodienda.
verses.english: The duty of Eleazar, son of Aaron the priest, includes the care of the oil for the lamps, and the incense of composition, and the perpetual sacrifice, and the anointing oil. He is responsible for all things within the Tabernacle and all the vessels of the sanctuary.

verses.latin: Et locutus est Dominus ad Moysen et Aaron, dicens:
verses.english: And the Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying:

verses.latin: Nolite perdere multitudinem cognationis Caath de medio Levitarum:
verses.english: Do not allow the multitude of the clan of Kohath to perish from among the Levites.

verses.latin: sed hoc facite eis, ut vivant, et non moriantur, quando propius accedunt ad Sancta sanctorum. Ingrediantur Aaron et filii ejus, et constituant unumquemque in ministerio suo, et in diversis oneribus.
verses.english: Instead, do this for them, so that they may live and not die when they approach the Holy of Holies. Let Aaron and his sons go in and assign each one to his specific sacred service and to his various burdens.

verses.latin: Nec ingrediantur ut videant quæ rite sunt posita in sanctuario, ne moriantur.
verses.english: They must not enter to see the sacred things that are properly arranged in the sanctuary, lest they die.

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Tollite summam et filiorum Gerson quoque, per domos et familias suas,
verses.english: Take a census of the sons of Gershon also, according to their ancestral houses and their families.

verses.latin: a triginta annis et supra usque ad quinquaginta annos, omnium qui ingrediuntur ut ministrent in tabernaculo fœderis.
verses.english: Count all those from thirty years old and above, up to fifty years old, who are qualified to enter and perform sacred service in the Tabernacle of the Covenant.

verses.latin: Hoc est officium familiæ Gersonitarum, ut portetur et custodiatur:
verses.english: This is the duty of the families of the Gershonites: to carry and guard the following:

verses.latin: cortinas tabernaculi, et tabernaculum fœderis, operimentum, et tegumentum exterius hyacinthinum, quod desuper est,
verses.english: the curtains of the Tabernacle, and the Tabernacle of the Covenant itself, the covering for it, and the outer blue protective covering which is placed on top of it,

verses.latin: et aulaea atrii, ac tentorium in introitu ejus, et funes per circuitum, et quidquid ad usum atque cultum pertinet.
verses.english: and the hangings for the courtyard, and the curtain for its entrance, and the ropes all around, and whatever pertains to its use and sacred service.

verses.latin: Juxta imperium Aaron et filiorum ejus, portabunt filii Gerson, et ministrabunt in omnibus, ut nec his liceat pondus portare quod non est jussum.
verses.english: According to the command of Aaron and his sons, the sons of Gershon shall carry and perform sacred service in all these matters. They are not permitted to carry any burden that has not been commanded.

verses.latin: Hoc est officium familiæ Gersonitarum in tabernaculo fœderis: et præfectus eorum Eleazar filius Aaron sacerdotis.
verses.english: This is the duty of the families of the Gershonites in the Tabernacle of the Covenant, and their chief is Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest.

verses.latin: Filios quoque Merari per familias et domos suas enumerabis,
verses.english: You shall also enumerate the sons of Merari according to their families and their ancestral houses.

verses.latin: a triginta annis et supra usque ad quinquaginta annos, omnes qui ingrediuntur ut ministrent in tabernaculo fœderis.
verses.english: Count all those from thirty years old and above, up to fifty years old, all who are qualified to enter and perform sacred service in the Tabernacle of the Covenant.

verses.latin: Hæc sunt onera eorum: tabulæ tabernaculi, et vectes ejus, et columnæ ac bases earum,
verses.english: These are their burdens: the boards of the Tabernacle, and its carrying bars, and its pillars with their bases,

verses.latin: et columnæ atrii per circuitum cum basibus suis, et paxilli, et funes. Cuncta vasa et utensilia tradentur nominatim.
verses.english: and the pillars of the courtyard all around with their bases, and the pegs, and the ropes. All these vessels and utensils shall be delivered by name—meaning, each item will be specifically assigned for carrying.

verses.latin: Hoc est officium familiæ Meraritarum, et ministerium in tabernaculo fœderis: præfectus eorum Ithamar filius Aaron sacerdotis.
verses.english: This is the duty of the families of the Merarites and their sacred service in the Tabernacle of the Covenant. Their chief is Ithamar, the son of Aaron the priest.

verses.latin: Recensuerunt itaque Moyses et Aaron, et principes synagogæ, filios Caath per familias et domos eorum,
verses.english: So Moses and Aaron and the leaders of the assembly took a census of the sons of Kohath, according to their families and their ancestral houses,

verses.latin: a triginta annis et supra usque ad quinquaginta annos, omnium qui ingrediuntur ad ministerium tabernaculi fœderis.
verses.english: counting all those from thirty years old and above, up to fifty years old, who are qualified to enter into the sacred service of the Tabernacle of the Covenant.

verses.latin: Et inventi sunt numero per familias suas, duo millia septingenti quinquaginta.
verses.english: And those found by number, according to their families, were two thousand seven hundred fifty.

verses.latin: Hic est numerus familiarum Caathitarum, omnium qui ministrant in tabernaculo fœderis: quos recensuit Moyses et Aaron juxta imperium Domini per manum Moysi.
verses.english: This is the number of the families of the Kohathites, all who perform sacred service in the Tabernacle of the Covenant, whom Moses and Aaron enumerated according to the command of the Lord through Moses.

verses.latin: Recensiti sunt et filii Gerson per familias et domos suas,
verses.english: The sons of Gershon were also enumerated according to their families and their ancestral houses,

verses.latin: a triginta annis et supra usque ad quinquaginta annos, omnium qui ingrediuntur ut ministrent in tabernaculo fœderis.
verses.english: counting all those from thirty years old and above, up to fifty years old, all who are qualified to enter and perform sacred service in the Tabernacle of the Covenant.

verses.latin: Et inventi sunt numero per familias et domos suas, duo millia sexcenti triginta.
verses.english: And those found by number, according to their families and their ancestral houses, were two thousand six hundred thirty.

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Praecipe filiis Israel, ut ejiciant de castris omnem leprosum, et qui fluit semine, et polutus est super mortuo.
verses.english: “Command the children of Israel to remove from their camp everyone who has a serious skin disease, everyone who has an uncontrolled discharge of fluids, and everyone who has become ritually defiled by touching a dead body.”

verses.latin: Tam masculum quam feminam ejicite de castris, ne polluant castra eorum, cum ego habitem vobiscum.
verses.english: “You must remove both men and women from the camp. This is so they will not ritually defile their camp, since I Myself dwell among them.”

verses.latin: Feceruntque ita filii Israel, et ejecerunt eos extra castra, sicut locutus fuerat Dominus ad Moysen.
verses.english: The children of Israel did exactly this; they expelled those people from the camp, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Loquere filiis Israel: Vir sive mulier cum fecerit de omnibus peccatis quae solent homines committere, et neglecta caerimonia, transgressus fuerit praeceptum Domini:
verses.english: “Speak to the children of Israel: When a man or a woman commits any of the sins that people commonly commit, and thereby acts unfaithfully against the Lord, that person is guilty.

verses.latin: confitebuntur peccatum suum, et reddent id quod per negligentiam ablatum est, addita quinta parte, ei cui fecerant.
verses.english: They must confess the sin they committed. They must repay in full what they took through their wrongdoing, adding a fifth part (20%) to it, and give it to the person they wronged.”

verses.latin: Si non fuerit qui recipiat, reddi debet Domino, et sacerdotis erit, excepta ariete piaculi, qui offertur pro scelere.
verses.english: “But if there is no close relative to receive the repayment, then the payment that is owed must be given to the Lord, and it will belong to the priest, in addition to the ram of atonement offered for that specific offense.”

verses.latin: Omne de primitiis sanctorum, quae offerunt filii Israel sacerdoti, ejus erit.
verses.english: “Every contribution of sacred offerings that the children of Israel bring to the priest will belong to him.

verses.latin: Et quae quisque offert, illius erunt: si quispiam dederit sacerdoti, omnia ejus erunt.
verses.english: And whatever anyone offers, it will be for the priest. Indeed, if anyone gives something to the priest, all of it will belong to him.”

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Loquere filiis Israel, et dices ad eos: Vir cujus uxor, digressa ab eo, concubuerit cum altero,
verses.english: “Speak to the children of Israel, and say to them: If a man’s wife has gone away from him and been intimate with another man,

verses.latin: et vir ejus, propterea quod celata est, et latuit adulterium, scire non potuerit, et nec testis sit, nec convicta:
verses.english: and her husband cannot know about it because the adultery was kept secret and hidden, and there is no witness, and she has not been caught in the act:

verses.latin: si spiritus jurgii, et zelotypiae, commoverit virum contra uxorem suam, quae vel poluta est, vel non:
verses.english: but a spirit of jealousy and contention comes upon the husband, and he suspects his wife, whether she has actually been defiled or not:

verses.latin: adducet eam ad sacerdotem, et offeret pro illa oblationem decimam partem ephi farinae hordei: non fundet super eam oleum, nec ponet thymiama, quia sacrificium zelotypiae est, et oblatio pro scelere, ad probationem adulterii.
verses.english: then the man must bring his wife to the priest, and he must bring an offering for her: a tenth of an ephah of barley flour. He must not pour oil on it nor put frankincense on it, because it is an offering of jealousy, and an offering for a transgression, intended to bring the adultery to light.”

verses.latin: Accipiet igitur sacerdos eam, et statuet coram Domino:
verses.english: “So the priest will take her and present her before the Lord.

verses.latin: et tollet aquam sanctam in vase fictili, et paululum terrae de pavimento tabernaculi mittet in eam.
verses.english: The priest will take holy water in an earthenware vessel and put a little dust from the floor of the tabernacle into it.”

verses.latin: Cumque statuerit mulierem coram Domino, discooperiet caput ejus, et ponet super manus illius sacrificium recordationis, et oblationem zelotypiae: ipse autem tenebit in manu sua aquas amaritudinis, et in maledictionem.
verses.english: “When the priest has presented the woman before the Lord, he will uncover her head and place the offering of remembrance — the offering of jealousy — upon her hands. The priest himself will hold in his hand the bitter waters, which bring a curse.

verses.latin: Et adjurabit eam, et dicet: Si non dormivit tecum vir alienus, et si non polluta es propter relinquit maritum tuum, innocens eris ab aquis istis amaritudinis, et maledictionis.
verses.english: Then the priest will make her swear an oath and say to her: ‘If no other man has been intimate with you, and if you have not been defiled by leaving your husband, then you will be innocent from these bitter waters and the curse they carry.’”

verses.latin: Si autem declinans a viro tuo, polluta es, et concubuisti cum altero:
verses.english: “‘But if you have turned away from your husband and been defiled, and you have been intimate with another man:’

verses.latin: subjiciaris huic maledictioni: det te Dominus in execrationem, et in exemplum omnis populi sui: putrescere faciat femur tuum, et turgeat venter tuus.
verses.english: ‘then you will be subject to this curse: May the Lord make you an object of execration and an example among all your people; may He cause your thigh to waste away and your belly to swell.’

verses.latin: Ut in tumorem venter turgens profiliat, et putrescat femur: Amen, amen.
verses.english: ‘May your belly swell up with a tumor and your thigh rot away.’ And the woman must say, ‘Amen, amen.’

verses.latin: Et scribet sacerdos maledictiones has in libello, et delebit eas aquis amaritudinis.
verses.english: “Then the priest will write these curses in a scroll, and he will wash them into the bitter waters.

verses.latin: Et dabit mulieri bibere. Quae cum biberit, si fuerit polluta, et contempto viro suo, in adulterio deprehensa: tumens venter illius intumescet, et putrescet femur, et erit mulier in execrationem in medio populi sui.
verses.english: And he will give the woman the bitter waters to drink. When she has drunk them, if she is defiled and has been caught in adultery, having scorned her husband: then her belly will swell up, and her thigh will waste away, and the woman will become an object of execration among her people.”

verses.latin: Quod si non fuerit maculata, innoxia erit, et pariet filios.
verses.english: “But if she has not been defiled, she will be unharmed and will be able to bear children.”

verses.latin: Haec est lex zelotypiae: si qua mulier declinans a viro suo fuerit polluta, et vir ejus spiritu zelotypiae concitatus obtulerit eam Domino;
verses.english: “This is the law concerning jealousy: if a woman turns away from her husband and becomes defiled, and her husband, moved by a spirit of jealousy, brings her before the Lord;

verses.latin: et voluerit bibere aquas amaritudinis, et maledictionis, si non polluetur mulier, et inanis erit ab his aquis amaritudinis et maledictionis.
verses.english: —even if she drinks the bitter waters that carry the curse—if the woman is not actually defiled, she will remain unharmed by these bitter waters and their curse.

verses.latin: Quod si fuerit maculata, et in adulterio deprehensa, in tumorem venter ejus intumescet, et putrescet femur: et erit mulier in execrationem in populis suis.
verses.english: But if she has been defiled and caught in adultery, her belly will swell up with a tumor, and her thigh will waste away, and the woman will become an object of execration among her people.

verses.latin: Haec est lex zelotypiae, quae continet virum, si zelotypiae spiritu fuerit concitatus contra uxorem suam:
verses.english: This is the law of jealousy, which applies to a husband if he is stirred by a spirit of jealousy against his wife,

verses.latin: aut mulierem, si declinans a viro suo polluta fuerit:
verses.english: or if a woman turns away from her husband and becomes defiled.

verses.latin: et offeret vir uxorem suam sacerdoti, quae statim bibit aquas maledictionis, et non peccabit.
verses.english: Then the man will present his wife to the priest, and she will immediately drink the waters of the curse, and if she is innocent, she will not be found guilty of the sin.”

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen dicens:
verses.english: Then the Lord God spoke to Moses and said:

verses.latin: Loquere filiis Israël et dices ad eos: Vir sive mulier cum votum fecerit ut consecretur et se voverit Domino,
verses.english: “Speak to the children of Israel and say to them: If any man or woman makes a special vow to dedicate themselves to the Lord through a Nazirite vow,

verses.latin: ab omni vino et quod inebriare potest abstinebunt: aceti ex vino et ex qualibet alia potione non bibent, et quidquid ex uva exprimitur, non comedent: uvas recentes siccasque non vescentur
verses.english: they must completely separate themselves from wine and strong drink. They must not drink vinegar made from wine or from strong drink. They must not drink any juice pressed from grapes, and they must not eat fresh grapes or dried grapes. This is a total abstinence from anything made from the vine.

verses.latin: cunctis diebus quibus consecratus est Domino: quidquid ex vite nasci potest, ab uva usque ad acinum, non comedent.
verses.english: For the entire duration of their Nazirite consecration to the Lord, they must not eat anything that comes from the grapevine, from the seeds to the skin.

verses.latin: Omni tempore quo voverit se, novacula non transibit super caput ejus: donec impleantur dies consecrationis ejus et Domino consecretur, sanctus erit, et comam capitis nutriet.
verses.english: During the entire time of their vow, no razor is to touch their head. They are to remain holy by growing out the hair of their head, until the days of their dedication to the Lord are completed.

verses.latin: Omni tempore consecrationis suæ, ad mortuum non introibit:
verses.english: For the entire period of their consecration, they must not go near a dead body.

verses.latin: nec super patrem et matrem et fratres et sorores, si mortui fuerint, contaminabitur: quia consecratio Dei sui super caput ejus est.
verses.english: They must not make themselves unclean, even if their father, mother, brother, or sister dies. This is because the mark of their God’s consecration is upon their head, making them especially sacred.

verses.latin: Cunctis diebus separationis suæ, sanctus erit Domino.
verses.english: Throughout the entire time of their separation for the Lord, they are to be holy to the Lord God.

verses.latin: Si quis subito et ex imprudente conscientia mortuus fuerit juxta eum, polluetur caput consecrationis ejus: et in eodem die purgationis suæ radi debet caput.
verses.english: If someone unexpectedly and accidentally dies next to them, the consecrated head of the Nazirite becomes defiled. On the day of their purification, they must shave their head.

verses.latin: Et in octava die offeret duos turtures, aut duos pullos columbæ sacerdoti in introitu tabernaculi testimonii.
verses.english: On the eighth day, they must bring two turtledoves or two young pigeons to the priest at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.

verses.latin: Facietque sacerdos unum pro peccato, et alterum in holocaustum, et orabit pro eo, pro peccato quod commisit super mortuo: sanctificabitque caput ejus in die illo.
verses.english: The priest will then offer one bird as a sacrifice for sin and the other as a burnt offering. The priest will make atonement for them, for the sin they committed by being near the dead person, and on that day, the priest will reconsecrate their head.

verses.latin: Et consecrabit Domino dies separationis suæ, offerens agnum anniculum pro peccato: dies autem priores irriti fient, quoniam polluta est consecratio ejus.
verses.english: They must then rededicate their days of separation to the Lord and offer a male lamb in its first year as a sin offering. All the previous days of their vow are invalidated, because their consecration was defiled.

verses.latin: Ista est lex Nazaræi: Cum fuerint impleti dies consecrationis ejus, adducetur ad ostium tabernaculi testimonii,
verses.english: “This is the law for the Nazirite: When the days of their consecration are completed, they must be brought to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting,

verses.latin: et offeret oblationes suas Domino: agnum anniculum immaculatum in holocaustum, et ovem anniculam immaculatam pro peccato, et arietem immaculatum hostiam pacificam:
verses.english: and they must offer their sacrifices to the Lord: a male lamb in its first year, without blemish, for a burnt offering; a female lamb in its first year, without blemish, for a sin offering; and one ram, without blemish, for a peace offering.

verses.latin: canistrum quoque panum azymorum, qui conspersi sint oleo, et lagana absque fermento uncta oleo: et libamenta singulorum.
verses.english: Also, a basket of unleavened bread made with fine flour mixed with oil, and unleavened wafers spread with oil, along with their grain offerings and drink offerings.

verses.latin: Quæ offeret sacerdos coram Domino, et faciet tam pro peccato quam in holocaustum.
verses.english: The priest will present these offerings before the Lord, performing the sin offering and the burnt offering first.

verses.latin: Arietem vero immolabit Domino hostiam pacificam, offerens simul canistrum azymorum, et libamenta quæ ex more debentur.
verses.english: The priest will then sacrifice the ram as a peace offering to the Lord, along with the basket of unleavened bread, and its accompanying grain offerings and drink offerings as is customary.

verses.latin: Tunc radetur Nazaræus ante ostium tabernaculi testimonii cincinnos capilli sui, et accipiet capillos consecrationis suæ, et ponet super ignem, qui est subter immolata pacifica.
verses.english: Then the Nazirite will shave off the hair of their consecrated head at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting. They will take the shaved hair, which is a sign of their consecration, and put it on the fire that is under the peace offering.

verses.latin: Tollitque sacerdos armum coctum arietis, et placentam unam absque fermento de canistro, et laganum unum azymum, et ponet super manus Nazaræi, postquam rasum fuerit caput ejus.
verses.english: The priest will take a boiled shoulder of the ram, one unleavened cake from the basket, and one unleavened wafer, and place them on the hands of the Nazirite after their head has been shaved.

verses.latin: Et elevabit ea sacerdos coram Domino: et sanctificata sacerdotis erunt, sicut pectusculum consecratum et armus separatus: post hæc potest bibere Nazaræus vinum.
verses.english: The priest will wave these offerings before the Lord; they are a holy portion for the priest, just like the consecrated breast and the separated thigh are. After this ritual, the Nazirite is permitted to drink wine again.

verses.latin: Hæc est lex Nazaræi, cum voverit oblationem suam Domino, et capillos capitis sui: absque his quæ invenire poterit manus ejus: juxta votum quod mente decreverit, ita faciet ad consecrationem suam.
verses.english: “This is the law for the Nazirite concerning their vow and their offerings to the Lord, including the hair of their head. This is what they must offer, beyond what their means allow. According to the vow they have thoughtfully made, so they must carry out their consecration.”

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen dicens:
verses.english: Then the Lord God spoke to Moses and said:

verses.latin: Loquere Aaron et filiis ejus: Sic benedicetis filiis Israël, et dicetis eis:
verses.english: “Speak to Aaron and his sons, instructing them on how to bless the children of Israel. Say to them:

verses.latin: Benedicat tibi Dominus, et custodiat te.
verses.english: May the Lord God bless you and keep watch over you.

verses.latin: Ostendat Dominus faciem suam tibi, et misereatur tui.
verses.english: May the Lord God make His face shine upon you and be gracious to you.

verses.latin: Convertat Dominus vultum suum ad te, et det tibi pacem.
verses.english: May the Lord God lift up His countenance upon you and give you true peace.

verses.latin: Invocabuntque nomen meum super filios Israël, et ego benedicam eis.
verses.english: This is how they will invoke My name over the children of Israel, and I, the Lord God, will personally bless them.”

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen postquam complevit omne præceptum ejus dicens:
verses.english: Then the Lord God spoke to Moses after He had finished all His commands, saying:

verses.latin: Hæc est oblatio ducum Israël in die qua dedicatum est altare, ut ungeretur. Duodecim plaustra curruum, et duodecim boves, singula plaustra bovem unum, et singuli duces bovem unum.
verses.english: “This is the offering of the leaders of Israel on the day the altar was dedicated and anointed for its sacred purpose. They brought twelve carts, twelve oxen—one ox for each cart, and one ox for each leader.

verses.latin: Et obtulerunt ea coram Domino.
verses.english: And they presented these offerings before the Lord God.

verses.latin: Dixitque Dominus ad Moysen: Accipe ea ab eis, et erunt in ministerium tabernaculi testimonii, dabisque ea Levitis juxta ministerium uniuscujusque.
verses.english: Then the Lord God said to Moses: 'Accept these from them, and they are to be used for the service of the Tent of Meeting. You are to give them to the Levites, according to each one’s specific service.'

verses.latin: Igitur accepit Moyses plaustra et boves, et tradidit Levitis.
verses.english: So Moses received the carts and the oxen, and he gave them to the Levites.

verses.latin: Duo plaustra et quatuor boves dedit filiis Gerson juxta ministerium eorum.
verses.english: He gave two carts and four oxen to the sons of Gershon, for their specific duties.

verses.latin: Quatuor plaustra et octo boves dedit filiis Merari juxta ministerium uniuscujusque.
verses.english: He gave four carts and eight oxen to the sons of Merari, for their specific duties.

verses.latin: Filiis vero Caath nihil dedit: quia ipsi portabant sanctuarium absque plaustris et bobus.
verses.english: But to the sons of Kohath he gave no carts or oxen, because their duty was to carry the holy things of the sanctuary on their shoulders, without any vehicles.

verses.latin: Igitur obtulerunt duces ad dedicationem altaris in die qua unctum est.
verses.english: Therefore, the leaders brought these offerings for the dedication of the altar on the very day it was anointed.

verses.latin: Obtulit princeps Juda Naasson filius Aminadab oblationem suam in die primo.
verses.english: On the first day, Nahshon, son of Amminadab, the leader of the tribe of Judah, presented his offering.

verses.latin: Et fuit oblatio ejus: phiala argentea pondo centum triginta siclos, urceolus argenteus septuaginta siclis, ad pondus sanctuarii, utrumque plenum simila conspersa oleo in sacrificium:
verses.english: His offering consisted of: one silver plate weighing one hundred and thirty shekels, and one silver basin weighing seventy shekels, according to the holy sanctuary standard. Both were filled with fine flour mixed with oil, as a grain offering.

verses.latin: mortariolum aureum decem siclorum plenum incenso:
verses.english: Also, one small gold pan, weighing ten shekels, full of incense.

verses.latin: bos unus de armento, aries unus, agnus anniculus in holocaustum.
verses.english: And for a burnt offering: one young bull from the herd, one ram, and one male lamb in its first year.

verses.latin: Factum est autem in die qua complevit Moyses tabernaculum, et erexit illud, et unxit, et sanctificavit omnia vasa ejus in unctione,
verses.english: It came to pass on the very day when Moses completed the Tabernacle, and set it up, and consecrated it with oil, and made all its sacred vessels holy by anointing them,

verses.latin: obtulerunt principes Israel, et duces familiarum, qui erant super singulos, et super recensitos.
verses.english: the tribal leaders of Israel, who were the heads of their ancestral houses and in charge of the numbered men, brought their offerings.

verses.latin: Oblationes eorum coram Domino sex plaustra tecta, et duodecim boves: duo principes unum plaustrum, et bovem singuli, singulisque tradiderunt levitis.
verses.english: Their offerings before the Lord were six covered wagons and twelve oxen. Two of the tribal leaders offered one wagon, and each leader offered one ox, and they handed them over to the Levites, with each Levite family receiving a portion.

verses.latin: Dixitque Dominus ad Moysen:
verses.english: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Suscipe ab eis, et erunt in ministerio tabernaculi testimonii, dabisque ea levitis, unicuique secundum ministerium suum.
verses.english: 'Receive these offerings from them, because they will be used for the service of the Tabernacle of the Testimony. You shall give them to the Levites, to each group according to their specific duty.'

verses.latin: Tulit ergo Moyses plaustra et boves, et tradidit levitis.
verses.english: So Moses took the wagons and the oxen, and he handed them over to the Levites.

verses.latin: Duas plaustra, et quatuor boves, dedit filiis Gerson, juxta ministerium eorum.
verses.english: He gave two wagons and four oxen to the sons of Gershon, according to the requirements of their service.

verses.latin: Quatuor plaustra, et octo boves dedit filiis Merari, juxta ministerium eorum, sub manu Ithamar filii Aaron sacerdotis.
verses.english: And he gave four wagons and eight oxen to the sons of Merari, according to the requirements of their service, under the direct supervision of Ithamar, the son of Aaron the priest.

verses.latin: Filiis autem Caath nihil dedit: quia ad eos pertinebant sancta sanctorum, quae humeris portabant.
verses.english: But to the sons of Kohath, he gave no wagons or oxen; for it was their duty to carry the most holy objects of the Tabernacle on their shoulders.

verses.latin: Obtulerunt ergo principes in dedicationem altaris, in die qua unctum est.
verses.english: Therefore, the tribal leaders brought their offerings for the dedication of the altar on the very day it was consecrated.

verses.latin: Dixitque Dominus ad Moysen: Singuli principes, singulis diebus offerant munera ad dedicationem altaris.
verses.english: And the Lord said to Moses, 'Each tribal leader shall bring his dedication offering for the altar on a separate day.'

verses.latin: Obtulit ergo in die prima, Naasson filius Aminadab de tribu Juda.
verses.english: So, on the first day, Nahshon, the son of Amminadab from the tribe of Judah, brought his offering.

verses.latin: Oblatioque ejus fuit: patella argentea unius sicli pondere, habens in se centum triginta siclos, phiala argentea septuaginta siclorum juxta pondus sanctuarii, plena simila conspersa oleo in sacrificium, et thure.
verses.english: His offering consisted of: a silver dish weighing one hundred and thirty shekels (measured by the sanctuary standard), and a silver bowl weighing seventy shekels, according to the same sanctuary standard. Both vessels were filled with fine flour mixed with oil for the grain offering, along with frankincense.

verses.latin: Cochlear aureum decem siclorum, plenum thure.
verses.english: Also, a golden spoon weighing ten shekels, filled with frankincense.

verses.latin: Hircum de capris pro peccato.
verses.english: And a male goat for the sin offering.

verses.latin: Boves duos, arietem unum, agnos anniculos quinque, pro hostia pacifica. Haec est oblatio Naasson filii Aminadab.
verses.english: Two oxen, one ram, and five one-year-old male lambs for the peace offering. This was the entire offering from Nahshon, the son of Amminadab.

verses.latin: In die secunda obtulit Nathanael filius Suar de tribu Issachar.
verses.english: On the second day, Nathanael, the son of Zuar from the tribe of Issachar, brought his offering.

verses.latin: Obtulit in muneribus suis patellam argenteam unius sicli pondere, habentem in se centum triginta siclos, phialam argenteam septuaginta siclorum juxta pondus sanctuarii, plenam simila conspersa oleo in sacrificium, et thure.
verses.english: His offering consisted of: a silver dish weighing one hundred and thirty shekels (measured by the sanctuary standard), and a silver bowl weighing seventy shekels, according to the same sanctuary standard. Both vessels were filled with fine flour mixed with oil for the grain offering, along with frankincense.

verses.latin: Cochlear aureum decem siclorum, plenum thure.
verses.english: Also, a golden spoon weighing ten shekels, filled with frankincense.

verses.latin: Hircum de capris pro peccato.
verses.english: And a male goat for the sin offering.

verses.latin: Boves duos, arietem unum, agnos anniculos quinque, pro hostia pacifica. Haec est oblatio Nathanael filii Suar.
verses.english: Two oxen, one ram, and five one-year-old male lambs for the peace offering. This was the entire offering from Nathanael, the son of Zuar.

verses.latin: In die tertia princeps filiorum Zabulon, Eliab filius Helon.
verses.english: On the third day, Eliab, the son of Helon and leader of the sons of Zebulun, brought his offering.

verses.latin: Obtulit in muneribus suis patellam argenteam unius sicli pondere, habentem in se centum triginta siclos, phialam argenteam septuaginta siclorum juxta pondus sanctuarii, plenam simila conspersa oleo in sacrificium, et thure.
verses.english: His offering consisted of: a silver dish weighing one hundred and thirty shekels (measured by the sanctuary standard), and a silver bowl weighing seventy shekels, according to the same sanctuary standard. Both vessels were filled with fine flour mixed with oil for the grain offering, along with frankincense.

verses.latin: Cochlear aureum decem siclorum, plenum thure.
verses.english: Also, a golden spoon weighing ten shekels, filled with frankincense.

verses.latin: Hircum de capris pro peccato.
verses.english: And a male goat for the sin offering.

verses.latin: Boves duos, arietem unum, agnos anniculos quinque, pro hostia pacifica. Haec est oblatio Eliab filii Helon.
verses.english: Two oxen, one ram, and five one-year-old male lambs for the peace offering. This was the entire offering from Eliab, the son of Helon.

verses.latin: In die quarta princeps filiorum Ruben, Elizur filius Sedeur.
verses.english: On the fourth day, Elizur, the son of Shedeur and leader of the sons of Reuben, brought his offering.

verses.latin: Obtulit in muneribus suis patellam argenteam unius sicli pondere, habentem in se centum triginta siclos, phialam argenteam septuaginta siclorum juxta pondus sanctuarii, plenam simila conspersa oleo in sacrificium, et thure.
verses.english: His offering consisted of: a silver dish weighing one hundred and thirty shekels (measured by the sanctuary standard), and a silver bowl weighing seventy shekels, according to the same sanctuary standard. Both vessels were filled with fine flour mixed with oil for the grain offering, along with frankincense.

verses.latin: Cochlear aureum decem siclorum, plenum thure.
verses.english: Also, a golden spoon weighing ten shekels, filled with frankincense.

verses.latin: Hircum de capris pro peccato.
verses.english: And a male goat for the sin offering.

verses.latin: Boves duos, arietem unum, agnos anniculos quinque, pro hostia pacifica. Haec est oblatio Elizur filii Sedeur.
verses.english: Two oxen, one ram, and five one-year-old male lambs for the peace offering. This was the entire offering from Elizur, the son of Shedeur.

verses.latin: In die quinta princeps filiorum Simeon, Salumiel filius Surisaddai.
verses.english: On the fifth day, Shelumiel, the son of Zurishaddai and leader of the sons of Simeon, brought his offering.

verses.latin: Obtulit in muneribus suis patellam argenteam unius sicli pondere, habentem in se centum triginta siclos, phialam argenteam septuaginta siclorum juxta pondus sanctuarii, plenam simila conspersa oleo in sacrificium, et thure.
verses.english: His offering consisted of: a silver dish weighing one hundred and thirty shekels (measured by the sanctuary standard), and a silver bowl weighing seventy shekels, according to the same sanctuary standard. Both vessels were filled with fine flour mixed with oil for the grain offering, along with frankincense.

verses.latin: Cochlear aureum decem siclorum, plenum thure.
verses.english: Also, a golden spoon weighing ten shekels, filled with frankincense.

verses.latin: Hircum de capris pro peccato.
verses.english: And a male goat for the sin offering.

verses.latin: Boves duos, arietem unum, agnos anniculos quinque, pro hostia pacifica. Haec est oblatio Salumiel filii Surisaddai.
verses.english: Two oxen, one ram, and five one-year-old male lambs for the peace offering. This was the entire offering from Shelumiel, the son of Zurishaddai.

verses.latin: In die sexta princeps filiorum Gad, Eliasaph filius Duel.
verses.english: On the sixth day, Eliasaph, the son of Deuel and leader of the sons of Gad, brought his offering.

verses.latin: Obtulit in muneribus suis patellam argenteam unius sicli pondere, habentem in se centum triginta siclos, phialam argenteam septuaginta siclorum juxta pondus sanctuarii, plenam simila conspersa oleo in sacrificium, et thure.
verses.english: His offering consisted of: a silver dish weighing one hundred and thirty shekels (measured by the sanctuary standard), and a silver bowl weighing seventy shekels, according to the same sanctuary standard. Both vessels were filled with fine flour mixed with oil for the grain offering, along with frankincense.

verses.latin: Cochlear aureum decem siclorum plenum thure, hircum de capris pro peccato.
verses.english: Also, a golden spoon weighing ten shekels, filled with frankincense; and a male goat for the sin offering.

verses.latin: Boves duos, arietem unum, agnos anniculos quinque pro hostia pacifica. Haec est oblatio Eliasaph filii Duel.
verses.english: Two oxen, one ram, and five one-year-old male lambs for the peace offering. This was the entire offering from Eliasaph, the son of Deuel.

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: The Lord then spoke to Moses, giving him these instructions:

verses.latin: Loquere Aaron et dices ad eum: Quando accenderis lucernas, contra faciem candelabri septem lucernae lucebunt.
verses.english: “Tell Aaron these instructions: When you prepare the lamps in the Tabernacle, make sure that the light from the seven lamps shines forward, illuminating the area directly in front of the lampstand.”

verses.latin: Fecitque Aaron ita: et contra faciem candelabri accendit lucernas, sicut praeceperat Dominus Moysi.
verses.english: Aaron carried out these instructions. He lit the lamps on the lampstand so that they faced forward and illuminated the area in front of it, exactly as the Lord had commanded Moses.

verses.latin: Haec est factura candelabri, ex auro ductile, tam basis quam calami, omnia opera excisa. Juxta exemplar quod ostenderat Dominus Moysi, ita fabricatus est candelabrum.
verses.english: This is how the lampstand was made: it was hammered out of pure gold, both its base and its branches, all of it with intricate carved work. The lampstand was crafted exactly according to the design that the Lord had shown to Moses.

verses.latin: Et locutus est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: The Lord then spoke to Moses, giving him further instructions:

verses.latin: Tolle Levitas de medio filiorum Israel, et purificabis eos.
verses.english: “Take the Levites from among all the people of Israel and purify them through a ritual cleansing.

verses.latin: Juxta hunc ritum purificabis eos: aspergatur aqua purificationis super eos, et radant omnes pilos carnis suae; cumque laverint vestimenta sua, et mundati fuerint,
verses.english: You shall purify them according to this ritual: sprinkle the water of purification upon them. They must shave off all the hair on their bodies; then they are to wash their clothes and cleanse themselves completely.

verses.latin: tollant vitulum de armento, et sacrificium ejus similam oleo conspersam; et vitulum alterum accipies pro peccato.
verses.english: After this, they are to bring a young bull from the herd, along with its grain offering of fine flour mixed with oil. You are also to take another young bull as a sin offering for them.

verses.latin: Applicabisque Levitas coram tabernaculo testimonii, omnemque multitudinem filiorum Israel convocabis.
verses.english: You are to bring the Levites before the Tabernacle of the Testimony, and then you are to assemble the entire community of the people of Israel.

verses.latin: Cumque admoveris Levitas coram Domino, ponent filii Israel manus suas super eos:
verses.english: When you present the Levites before the Lord, all the people of Israel shall lay their hands upon them, dedicating them.

verses.latin: et offerent Aaron Levitas in munus Domini a filiis Israel, ut serviant mihi in famulatu suo.
verses.english: Aaron shall then present the Levites before the Lord as a special wave offering from the people of Israel, so that the Levites may perform their service for Me in the Tabernacle.

verses.latin: Levitae quoque ponent manus suas super capita vitulorum, e quibus unum facies pro peccato, et alterum in holocaustum Domini, ad deprecandum pro eis.
verses.english: The Levites, in turn, are to lay their hands on the heads of the young bulls. One bull is to be offered as a sin offering, and the other as a burnt offering to the Lord, to make atonement for the Levites.

verses.latin: Statuesque Levitas in conspectu Aaron et filiorum ejus, et consecrabis hostias Domino.
verses.english: You are to present the Levites before Aaron and his sons, and then you will consecrate them as a special offering to the Lord.

verses.latin: Et separabis Levitas de medio filiorum Israel, ut sint mei.
verses.english: Thus, you will separate the Levites from among the rest of the people of Israel, so that the Levites will be exclusively Mine.

verses.latin: Post haec ingredientur tabernaculum testimonii, ut ministrent mihi. Sic purificabis et consecrabis eos in oblationem Domini; quoniam dati sunt mihi ultra de medio filiorum Israel.
verses.english: After these rituals, the Levites may enter the Tabernacle of the Testimony to serve Me. You are to purify and consecrate them in this manner as a special offering to the Lord, because they have been given to Me as a unique possession from among the people of Israel.

verses.latin: Pro primogenitis cunctis quae aperiunt omnes vulvas in Israel, accepi eos.
verses.english: I have accepted them as a replacement for all the firstborn among the people of Israel, for every first male child that opens the womb.

verses.latin: Mea sunt enim omnia primogenita filiorum Israel, tam hominum quam jumentorum. Ex die quo percussi omne primogenitum in terra Aegypti, sanctificavi eos mihi:
verses.english: For all the firstborn among the people of Israel are Mine, both of humans and animals. From the day I struck down every firstborn in the land of Egypt, I set them apart as holy for Myself.

verses.latin: et sumpsi Levitas pro cunctis primogenitis filiorum Israel,
verses.english: And now, I have taken the Levites as substitutes for all the firstborn of the people of Israel.

verses.latin: tradidique eos Aaron et filiis ejus, ut serviant mihi pro filiis Israel in tabernaculo foederis, et orent pro eis, nequaquam oriatur plaga in populo, si ausi fuerint accedere ad Sanctuarium.
verses.english: I have given the Levites to Aaron and his sons as a special gift, so that they may perform service for Me on behalf of the people of Israel in the Tabernacle of the Covenant. They are also to make atonement and pray for the people, so that no plague may strike the community if any Israelite should presumptuously approach the Sanctuary without authorization.”

verses.latin: Fecerunt ergo Moyses et Aaron, et omnis multitudo filiorum Israel, super Levitas cuncta quae praeceperat Dominus Moysi.
verses.english: So Moses and Aaron, and the entire community of the people of Israel, performed all these instructions concerning the Levites, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.

verses.latin: Purificati sunt Levitae, et laverunt vestimenta sua; et obtulit Aaron eos coram Domino, orans pro eis.
verses.english: The Levites underwent purification and washed their clothes. Aaron then presented them before the Lord as an offering, making atonement for them.

verses.latin: Post haec intraverunt, ut ministrarent in tabernaculo testimonii coram Aaron et filiis ejus, sicut praeceperat Dominus Moysi super Levitas.
verses.english: After this, the Levites began their service in the Tabernacle of the Testimony before Aaron and his sons, exactly as the Lord had commanded Moses concerning the Levites.

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: The Lord then spoke to Moses, giving him further instructions:

verses.latin: Hoc est lex Levitarum: a viginti quinque annis et supra, ingredientur ut ministrent in tabernaculo foederis.
verses.english: “This is the law for the Levites: from twenty-five years of age and older, they shall begin their service and perform duties in the Tabernacle of the Covenant.

verses.latin: Et cum quinquaginta annos aetatis impleverint, non ultra ministrabunt, et in opere cessabunt.
verses.english: But when they reach fifty years of age, they shall no longer serve actively, and they will cease from their regular work.

verses.latin: Sed coadjutores erunt fratrum suorum in tabernaculo testimonii, custodiendi ea quae sibi commissa fuerint; opera tantum facient, ut non ministrent. Sic facies Levitis in custodiis suis.”
verses.english: However, they may assist their younger brothers in the Tabernacle of the Testimony, helping to guard what has been entrusted to them. They shall only perform duties of oversight, but they are not to perform the active service of the Tabernacle itself. This is how you are to regulate the Levites concerning their assigned duties and responsibilities.”

verses.latin: et locutus est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: The Lord then spoke to Moses, giving him instructions:

verses.latin: Loquere filiis Israel, et dices ad eos: Cum ingressi fueritis terram habitationis vestrae, quam ego dabo vobis,
verses.english: “Speak to the people of Israel and tell them: When you enter the land where you will dwell, which I am giving to you,

verses.latin: et feceritis oblationem Domini in holocaustum aut victimam, vota solventes aut sponte offerentes, sive in solemnitatibus vestris, ut faciatis odorem suavitatis Domino ex bubus vel ovibus:
verses.english: and you present an offering to the Lord—whether a burnt offering or a sacrifice, fulfilling vows or making a voluntary offering, or during your appointed festivals—to create a pleasing aroma to the Lord from cattle or sheep:

verses.latin: qui immolabit hostiam pacificorum, offeret simul et sacrificium, id est, decimam partem ephi similae oleo conspersae, quae habeat quartam partem hin.
verses.english: Whoever offers a peace offering must also present a grain offering with it. This grain offering must be one-tenth of an ephah of fine flour mixed with one-quarter of a hin of oil.

verses.latin: Et vinum ad liba fundenda, ejusdem mensurae dabit quantum et olei.
verses.english: And for the drink offering, they are to provide wine in the same measure as the oil, one-quarter of a hin.

verses.latin: De singulis ovibus et arietibus, et hircis, et vitulis, et bubalis, et cunctis quae immolantur:
