verses.english: This applies to each individual sheep, ram, goat, calf, and ox, and all other animals that are offered as sacrifices.

verses.latin: juxta multitudinem victimarum, simila aeque dabitur et vinum ad liba.
verses.english: According to the number of sacrificial animals, the same proportion of fine flour and wine for the drink offerings shall be given for each one.

verses.latin: Omnis indigena et peregrinus, qui habitat vobiscum, eodem ritu faciet.
verses.english: Every native-born Israelite and every foreigner who lives among you shall perform these rituals according to the same law.

verses.latin: Unum erit judicium tam vobis quam advenis, et eadem statuta.
verses.english: There shall be one law for you and for the resident foreigner, and the same ordinances shall apply to all.

verses.latin: Et locutus est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: The Lord then spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Loquere filiis Israel, et dices ad eos: Cum ingressi fueritis terram Chanaan, et comederitis de panibus terrae illius,
verses.english: “Speak to the people of Israel and tell them: When you enter the land of Canaan, and you eat from the food of that land,

verses.latin: tollere primitias ciborum vestrorum Domino.
verses.english: you are to set aside the first portion of your dough as an offering to the Lord.

verses.latin: De primitiis ciborum vestrorum, sicut de areis vestris, sic dabitis Domino.
verses.english: From the first of your dough, just as you give a portion from your threshing floors, so too shall you give an offering to the Lord.

verses.latin: Primitias ciborum dabitis Domino in generationibus vestris.
verses.english: You are to present this first portion of your dough as an offering to the Lord throughout all your generations.”

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen in deserto Sinai, anno secundo, postquam egressi sunt de terra Ægypti, mense primo, dicens:
verses.english: The Lord spoke to Moses in the Sinai desert, in the first month of the second year after the Israelites had left the land of Egypt, saying this to him:

verses.latin: Facite filii Israel Pascha in tempore suo:
verses.english: “You, the children of Israel, are to keep the Passover at its proper time.

verses.latin: quarta decima die mensis hujus, juxta omnes cæremonias et justitias ejus.
verses.english: You must do this on the fourteenth day of that same month, following all of its proper ceremonies and legal requirements.”

verses.latin: Præcepit ergo Moyses filiis Israel ut facerent Pascha.
verses.english: So Moses commanded the children of Israel to keep the Passover.

verses.latin: Qui fecerunt in deserto Sinai, quarta decima die mensis primi, vespere, juxta omnia quæ mandaverat Dominus Moysi: ita fecerunt filii Israel.
verses.english: They kept it in the Sinai desert on the fourteenth day of the first month, in the evening. The children of Israel did everything exactly as the Lord had commanded Moses.

verses.latin: Ecce autem quidam erant immundi super animam hominis, et non poterant facere Pascha in die suo: accedentes ad Moysen et Aaron
verses.english: However, some men were ritually unclean because they had touched a dead body, and so they were not able to keep the Passover on its designated day. These men came to Moses and Aaron,

verses.latin: dixerunt: Immundi sumus super animam hominis: quare fraudamur ut non offeramus oblationem Domino in tempore suo inter filios Israel?
verses.english: and they said: “We are unclean because we touched a dead body. Why should we be prevented from offering the Lord’s sacrifice at its proper time, along with the rest of the children of Israel?”

verses.latin: Quibus respondit Moyses: State, ut consulam quid jubeat Dominus de vobis.
verses.english: Moses answered them: “Wait here so I can consult the Lord to see what He commands about your situation.”

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Loquere filiis Israel: Homo, qui fuerit immundus super animam, sive in via procul in gente vestra, faciat Pascha Domino:
verses.english: “Speak to the children of Israel and tell them: If any man among you, or among your descendants, becomes unclean by touching a dead body, or if he is far away on a journey, he may still keep the Passover for the Lord.

verses.latin: mense secundo, quarta decima die mensis, vespere, cum azymis et lactucis agrestibus comedent illud:
verses.english: He shall keep it in the second month, on the fourteenth day of that month, in the evening. They must eat it with unleavened bread and bitter herbs.

verses.latin: non relinquent ex eo quidquam usque mane, nec os ejus confringent: omnia cæremonias Paschæ observabunt.
verses.english: They must not leave any of it until morning, nor break any of its bones. They must observe all the ceremonies of the Passover exactly as prescribed.

verses.latin: Si quis autem et mundus fuerit, et in via non fuerit, et tamen non fecerit Pascha, interibit anima illa de populis suis: quia sacrificium Domino non obtulit in tempore suo, peccatum suum portabit ille homo.
verses.english: But if a man is clean and is not on a journey, and still fails to keep the Passover, that person will be cut off from his people. Because he did not offer the Lord’s sacrifice at its proper time, that man will bear the guilt of his sin.

verses.latin: Peregrinus quoque et advena, si fuerit apud vos, faciet Pascha Domino juxta cæremonias et justitias ejus. Idem præceptum erit vobis tam advenæ quam indigenæ terræ.
verses.english: If a resident foreigner or a temporary visitor among you desires to keep the Passover for the Lord, he must do so according to its ceremonies and legal requirements. You shall have the same law for both the resident foreigner and the native-born person.”

verses.latin: Igitur die qua erectum est tabernaculum, operuit illud nubes. Et a vespere usque mane super tabernaculum erat quasi species ignis.
verses.english: Now, on the day the Tabernacle was set up, a cloud covered it. And from evening until morning, there appeared over the Tabernacle something like the appearance of fire.

verses.latin: Sicque contigit jugiter: per diem operiebat illud nubes, et per noctem quasi species ignis.
verses.english: This is how it remained continuously: by day, the cloud covered it, and by night, it had the appearance of fire.

verses.latin: Et quando recedebat nubes quæ erat super tabernaculum, tunc proficiscebantur filii Israel: et in loco quocumque stetisset nubes, ibi castrametabantur.
verses.english: Whenever the cloud that was over the Tabernacle moved away, then the children of Israel would set out on their journey. And wherever the cloud settled, there they would set up their camp.

verses.latin: Ad imperium Domini proficiscebantur, et ad imperium illius figebant tabernacula. Cunctis diebus quibus stabat nubes super tabernaculum, manebant in eodem loco:
verses.english: At the Lord’s command they would set out, and at His command they would pitch their tents. As long as the cloud remained over the Tabernacle, they stayed in that same place.

verses.latin: si moraretur desuper dies multos, filii Israel custodiebant mandata Domini, et non proficiscebantur.
verses.english: If the cloud stayed over it for many days, the children of Israel observed the Lord’s command and did not move on.

verses.latin: Si paucis diebus fuisset super illud, ad imperium Domini manebant, et ad imperium illius proficiscebantur.
verses.english: If the cloud was over it for only a few days, they remained at the Lord’s command, and at His command they would set out.

verses.latin: Si ab vespere usque mane stetisset nubes, et statim mane abiisset, proficiscebantur: aut si post diem et noctem recessisset, sequentes movebant castra.
verses.english: If the cloud remained from evening until morning, and then departed in the morning, they would set out. Or if it departed after a day and a night, they would move their camp by following it.

verses.latin: Si dies duos, aut mensis unius, vel diuturnioris temporis morata fuisset super tabernaculum, manebant filii Israel in eodem loco, et non proficiscebantur: statim ut recessisset, movebant castra.
verses.english: Whether the cloud stayed over the Tabernacle for two days, or a month, or a longer period of time, the children of Israel remained in the same place and did not move on. But as soon as it departed, they would move their camp.

verses.latin: Per verbum Domini figebant tentoria, et per verbum illius proficiscebantur: et observabant mandata Domini juxta sermonem Domini in manu Moysi.
verses.english: They set up their tents at the Lord’s command and journeyed at His command. They observed the Lord’s commands, just as the Lord had spoken through Moses.

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: The Lord God then spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Fac tibi duas tubas argenteas, productiles, quibus convocare possis multitudinem cum castrorum motio est.
verses.english: “Make two trumpets for yourself, made of hammered silver. You shall use them to call the community together when it is time for the camp to move.”

verses.latin: Cumque increpueris tubis, congregabitur ad te omnis turba ad ostium tabernaculi foederis.
verses.english: “When you sound them, the entire assembly of people will gather before you at the entrance of the tent of the covenant.”

verses.latin: Si solum una tuba clanguerit, venient ad te principes, et capita turmarum Israël.
verses.english: “If only one trumpet makes a sound, then only the leaders—the heads of the thousands of Israel—will come to you.”

verses.latin: Si autem longiore et iterato sono clangor bucinarum increpuerit, movebunt castra primi qui manent ad orientalem plagam.
verses.english: “But if you make a long, repeated sound with the trumpets, then those who are camped on the east side will begin to move.”

verses.latin: Ad secundum sonum et eundem modum clangoris tubae, qui habitant ad meridianam plagam, castra component: et sic reliqui facient.
verses.english: “At the second sound, made in the same manner, those who are camped on the south side will prepare their camp to move. And the others will do likewise.”

verses.latin: Quando autem congregandus est populus, simplex tubarum clangor erit, et non reiteratus.
verses.english: “However, when the people are to be gathered together, the trumpet sound will be a simple call, not a repeated one.”

verses.latin: Filii autem Aaron sacerdotes, clangent tubis: eritque hoc legitimum sempiternum in generationibus vestris.
verses.english: “And Aaron's sons, who are priests, shall sound the trumpets. This shall be a lasting ordinance for your generations.”

verses.latin: Si exieritis ad pugnam de terra vestra adversum hostes qui adversum vos dimicant, clangetis valide tubis: et recordabitur vestri Dominus Deus vester, ut eruamini de manibus inimicorum vestrorum.
verses.english: “If you go out to battle in your land against enemies who are fighting against you, you shall sound a strong call with the trumpets. Then the Lord your God will remember you, and you will be delivered from the hands of your enemies.”

verses.latin: Si quando habetis epulum, et dies festos, et kalendas, clangetis tubis super holocausta, et pacifica victimarum: et erit vobis in recordationem Dei vestri. Ego Dominus Deus vester.
verses.english: “Also, on your days of celebration, and on your feast days, and at the beginning of your months, you shall sound the trumpets over your burnt offerings and over the peace offerings. They will serve as a reminder for you before your God. I am the Lord your God.”

verses.latin: Anno secundo, mense secundo, vigesimo die mensis, sublevata est nubes de tabernaculo testimonii.
verses.english: In the second year, on the second month, on the twentieth day of the month, the cloud lifted from over the tabernacle of testimony.

verses.latin: Profectique sunt filii Israël per turmas suas de deserto Sinai: et recubuit nubes in solitudine Pharan.
verses.english: So the sons of Israel began their journeys, group by group, from the desert of Sinai. And the cloud settled down in the wilderness of Paran.

verses.latin: Moveruntque castra primi juxta imperium Domini per manum Moysi.
verses.english: The first groups to move their camps did so according to the Lord's command, through Moses.

verses.latin: Et sic profecti sunt filii Juda per turmas suas: quorum princeps erat Nahasson filius Aminadab.
verses.english: And so the sons of Judah set out by their divisions. Nahshon, the son of Amminadab, was their prince.

verses.latin: In tribu filiorum Issachar, princeps fuit Nathanaël filius Suar.
verses.english: In the tribe of the sons of Issachar, Nethanel, the son of Zuar, was the prince.

verses.latin: In tribu filiorum Zabulon, princeps fuit Eliab filius Helon.
verses.english: In the tribe of the sons of Zebulun, Eliab, the son of Helon, was the prince.

verses.latin: Depositumque est tabernaculum, et portaverunt filii Gerson et Merari.
verses.english: Then the tabernacle was taken down, and the sons of Gershon and Merari carried it.

verses.latin: Profectique sunt filii Ruben per turmas et cognationes suas: quorum princeps fuit Elisur filius Sedeur.
verses.english: Next, the sons of Reuben set out by their divisions and their families. Their prince was Elizur, the son of Shedeur.

verses.latin: In tribu filiorum Simeon, princeps fuit Salumiël filius Surisaddai.
verses.english: In the tribe of the sons of Simeon, Shelumiel, the son of Zurishaddai, was the prince.

verses.latin: In tribu filiorum Gad, princeps fuit Eliasaph filius Duel.
verses.english: In the tribe of the sons of Gad, Eliasaph, the son of Deuel, was the prince.

verses.latin: Profectique sunt et filii Caath portantes sanctuarium: ita ut cum venissent ad locum dispositionis tabernaculum erigeretur.
verses.english: And the sons of Kohath also set out, carrying the sanctuary. This was so that by the time they arrived at the designated stopping place, the tabernacle would already be set up.

verses.latin: Profecti sunt et filii Ephraim per turmas et cognationes suas: quorum princeps fuit Elisama filius Ammiud.
verses.english: Then the sons of Ephraim set out by their divisions and their families. Their prince was Elishama, the son of Ammihud.

verses.latin: In tribu filiorum Manasse, princeps fuit Gamaliël filius Phadassur.
verses.english: In the tribe of the sons of Manasseh, Gamaliel, the son of Pedahzur, was the prince.

verses.latin: In tribu filiorum Benjamin, princeps fuit Abidan filius Gedeonis.
verses.english: In the tribe of the sons of Benjamin, Abidan, the son of Gideoni, was the prince.

verses.latin: Novissimi ad exercitum profecti sunt filii Dan per turmas suas: quorum princeps fuit Ahiëser filius Ammisaddai.
verses.english: Lastly, those who formed the rear guard for all the camps were the sons of Dan, who set out by their divisions. Their prince was Ahiezer, the son of Ammishaddai.

verses.latin: In tribu filiorum Aser, princeps fuit Phagiel filius Ochran.
verses.english: In the tribe of the sons of Asher, Pagiel, the son of Ocran, was the prince.

verses.latin: In tribu filiorum Nephthali, princeps fuit Ahira filius Enan.
verses.english: In the tribe of the sons of Naphtali, Ahira, the son of Enan, was the prince.

verses.latin: Hi sunt motus filiorum Israël per turmas suas, quando egrediebantur.
verses.english: These were the movements of the sons of Israel, by their divisions, as they set out on their journeys.

verses.latin: Dixitque Moyses Hobab filio Raguel Madianitæ cognato suo: Proficiscimur ad locum quem Dominus daturus est nobis. Veni nobiscum, ut benefaciamus tibi: quia Dominus bona pollicitus est Israëli.
verses.english: Moses then said to Hobab, the son of Reuel the Midianite, his father-in-law: “We are setting out for the place that the Lord is going to give us. Come with us, and we will do good to you, because the Lord has promised good things to Israel.”

verses.latin: Qui respondit: Non veniam tecum, sed revertar in terram meam, ubi natus sum.
verses.english: But Hobab replied: “I will not come with you. Instead, I will return to my own land, where I was born.”

verses.latin: At ille: Noli, inquit, nos relinquere: tu enim nosti in quibus locis per desertum castra ponere debeamus, et eris nobis dux.
verses.english: But Moses urged him, saying: “Please do not leave us! For you know the places in the desert where we ought to camp, and you can be our guide.”

verses.latin: Quod si nobiscum veneris, quicquid optimum fuerit ex opibus quas nobis tradet Dominus, dabimus tibi.
verses.english: “And if you come with us, whatever good things the Lord gives to us, we will give to you as well.”

verses.latin: Profecti sunt ergo de monte Domini viam trium dierum: et arca fœderis Domini præcedebat eos viam trium dierum, providens atque investigans eis loca castrorum.
verses.english: So they set out from the mountain of the Lord, a three-day journey. And the ark of the covenant of the Lord went before them for three days, providing and searching out places for them to camp.

verses.latin: Nubes quoque Domini super illos erat per diem, cum pergerent.
verses.english: “And the cloud of the Lord was over them by day when they traveled.”

verses.latin: Cumque elevaretur arca, dicebat Moyses: Surge Domine, et dissipentur inimici tui, et fugiant qui oderunt te a facie tua.
verses.english: And whenever the ark was lifted up to move, Moses would say: “Arise, Lord, and may your enemies be scattered! May those who hate you flee from your presence!”

verses.latin: Cum autem poneretur, dicebat: Revertere Domine ad multitudinem exercitus Israël.
verses.english: “And when it was set down, he would say: ‘Return, Lord, to the countless thousands of Israel's army!’”

verses.latin: Igitur murmuraverat populus quasi dolens pro labore, contra Dominum. Quod cum audisset Dominus, iratus est. Et accensus ignis in eis devoravit extremam partem castrorum.
verses.english: The people began to complain against the Lord, as if they were lamenting their hardship. When the Lord heard this, He became very angry. A fire then ignited among them, consuming the outskirts of their camp.

verses.latin: Cumque clamasset populus ad Moysen, oravit Moyses Dominum: et extinguitur ignis.
verses.english: So the people cried out to Moses, and Moses prayed to the Lord for them. The fire was then extinguished.

verses.latin: Et vocavit nomen loci illius Incensionem: eo quod succensus esset ignis Domini in eos.
verses.english: So the name of that place was called "Burning", because the Lord's fire had been kindled against them there.

verses.latin: Vulgus quoque promiscuum, quod ascenderat cum eis, in desiderio fuit: atque illi filii Israel plorantes simul dixerunt: Quis dabit nobis escas carnium?
verses.english: But the mixed multitude of people who had come up with them were filled with intense cravings. And the children of Israel also wept, saying: "Who will give us meat to eat?"

verses.latin: Recordamur piscium quos comedebamus in Aegypto gratis: in mentem veniunt cucumeres, et pepones, porrique, et caepe, et allia.
verses.english: We remember the fish we used to eat for free in Egypt! We recall the cucumbers, melons, leeks, onions, and garlic.

verses.latin: Nunc anima nostra arida est: nihil aliud respiciunt oculi nostri nisi manna.
verses.english: But now our appetites are dry and weak. Our eyes see nothing but this manna.

verses.latin: Erat autem manna quasi semen coriandri, aspectus ejus quasi crystallus.
verses.english: The manna itself looked like coriander seed, and its appearance was like crystalline dew.

verses.latin: Perambulabatque populus, et colligens molebat in pistorio, vel terens in mortario coquebat in olla, faciens ex eo tortulas saporis quasi panis oleati.
verses.english: The people would go out to gather it, then grind it in handmills or crush it in mortars. They would cook it in pots and make cakes from it that tasted like bread made with oil.

verses.latin: Cumque nocte ros descenderet super castra, descendebat pariter et manna.
verses.english: And when the dew fell upon the camp at night, the manna would descend with it.

verses.latin: Audivit ergo Moyses plorantem populum per familias, singulos per ostia tabernaculorum suorum: iratusque est furor Domini vehementer. Sed et Moysi vehementer displicuit.
verses.english: Moses then heard the people weeping throughout their families, each person at the entrance of their tents. The Lord's fury became intense, and Moses himself was also greatly displeased by their behavior.

verses.latin: Dixitque ad Dominum: Cur afflixisti servum tuum? quare non invenio gratiam coram te, ut imponas pondus universi populi hujus super me?
verses.english: And Moses said to the Lord: "Why have You afflicted Your servant? Why have I not found grace in Your sight, that You would lay the burden of all these people upon me?"

verses.latin: Numquid ego concepi omnem hanc multitudinem, vel genui eam, ut dicas mihi: Porta illos in sinu tuo sicut portare solet nutrix infantulum, et defer in terram quam jurasti patribus eorum?
verses.english: Did I conceive all these people? Or did I give birth to them, that You should tell me: 'Carry them in your arms, as a nurse carries a baby, and bring them to the land which You swore to their fathers'?

verses.latin: Unde mihi carnes ut dem tantis populis? flebant contra me, dicentes: Da nobis carnes ut comedamus.
verses.english: Where can I get meat to give to all these people? For they are weeping before me, saying: 'Give us meat, so we may eat'.

verses.latin: Non possum solus sustinere omne hoc pondus populi: quia grave est mihi.
verses.english: I cannot bear all this burden of the people by myself, because it is too heavy for me.

verses.latin: Sin aliter facis, obsecro ut interficias me: si inveni gratiam in oculis tuis, ne videam mala mea.
verses.english: If You are going to continue dealing with me like this, I beg You, please kill me now—if I have found favor in Your eyes—so I may not see my own troubles and misery any further.

verses.latin: Et dixit Dominus ad Moysen: Congrega mihi septuaginta viros de senioribus Israel, quos tu nosti quod senes populi sint et magistri: et duces eos ad ostium tabernaculi foederis, faciesque ibi stare tecum,
verses.english: And the Lord said to Moses: "Gather for Me seventy men from the elders of Israel, men whom you know to be elders and leaders of the people. Bring them to the entrance of the Tabernacle of the Covenant, and have them stand there with you."

verses.latin: et descendam, et loquar tibi: auferamque de spiritu tuo, et dabo eis, ut sustentent tecum onus populi, et non graveris solus.
verses.english: And I will come down and speak with you there. I will take some of the Spirit that is upon you and put it upon them, so that they may bear the burden of the people with you, and you will not be burdened alone.

verses.latin: Populo quoque dices: Sanctificamini, in crastinum comedetis carnes: audistis enim, Quid dabit nobis carnes ad vescendum? melius est nobis in Aegypto. Ut det vobis Dominus carnes, et comedatis.
verses.english: And to the people you shall say: 'Sanctify yourselves for tomorrow, for you shall eat meat. For you have complained, saying: "Who will give us meat to eat? It was better for us in Egypt!" Now, the Lord will give you meat, and you shall eat it'.

verses.latin: Non uno die, nec duobus, vel quinque aut decem, nec viginti quidem diebus,
verses.english: You will eat it not for just one day, nor for two, or five, or ten, or even twenty days,

verses.latin: sed usque ad mensem dierum, donec exeat per nares vestras, et vertatur in nauuseam: eo quod spreveritis Dominum, qui in medio vestri est, et fleveritis coram eo, dicentes: Quare egressi sumus de Aegypto?
verses.english: but for an entire month of days, until it comes out of your nostrils and becomes sickening to you. This will happen because you have despised the Lord, who is in your midst, and have wept before Him, saying: 'Why did we ever leave Egypt?'

verses.latin: Et ait Moyses: Sexcenta millia peditum sunt de hoc populo inter quos ego sum: et tu dicis: Dabo eis carnes ut comedant per totum mensem?
verses.english: And Moses said: "There are six hundred thousand footmen among these people, among whom I stand. Yet You say: 'I will give them meat to eat for an entire month'?"

verses.latin: Numquid greges ovium et armenta boum occidentur, ut sufficere possint ad escam? vel omnes pisces maris in unum congregabuntur, ut saturent eos?
verses.english: Even if flocks of sheep and herds of cattle were slaughtered, would they be enough for their food? Or if all the fish of the sea were gathered together, would they satisfy them?

verses.latin: Cui respondit Dominus: Numquid manus Domini abbreviata est? jam nunc videbis utrum sermo meus in opere compleatur an non.
verses.english: To which the Lord answered: "Is the Lord's power limited? Now you shall see whether My word will be fulfilled in action or not."

verses.latin: Venit igitur Moyses, et narravit populo verba Domini, congregansque septuaginta viros de senioribus Israel, quos stare fecerat circa tabernaculum.
verses.english: So Moses went out and reported the Lord's words to the people. He gathered seventy men from the elders of Israel and made them stand around the Tabernacle.

verses.latin: Descenditque Dominus per nubem, et locutus est ad eum: auferens de spiritu qui erat in Moyse, dedit septuaginta viris senioribus. Cumque requievissent spiritus in eis, prophetaverunt, nec ultra cessaverunt.
verses.english: And the Lord came down in the cloud and spoke to Moses. He took some of the Spirit that was upon Moses and placed it upon the seventy elders. And when the Spirit rested upon them, they prophesied, and did not cease afterward.

verses.latin: Remanserant autem in castris duo viri, quorum unus vocabatur Eldad, et alter Medad, super quos requievit spiritus: nam et ipsi descripti fuerant, et non exierant ad tabernaculum. Cumque prophetarent in castris,
verses.english: Two men, however, had remained in the camp. One was named Eldad and the other Medad, and the Spirit rested upon them, for they had also been listed among the elders, but had not gone out to the Tabernacle. When they prophesied in the camp,

verses.latin: cucurrit puer, et nuntiavit Moysi, dicens: Eldad et Medad prophetant in castris.
verses.english: a young man ran and reported to Moses, saying: "Eldad and Medad are prophesying in the camp!"

verses.latin: Statimque Josue filius Nun, minister Moysi, unus de electis ejus, ait: Domine mi Moyses, prohibe illos.
verses.english: Immediately, Joshua, the son of Nun, Moses' assistant and one of his chosen men, said: "My Lord Moses, forbid them!"

verses.latin: Cui Moyses: Quid, inquit, æmularis pro me? quis tribuat ut omnis populus prophetet, et det eis Dominus spiritum suum?
verses.english: To him Moses replied: "Are you jealous for my sake? I wish that all the Lord's people would prophesy, and that the Lord would put His Spirit upon them all!"

verses.latin: Reversusque est Moyses, et seniores Israel in castra.
verses.english: After this, Moses and the elders of Israel returned to the camp.

verses.latin: Ventus autem egrediens a Domino, rapuit coturnices de mari, et detulit in castra viæ, quanti est dies, hinc atque inde per circuitum castrorum, et duos cubitos altitudine super faciem terræ.
verses.english: Then a wind came from the Lord, which swept quails from the sea and brought them to the camp. They were scattered for a distance of a day's journey all around the camp, and lay about two cubits (around three feet) high on the surface of the earth.

verses.latin: Surrexit ergo populus tota die illa, et nocte, ac die altera, et collegerunt coturnicum: qui minimum collegerat, decem choros implevit: et siccaverunt eos per circuitum castrorum.
verses.english: So the people rose up all that day, all that night, and all the next day, and gathered the quails. Even he who gathered the least collected ten homers (about 60 bushels). They then spread them out all around the camp to dry.

verses.latin: Adhuc carnes erant in dentibus eorum, nec defecerat hujuscemodi cibus: et ecce ira Domini concitata in populum, percussit eos plaga magna nimis.
verses.english: While the meat was still between their teeth and had not yet been consumed, the Lord's anger was stirred against the people, and He struck them with an exceedingly great plague.

verses.latin: Et vocavit nomen loci illius Sepulchra concupiscentiæ: eo quod ibi sepelissent populum qui concupierant.
verses.english: So the name of that place was called "Graves of Craving", because there they buried the people who had craved meat with such intensity.

verses.latin: De Sepulchris concupiscentiæ profecti sunt in Haseroth, manseruntque ibi.
verses.english: From the Graves of Craving, they journeyed to Hazeroth and remained there.

verses.latin: Locutaque est Maria et Aaron contra Moysen propter uxorem ejus Æthiopissam, et dixerunt: Cur duxit uxorem Æthiopissam?
verses.english: Then Miriam and Aaron began speaking against Moses because of his Ethiopian wife. They asked, 'Why did he marry an Ethiopian woman?'

verses.latin: Numquid per solum Moysen locutus est Dominus? nonne et per nos locutus est? Quod cum audisset Dominus.
verses.english: They continued, 'Has the Lord spoken only through Moses? Has He not also spoken through us?' The Lord heard what they said.

verses.latin: Erat autem Moyses vir mitissimus super omnes homines qui morabantur in terra.
verses.english: Now Moses was a very humble man, more humble than anyone else on the earth.

verses.latin: Statim locutus est ad eum Dominus, et ad Aaron, et ad Mariam: Egredimini tres soli ad tabernaculum fœderis. Cumque egressi fuissent.
verses.english: Immediately the Lord spoke to Moses, Aaron, and Miriam, saying, 'Go out, you three, to the Tent of Meeting.' So they went out.

verses.latin: Descendit Dominus in columna nubis, et stetit in introitu tabernaculi, vocavitque Aaron et Mariam. Qui cum ambo egressi fuissent.
verses.english: The Lord descended in a pillar of cloud and stood at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting. He called Aaron and Miriam. When both of them had come forward,

verses.latin: Dixit ad eos: Audite sermones meos: Si quis fuerit inter vos propheta Domini, in visione apparebo ei, vel per somnium loquar ad illum.
verses.english: He said to them, 'Hear My words: If there is a prophet among you who speaks for the Lord, I will appear to him in a vision, or I will speak to him in a dream.'

verses.latin: At non talis Moyses servus meus, qui in omni domo mea fidelissimus est.
verses.english: But My servant Moses is not like that, for he is most faithful in all My house.

verses.latin: Ore enim ad os loquor ei, et palam, et non per ænigmata et figuras: porro et similitudinem Domini videt. Quare ergo non timuistis loqui de servo meo Moyse?
verses.english: For I speak to him face to face, and plainly, not through dark sayings and riddles. Moreover, he sees the very form of the Lord. Why then were you not afraid to speak against My servant Moses?

verses.latin: Iratusque Dominus contra eos, abiit.
verses.english: And the Lord was angry with them and departed.

verses.latin: Nubes quoque recessit a super tabernaculum: et ecce Maria apparuit candens ut nix lepra. Cumque respexisset eam Aaron, et vidisset plenam lepra.
verses.english: The cloud also departed from above the Tent of Meeting. And behold, Miriam was suddenly white with leprosy like snow. When Aaron looked at her and saw she was completely covered with leprosy,

verses.latin: Ait ad Moysen: Obsecro domine mi, ne ponas nobis hoc peccatum, quod stulte fecimus, et peccavimus.
verses.english: He said to Moses, 'I beg you, my lord, do not hold this sin against us, which we foolishly committed and in which we sinned.'

verses.latin: Non fiat haec quasi abortivum, quod mortuum egreditur de matris utero consumpto jam carneo.
verses.english: 'Let her not be like a stillborn child, that comes out dead from its mother’s womb with its flesh already half-consumed.'

verses.latin: Clamavitque Moyses ad Dominum, dicens: Deus, obsecro, sana eam.
verses.english: Then Moses cried out to the Lord, saying, 'O God, I beg You, heal her!'

verses.latin: Cui respondit Dominus: Si pater ejus spuisset in faciem illius, nonne saltem septem diebus erubuisset? Separetur septem diebus extra castra, et tunc revocabitur.
verses.english: The Lord answered him, 'If her father had spat in her face, would she not have been ashamed for at least seven days? Let her be separated for seven days outside the camp, and then she will be brought back.'

verses.latin: Exclusa est itaque Maria extra castra septem diebus: et populus non est ultra progressus, donec rediret Maria.
verses.english: So Miriam was excluded from the camp for seven days. And the people did not move on until Miriam was brought back.

verses.latin: Post haec profecti sunt de Haseroth, et castrametati sunt in deserto Pharan.
verses.english: After this, they moved on from Hazeroth and encamped in the desert of Paran.

verses.latin: Locutus est Dominus ad Moysen dicens:
verses.english: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Mitte viros qui explorent terram Chanaan, quam daturus sum filiis Israël, singulos de singulis tribubus ex principibus.
verses.english: “Send men to explore the land of Canaan, which I am about to give to the children of Israel. Send one leader from each tribe.”

verses.latin: Misit Moyses de deserto Pharan juxta imperium Domini, omnes principes viri ex filiis Israël, quorum haec sunt nomina:
verses.english: So Moses sent them from the wilderness of Paran, as commanded by the Lord. All of these men were leaders from among the children of Israel. These are their names:

verses.latin: De tribu Ruben, Sammua filium Zecchur.
verses.english: From the tribe of Reuben, Shammua, the son of Zaccur.

verses.latin: De tribu Simeon, Saphat filium Huri.
verses.english: From the tribe of Simeon, Shaphat, the son of Hori.

verses.latin: De tribu Juda, Caleb filium Jephone.
verses.english: From the tribe of Judah, Caleb, the son of Jephunneh.

verses.latin: De tribu Issachar, Igal filium Joseph.
verses.english: From the tribe of Issachar, Igal, the son of Joseph.

verses.latin: De tribu Ephraim, Osee filium Nun.
verses.english: From the tribe of Ephraim, Hosea, the son of Nun.

verses.latin: De tribu Benjamin, Phalti filium Raphu.
verses.english: From the tribe of Benjamin, Palti, the son of Raphu.

verses.latin: De tribu Zabulon, Geddiel filium Sodi.
verses.english: From the tribe of Zebulun, Gaddiel, the son of Sodi.

verses.latin: De tribu Joseph, sceptri Manasse, Gaddi filium Susi.
verses.english: From the tribe of Joseph, representing the tribe of Manasseh, Gaddi, the son of Susi.

verses.latin: De tribu Dan, Ammiel filium Gemalli.
verses.english: From the tribe of Dan, Ammiel, the son of Gemalli.

verses.latin: De tribu Aser, Sthur filium Michael.
verses.english: From the tribe of Asher, Sethur, the son of Michael.

verses.latin: De tribu Nephtali, Nahabi filium Vapsi.
verses.english: From the tribe of Naphtali, Nahbi, the son of Vophsi.

verses.latin: De tribu Gad, Guel filium Machi.
verses.english: From the tribe of Gad, Geuel, the son of Machi.

verses.latin: Haec sunt nomina virorum quos misit Moyses ad explorandam terram; et vocavit Moyses Osee filium Nun Josue.
verses.english: These are the names of the men whom Moses sent to explore the land. Moses also changed the name of Hosea, the son of Nun, to Joshua.

verses.latin: Dixitque Moyses: Ascendite per meridiem, quando veneritis ad montes:
verses.english: Moses then gave them instructions: “Go up through the South, and when you reach the mountainous region,

verses.latin: et considerate terram, qualis sit: et populum qui habitator est ejus, fortis an infirmus: pauci numero an plures:
verses.english: observe what kind of land it is. Also, observe the people who live there: are they strong or weak? Are they few in number or many?

verses.latin: urbes muratae an absque muris: ubi habitent, in tentoriis an oppidis:
verses.english: Are their cities fortified with walls or unwalled? Where do they live—in tents or in towns?

verses.latin: terra fertilis an sterilis, arboreta an absque arboribus. Confortamini, et adferte nobis de fructibus terrae. Erat autem tempus quando jam coeperant uvae maturescere.
verses.english: Is the land fertile or barren? Are there trees in it or not? Be courageous and bring back some of the fruit of the land. Now it was the season when the first grapes were beginning to ripen.”

verses.latin: Ascenderunt ergo, et exploraverunt terram a deserto Sin usque Raab, introitum Emath.
verses.english: So they went up and explored the land, from the wilderness of Zin all the way to Rehob, toward the entrance to Hamath.

verses.latin: Ascenderuntque ad meridiem, et venerunt in Hebron, ubi erant Ahiman et Sisai et Tholmai filii Enach. Hebron autem septem annis ante aedificata est quam Tanios civitas Ægypti.
verses.english: They went up into the South and came to Hebron, where Ahiman, Sheshai, and Talmai, the descendants of Anak, lived. Hebron had been built seven years before Zoan, the city in Egypt.

verses.latin: Et venerunt usque ad torrentem Botri, ubi praeciderunt palmitem cum uva una, quem portaverunt in vecte duo viri. De malogranatis quoque et ficis ejus loci tulerunt:
verses.english: They came as far as the Valley of Eshcol. There, they cut down a branch with a single cluster of grapes, which two men carried on a pole between them. They also took some pomegranates and figs from that place.

verses.latin: vocatus est locus ille Nehelescol, id est torrens Botri, eo quod botrum inde portassent filii Israël.
verses.english: That place was named Eshcol (meaning “valley of the cluster”) because of the cluster of grapes that the children of Israel carried from there.

verses.latin: Reversi sunt exploratores terrae post quadraginta dies.
verses.english: The explorers of the land returned after forty days.

verses.latin: Venerunt ad Moysen et Aaron et ad omnem coetum filiorum Israël in desertum Pharan Cades.
verses.english: They came back to Moses and Aaron and to the entire assembly of the children of Israel, in the wilderness of Paran, at Kadesh.

verses.latin: Tuleruntque ad illos et ad omnem multitudinem fructus terrae.
verses.english: They brought the fruit of the land to them and to the whole congregation.

verses.latin: Et narraverunt dicentes: Venimus in terram ad quam misisti nos, quae re vera lacte et melle manat, ut hi fructus ejus ostendunt:
verses.english: And they reported to Moses, saying: “We went into the land to which you sent us, and it truly flows with milk and honey, as these fruits demonstrate.

verses.latin: sed fortissimum est populus qui habitator est ejus, urbes maximae et muratae, insuper et de stirpe Enach vidimus ibi.
verses.english: But the people who live in it are very strong; the cities are very large and fortified. Moreover, we saw descendants of Anak there.

verses.latin: Amalec habitat in australi parte, Hettheus et Jebusaeus et Amorrhoeus morantur in montanis: Chananaeus vero juxta mare situmque Jordanis obtinet.
verses.english: The Amalekites live in the south; the Hittites, Jebusites, and Amorites dwell in the mountainous regions; and the Canaanites occupy the area by the sea and along the Jordan River.”

verses.latin: Cohortatusque Caleb silentium facite in populo, qui murmurabat contra Moysen, et ait: Ascendamus, et possideamus terram, quoniam poterimus obtinere eam.
verses.english: Caleb quieted the people who were murmuring against Moses and said: “Let us go up immediately and take possession of the land, for we will certainly be able to conquer it.”

verses.latin: Ceteri vero qui fuerant cum eo exploratores aiunt: Non possumus ad hunc populum ascendere, quoniam fortior nobis est.
verses.english: But the other men who had gone with him as explorers said: “We cannot go up against these people, because they are too strong for us.”

verses.latin: Detraxerunt igitur filiis Israël terram quam exploraverant, dicentes: Terra quam lustravimus devorat habitatores suos: populus cujus magnitudinem inspexerunt, procerior est.
verses.english: So they spread a discouraging report among the children of Israel about the land they had explored, saying: “The land which we surveyed devours its inhabitants. The people whose stature we observed are exceptionally tall.

verses.latin: Ibi vidimus monstra quaedam filiorum Enach gigantum stirpe, quorum conparatione quasi lucustae videbamur.
verses.english: There we saw monstrous beings, descendants of Anak—a race of giants. In comparison to them, we appeared like grasshoppers in our own eyes.”

verses.latin: Et murmuravit omnis multitudo contra Moysen et Aaron, clamavitque populus fletu tota nocte.
verses.english: Then the whole congregation murmured against Moses and Aaron, and the people wept and cried all that night.

verses.latin: Et contra Moysen et Aaron murmurabant omnes filii Israël, dicentes: Utinam mortui essemus in Aegypto, aut in solitudine hac utinam pereamus.
verses.english: All the children of Israel complained against Moses and Aaron, saying: “If only we had died in Egypt, or if only we would perish here in this wilderness!

verses.latin: Cur Dominus introduxit nos in terram hanc, ut cadamus gladio, et uxores ac liberi nostri captivi ducantur? Nonne melius est reverti in Aegyptum?
verses.english: Why has the Lord brought us to this land, only for us to fall by the sword? Our wives and children will be led away as captives. Wouldn’t it be better for us to return to Egypt?”

verses.latin: Dixitque alter ad alterum: Constituamus nobis ducem, et revertamur in Aegyptum.
verses.english: And one said to another: “Let us appoint a new leader and return to Egypt.”

verses.latin: Quo audito, Moyses et Aaron corruerunt proni ante omnem multitudinem filiorum Israël.
verses.english: Upon hearing this, Moses and Aaron fell prostrate before the entire assembly of the children of Israel.

verses.latin: Josue vero filius Nun et Caleb filius Jephone, qui et ipsi exploratores fuerant, sciderunt vestimenta sua, et ad omnem multitudinem filiorum Israël locuti sunt, dicentes: Terra quam lustravimus, optima est nimis.
verses.english: However, Joshua, the son of Nun, and Caleb, the son of Jephunneh, who themselves had also been among the explorers, tore their clothes. They spoke to the entire congregation of the children of Israel, saying: “The land which we surveyed is an exceptionally good land.”

verses.latin: Clamavit ergo omnis multitudo, et flevit eo nocte.
verses.english: So the entire assembly cried out in a loud voice. And they wept all throughout that night.

verses.latin: Murmurati sunt contra Moysen et Aaron omnes filii Israël: dicentes: Utinam mortui essemus in Ægypto, aut in solitudine hac, utinam perissemus:
verses.english: All the sons of Israel grumbled and complained against Moses and Aaron, saying: "If only we had died in Egypt, or if only we had perished in this desert!"

verses.latin: cur introduxit nos Dominus in terram hanc, ut cadamus in bello, et uxores ac liberi nostri ducantur captivi? Nonne melius est reverti in Ægyptum?
verses.english: "Why has the Lord brought us into this land only for us to fall in battle? Our wives and our children will be taken captive there. Wouldn't it be better for us to return to Egypt?"

verses.latin: Dixitque alter ad alterum: Constituamus sibi ducem, et revertamur in Ægyptum.
verses.english: They also began to say to one another: "Let's choose a new leader for ourselves, and then we can return to Egypt."

verses.latin: Quo audito, Moyses et Aaron corruerunt proni in terram coram omni multitudine filiorum Israël.
verses.english: When Moses and Aaron heard this, they fell face down on the ground before the entire assembly of the sons of Israel.

verses.latin: At Josue filius Nun, et Caleb filius Jephone, qui et ipsi exploratores fuerant terræ, sciderunt vestimenta sua,
verses.english: But Joshua, the son of Nun, and Caleb, the son of Jephone—who were also among those who had explored the land—tore their clothing in distress.

verses.latin: et ad omnem multitudinem filiorum Israël loquentes, dixerunt: Terra, quam lustravimus, optima est nimis.
verses.english: And speaking to the whole assembly of the sons of Israel, they said: "The land which we have explored is exceedingly good and bountiful."

verses.latin: Si propitius fuerit Dominus, inducet nos in eam, et tradet terram lacte et melle manantem.
verses.english: "If the Lord is gracious to us, He will bring us into that land and give us that land, which flows with milk and honey."

verses.latin: Nolite rebelles esse contra Dominum: neque timeatis populum terræ hujus, quia sicut panem, ita eos possumus devorare. Recessit ab illis omnis tutela: Dominus nobiscum est, nolite metuere.
verses.english: "Do not rebel against the Lord! And do not fear the people of this land, because we can surely devour them as if they were mere bread. All their protection has departed from them. The Lord is with us, so do not be afraid!"

verses.latin: Cumque clamaret omnis multitudo, et lapidibus eos vellet opprimere: apparuit gloria Domini super tabernaculum testimonii cunctis filiis Israël.
verses.english: But when the whole assembly cried out again and wanted to overwhelm Joshua and Caleb with stones, the glory of the Lord appeared over the tabernacle of testimony before all the sons of Israel.

verses.latin: Et dixit Dominus ad Moysen: Usquequo detrahet mihi populus iste? quousque non credent mihi in omnibus signis quæ feci coram eis?
verses.english: And the Lord said to Moses: "How long will this people revile Me? How long will they refuse to believe Me, despite all the miraculous signs that I have performed before their eyes?"

verses.latin: Percutiam igitur illos pestilentia, atque consumam: te autem faciam in gentem magnam, et robustiorem quam hæc est.
verses.english: "Therefore, I will strike them with a pestilence and consume them. But I will make you into a great and more powerful nation than this one."

verses.latin: Et ait Moyses ad Dominum: Ut audiant Ægyptii, de quorum medio eduxisti populum istum,
verses.english: And Moses said to the Lord: "But what if the Egyptians hear of this? They are the very people from among whom You brought out this nation!"

verses.latin: et habitatores terræ hujus, qui audierunt quod tu Domine in medio horum sis, et facies tua cernatur ad præsens, et nubes tua protegat illos, et in columna nubis præcedas eos per diem, et in columna ignis per noctem:
verses.english: "And what about the inhabitants of this land? They have heard that You, Lord, are in the midst of this people, and that Your face is seen among them in the present moment, and that Your cloud protects them, and that You go before them in a pillar of cloud by day and in a pillar of fire by night."

verses.latin: Si occideris populum istum quasi unum virum, dicent gentes quæ audierunt famam tuam:
verses.english: "If You kill this people as if they were a single man, then the nations who have heard Your great reputation will say:"

verses.latin: Non poterat introducere populum in terram, pro qua juraverat: idcirco occidit eos in solitudine.
verses.english: "'He could not bring the people into the land that He had sworn to give them, and therefore He killed them in the wilderness.'"

verses.latin: Magnificetur ergo fortitudo tua, Domine, sicut jurasti, dicens:
verses.english: "Therefore, let Your strength, O Lord, be magnified, just as You swore, saying:"

verses.latin: Dominus patiens et multæ misericordiæ, auferens iniquitatem et scelera, nullusque insontem ducens, qui visitas peccata patrum in filios in tertiam et quartam generationem.
verses.english: "The Lord is patient and full of great mercy, taking away iniquity and wicked deeds. Yet He does not declare the guilty innocent, for He visits the sins of the fathers upon the children, even to the third and fourth generation."

verses.latin: Dimitte, obsecro, peccatum populi hujus secundum magnitudinem misericordiæ tuæ, sicut propitius fuisti egressis de Ægypto usque ad hunc locum.
verses.english: "Forgive, I beg You, the sin of this people according to the greatness of Your mercy, just as You have been gracious to them from their departure out of Egypt all the way to this place."

verses.latin: Dixit Dominus: Dimisi juxta verbum tuum.
verses.english: The Lord said: "I have forgiven them according to your word."

verses.latin: Vivo ego: et implebitur gloria Domini universa terra:
verses.english: "As I live — and the glory of the Lord will fill the entire earth —"

verses.latin: Attamen omnes viri qui viderunt majestatem meam, et signa quæ feci in Ægypto, et in solitudine, et tentaverunt me jam per decem vices, nec obedierunt voci meæ,
verses.english: "Nevertheless, all the men who have seen My majesty, and the miraculous signs that I performed in Egypt and in the wilderness—and who have tested Me now these ten times, and have not obeyed My voice—"

verses.latin: non videbunt terram, pro qua juravi patribus eorum, nec quisquam ex his qui detraxerunt mihi, intuebitur eam.
verses.english: "they shall not see the land for which I swore an oath to their fathers. Not one of those who have reviled Me shall ever look upon it."

verses.latin: Servum meum Caleb, qui plenus alio spiritu secutus est me, inducam in terram hanc, quam circuivit: et semen ejus possidebit eam.
verses.english: "But My servant Caleb, because he was filled with a different spirit and fully followed Me, him I will bring into this land which he explored. And his offspring shall possess it."

verses.latin: Amalecites et Chananæus habitant in vallibus. Cras abfite in solitudinem per viam maris Rubri.
verses.english: "Now, since the Amalekites and the Canaanites dwell in the valleys, tomorrow you must turn around and depart into the wilderness by the way of the Red Sea."

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen et Aaron, dicens:
verses.english: And the Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying:

verses.latin: Usquequo multitudo hæc pessima murmurat contra me? Querelas filiorum Israël audivi.
verses.english: "How long will this wicked assembly grumble against Me? I have heard the complaints of the sons of Israel."

verses.latin: Dic ergo eis: Vivo ego, ait Dominus: sicut locuti estis audiente me, sic faciam vobis.
verses.english: "Therefore, tell them: 'As I live,' says the Lord, 'just as you have spoken in My hearing, so will I do to you.'"

verses.latin: In solitudine hac cadavera vestra jacebunt. Omnes qui numerati estis a viginti annis et supra, et murmurastis contra me,
verses.english: "In this very wilderness, your corpses shall fall. All of you who were counted, from twenty years old and above, and who grumbled against Me,"

verses.latin: non intrabitis terram super quam levavi manum meam ut habitare vos facerem: præter Caleb filium Jephone, et Josue filium Nun.
verses.english: "none of you shall enter the land over which I raised My hand in an oath to make you dwell in it, except Caleb, the son of Jephone, and Joshua, the son of Nun."

verses.latin: Parvulos autem vestros, de quibus dixistis quod prædæ forent hostibus, ego introducam: ut videant terram quam vos despexistis.
verses.english: "But your little ones, about whom you said they would become plunder for the enemies, these I will bring in. So they shall see the land that you despised."

verses.latin: Vestra cadavera jacebunt in solitudine hac.
verses.english: "Your own corpses, however, shall lie here in this wilderness."

verses.latin: Filios vestros pascetis in solitudine quadraginta annis, et portabunt fornicationem vestram, donec consumantur cadavera patrum in deserto.
verses.english: "And your children shall wander as shepherds in the wilderness for forty years, and they shall bear the punishment for your infidelity, until your fathers' corpses are consumed and gone in the desert."

verses.latin: Secundum numerum quadraginta dierum, quibus considerastis terram: annus pro die imputabitur. Quadraginta annis recipietis iniquitates vestras, et scietis ultionem meam:
verses.english: "According to the number of the forty days in which you explored the land—a year shall be counted for each day. For forty years, you shall bear the punishment for your iniquities, and you will experience My vengeful justice."

verses.latin: quoniam sicut locutus sum, ita faciam omni multitudini huic pessimæ, quæ consurrexit adversum me: in solitudine hac deficiet, et morietur.
verses.english: "Because just as I have spoken, so will I do to this entire wicked assembly that has risen up against Me. In this wilderness, they shall waste away and die."

verses.latin: Igitur omnes viri, quos miserat Moyses ad contemplandam terram, et qui reversi murmurare fecerant contra eum omnem multitudinem, detrahentes terræ quod esset mala,
verses.english: So then, all the men whom Moses had sent to explore the land, and who, upon returning, had made the entire assembly grumble against him by speaking evil about the land—

verses.latin: mortui sunt, atque perculsi in conspectu Domini.
verses.english: these men died, struck down by a plague in the sight of the Lord.

verses.latin: Josue autem filius Nun, et Caleb filius Jephone, ex omnibus qui terræ jam lustratæ fuerant, soli vixerunt.
verses.english: But Joshua, the son of Nun, and Caleb, the son of Jephone, alone remained alive out of all those who had gone to explore the land.

verses.latin: Locutusque est Moyses universa verba hæc ad omnes filios Israël: et luxit populus vehementer.
verses.english: And Moses spoke all these words to all the sons of Israel, and the people mourned intensely.

verses.latin: Et ecce mane primo surgentes, ascenderunt cacumen montis, atque dixerunt: Parati sumus ascendere ad locum de quo Dominus locutus est: quia peccavimus.
verses.english: And behold, rising early in the morning, they went up to the top of the mountain and said: "We are ready to go up to the place about which the Lord spoke, for we have sinned."

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Loquere filiis Israel, et dices ad eos: Cum ingressi fueritis terram habitationis vestræ, quam ego dabo vobis,
verses.english: Speak to the children of Israel and tell them this: 'When you have entered the land where you will live, the land that I am giving to you,

verses.latin: et feceritis oblationem Domino in holocaustum, sive victimam, vota solventes, vel sponte offerentes munera, aut in solemnitatibus vestris adolentes suavissimum odorem Domino de bubus sive de ovibus:
verses.english: and you make an offering to the Lord—whether a burnt offering or a sacrifice to fulfill a vow, or a freewill offering, or one presented during your solemn feasts to produce a most pleasing aroma to the Lord from cattle or from sheep:

verses.latin: afferent qui immolaverint hostias, sacrificium similæ, duodecim partibus ephi, quæ sit conspersa oleo, cujus mensura fuerit quarta pars hin:
verses.english: those who offer the sacrifice must present a grain offering of fine flour. It will be a tenth part of an ephah, mixed with oil, of which the measure shall be a fourth part of a hin.

verses.latin: et vinum ad libamentum ejusdem mensuræ dabunt ad holocaustum, sive ad victimam. Per singulos agnos.
verses.english: And they shall give wine for a drink offering of the same measure as the oil for the burnt offering or for the sacrifice. This is for each lamb sacrificed.

verses.latin: Si de arietibus fuerit, offerent similam, duas decimas ephi, conspersam oleo tertia parte hin:
verses.english: If the offering is from rams, they shall offer fine flour, two tenths of an ephah, mixed with oil, one third part of a hin.

verses.latin: et vinum ad libamentum tertiæ partis ejusdem mensuræ offerent in odorem suavissimum Domino.
verses.english: And for the drink offering, they shall offer wine of the same measure—a third part of a hin—as a most pleasing aroma to the Lord.

verses.latin: Quando vero bovem immolabis in holocaustum, vel hostiam, implens votum, vel pacificas victimas:
verses.english: But when you offer a bull as a burnt offering, or a sacrifice to fulfill a vow, or as a peace offering:

verses.latin: dabis per singulos boves similam tres decimas ephi conspersam oleo, media parte hin:
verses.english: then for each bull, you shall give a grain offering of fine flour, three tenths of an ephah, mixed with oil, half a hin.

verses.latin: et vinum ad libamentum ejusdem mensuræ offeres in holocaustum suavissimi odoris Domino.
verses.english: And you shall offer wine for the drink offering, of the same measure, as a burnt offering of most pleasing aroma to the Lord.

verses.latin: Sic facies
verses.english: You shall do this

verses.latin: per singulos boves et arietum et ovium atque caprarum.
verses.english: for each bull, and for each ram, and for each lamb, and for each goat.

verses.latin: Tam indigena quam advena facient juxta eundem ritum.
verses.english: Both the native-born and the resident alien shall perform these rituals according to the same custom.

verses.latin: Si quis peregrinorum vobiscum habitantium, voluerit offerre holocaustum, sive victimam Domino, sicut vos facitis, ita faciat.
verses.english: If any of the foreigners who live among you wish to offer a burnt offering or a sacrifice to the Lord, they shall do it exactly as you do.

verses.latin: Una ordinatio erit vobis, et proselytis qui advenæ sunt, æque placita.
verses.english: There will be one ordinance for you and for the proselytes who are resident aliens; it will be equally acceptable to God.

verses.latin: Unaque lex erit, et judicium tam vobis quam his qui peregrinantur vobiscum.
verses.english: There will be one law and one judgment for both you and for those who reside as strangers among you.

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Loquere filiis Israel, et dices ad eos: Cum ingressi fueritis terram, in quam ego introduco vos,
verses.english: Speak to the children of Israel and tell them this: 'When you have entered the land into which I am bringing you,

verses.latin: et comederitis de panibus regionis illius, separabitis primitias Domino.
verses.english: and you eat from the food of that region, you shall set aside the first portions for the Lord.

verses.latin: De cibis, quos comedistis, offeretis primogenita, sicut de areis vestris.
verses.english: From the food you eat, you shall offer the first fruits, just as you do from your threshing floors.

verses.latin: Primitias ciborum vestrorum dabitis Domino.
verses.english: You shall give the first portions of your food to the Lord.

verses.latin: Quod si per ignorantiam peccaveritis, et non observaveritis omnia quæ locutus est Dominus ad Moysen,
verses.english: Now, if you unintentionally sin and do not observe all the commandments that the Lord has spoken to Moses—

verses.latin: et per manum Moysi, atque jussit vobis: ex eo die quo cœpit jubere, et ultra:
verses.english: all that the Lord commanded you through Moses, from the day He began to give commandments and thereafter—

verses.latin: et oblita fuerit multitudo: offeres vitulum de armento, holocaustum, et suavissimum odorem Domino, et sacrificium ejus, et libamenta ut cærimoniæ postulant: hircumque caprarum pro peccato.
verses.english: and if the entire community has forgotten something and sinned, then they shall offer a young bull from the herd as a burnt offering and a most pleasing aroma to the Lord, along with its proper grain offering and drink offering, as the ceremonies require. They shall also offer a male goat as a sin offering.

verses.latin: Et rogabit sacerdos pro omni multitudine filiorum Israel, et dimittetur eis: quoniam non sponte peccaverunt, offerentesque pro peccato suo incensum Domino et sacrificia, atque libamina.
verses.english: And the priest shall make atonement for the entire community of the children of Israel, and they will be forgiven. This is because they sinned unintentionally, and they have brought their incense offering to the Lord along with their sacrifices and drink offerings for their sin.

verses.latin: Et dimittetur universo populo filiorum Israel, et advenis, qui inter eos versantur: quoniam culpa est omnis populi per ignorantiam.
verses.english: And the entire people of the children of Israel, and the resident aliens who live among them, shall be forgiven, because it was an unintentional fault on the part of the whole people.

verses.latin: Quod si anima una peccaverit per ignorantiam, offeret capram anniculam absque macula pro peccato suo.
verses.english: But if an individual person sins unintentionally, that person shall offer a one-year-old female goat without blemish as a sin offering.

verses.latin: Et rogabit pro ea sacerdos, quod ignoranter peccaverit coram Domino: impetrabitque ei veniam, et dimittetur illi.
verses.english: And the priest shall make atonement for that person who sinned unintentionally before the Lord. He shall obtain forgiveness for them, and it will be forgiven.

verses.latin: Tam indigenis quam advenis una erit lex cunctis qui peccaverint ignoranter.
verses.english: There shall be one law for all who sin unintentionally, both for the native-born and for the resident alien.

verses.latin: Siquis autem per superbiam fecerit, tam civis quam advena: quoniam adversum Dominum rebellis extitit, peribit de populo suo.
verses.english: But if anyone, whether native-born or a resident alien, acts presumptuously (that is, with arrogant defiance against God), then because that person has rebelled against the Lord, they shall be cut off from their people.

verses.latin: Verbum enim Domini contempsit, et præceptum illius fecit irritum: idcirco delebitur, et portabit iniquitatem suam.
verses.english: For they have despised the Word of the Lord and made His commandment void. Therefore, that person shall be utterly destroyed and shall bear the guilt of their iniquity.

verses.latin: Accidit autem ut cum essent filii Israel in solitudine, et colligerent vir ligna in die sabbati,
verses.english: It happened that while the children of Israel were in the desert, a man was gathering wood on the Sabbath day.

verses.latin: apprehenderent eum offerentes ad Moysen et Aaron et universam multitudinem.
verses.english: Those who found him gathering wood brought him to Moses and Aaron and the entire community.

verses.latin: Qui clauserunt eum in carcerem, nescientes quid super eo facere deberent.
verses.english: They put him in custody, because they did not know what should be done to him.

verses.latin: Dixitque Dominus ad Moysen: Morte moriatur homo ille: lapidibus opprimet eum omnis turba extra castra.
verses.english: And the Lord said to Moses: 'That man must surely be put to death. The entire community shall stone him with rocks outside the camp.'

verses.latin: Cumque eduxissent eum extra castra, obruerunt lapidibus, et mortuus est.
verses.english: So when they brought him outside the camp, the entire community pelted him with rocks, and he died.

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Loquere filiis Israel, et dices ad eos ut faciant sibi fimbrias per angulos palliorum suorum, ponentes in eis funiculos hyacinthinos:
verses.english: Speak to the children of Israel and tell them that they are to make for themselves fringes on the corners of their cloaks throughout their generations, and that they are to put a cord of blue on the fringe of each corner.

verses.latin: quas cum viderint, recordentur omnium mandatorum Domini, et non sequantur cogitationes suas et oculos per res varias fornicantes:
verses.english: When they see these fringes, they are to remember all the commandments of the Lord. They are not to stray after their own thoughts and their eyes, which lead them to spiritual unfaithfulness by lusting after various things.

verses.latin: sed magis memores mandatorum Domini, faciant ea, et sint sancti Deo vestro.
verses.english: Instead, they should remember the commandments of the Lord and do them, and so be holy to your God.

verses.latin: Ecce Core filius Isaar filii Caath filii Levi, et Dathan atque Abiron filii Eliab, et Hon filius Pheleth filii Ruben, assumpserunt contra Moysen;
verses.english: Listen now: Korah, the son of Izhar, who was the son of Kohath, who was the son of Levi— along with Dathan and Abiram, who were sons of Eliab, and Hon, who was the son of Peleth, who was the son of Reuben— these men rebelled against Moses.

verses.latin: et alii duo centum quinquaginta de filiis Israël principes concilii, qui in tempore synodi vocabantur nominibus suis.
verses.english: Also, two hundred and fifty other leaders from the sons of Israel joined them. These men were respected members of the council and were called by their names during times of assembly.

verses.latin: Hi coiverunt adversum Moysen et Aaron, dixeruntque: Sufficiat vobis, ut omnis multitudo sit sancta, et in ipsis sit Dominus: cur elevamini super populum Domini?
verses.english: These men gathered together against Moses and Aaron, and they said: 'It is enough that you two are in charge. The whole community of the people is holy, and the Lord is present among all of them. So why do you elevate yourselves above the Lord's people?'

verses.latin: Quo audito, Moyses cecidit pronus in terram,
verses.english: When Moses heard this, he fell face down to the ground in an act of deep reverence and supplication.

verses.latin: et loquens ad Core et ad universam multitudinem, ait: Mane ostendet Dominus qui ad se pertineant, et sanctos sibi applicet: et quos elegerit, appropinquabunt ei.
verses.english: Then, speaking to Korah and the entire assembly, Moses said: 'Tomorrow morning, the Lord will show who truly belongs to Him and whom He has made holy. And those whom He has chosen will be allowed to approach Him.'

verses.latin: Hoc ergo facite: Tollite thuribula, Core et omnis concio vestra:
verses.english: So this is what you must do: Korah, and all your followers, take your censers.

verses.latin: et ponentes ignem, incensum desuper, cras offeretis coram Domino, ut quemcumque elegerit, ipse sit sanctus: nimis erigimini filii Levi.
verses.english: Place fire in them and put incense on top. Tomorrow, you will offer these before the Lord. Then, whoever the Lord chooses, that person will be the holy one. You sons of Levi are being much too presumptuous.

verses.latin: Dixitque Moyses ad Core: Audite, filii Levi:
verses.english: Moses also said to Korah: 'Listen, sons of Levi!'

verses.latin: num parum vobis est quod separavit vos Deus Israël ab omni populo, et junxit sibi, ut serviretis ei in cultu tabernaculi, portantes onera multitudinis,
verses.english: 'Is it not enough for you that the God of Israel has separated you from all the rest of the people and brought you close to Himself to serve Him in the worship of the Tabernacle, performing the duties for the community?'

verses.latin: et nunc etiam sacerdotium vindicatis?
verses.english: 'And now, are you also claiming the priesthood for yourselves?'

verses.latin: Propter hoc omnis concio tua stat contra Dominum: nam Aaron quid est ut murmuratis contra eum?
verses.english: 'Because of this, your entire assembly is actually standing against the Lord. For what has Aaron done that you should complain against him?'

verses.latin: Misit Moyses ut vocarentur Dathan et Abiron filii Eliab. Qui responderunt: Non venimus.
verses.english: Moses sent a summons for Dathan and Abiram, the sons of Eliab. But they replied: 'We will not come!'

verses.latin: Num parum est tibi quod eduxisti nos de terra quæ lacte et melle manabat, ut occideres in deserto, nisi et dominari nobismetipsis insuper nitere?
verses.english: 'Is it not enough for you that you have brought us out of a land flowing with milk and honey, only to kill us in this desert, unless you also try to lord it over us?'

verses.latin: Revera terram fluentem lacte et melle non adduxisti nos, neque dedisti possessionem agrorum et vinearum: an et oculos nostros auferre conaris? Non venimus.
verses.english: 'Indeed, you have not brought us into a land flowing with milk and honey, nor have you given us possession of fields and vineyards! Are you trying to blind us as well? We will not come!'

verses.latin: Iratusque Moyses valde, ait ad Dominum: Ne respicias sacrificia eorum: tu scis quod ne asellum quidem unquam acceperim ab eis, nec afflixerim quemquam eorum.
verses.english: Moses became very angry and said to the Lord: 'Do not accept their offerings! You know that I have never taken even a single donkey from them, nor have I ever harmed any of them.'

verses.latin: Dixitque Moyses ad Core: Tu et omnis congregatio tua state seorsum coram Domino, et Aaron cras seorsum.
verses.english: Moses then said to Korah: 'You and your entire congregation are to stand separately before the Lord tomorrow, and Aaron will also stand separately.'

verses.latin: Tollite singuli thuribula sua, et ponite incensum desuper, offerentes Domino ducenta quinquaginta thuribula: Aaron quoque teneat thuribulum suum.
verses.english: Let each one of you take his censer, put incense on it, and offer two hundred and fifty censers before the Lord. Aaron is also to hold his censer.

verses.latin: Cumque tulissent singuli thuribula, et posuissent ignem, superponens incensum, starent in introitu tabernaculi testimonii cum Moyse et Aaron,
verses.english: So each man took his censer, put fire in it, and then placed incense on top. They all stood at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, along with Moses and Aaron.

verses.latin: congregassetque Core adversum eos omnem multitudinem ad ostium tabernaculi,
verses.english: Korah had gathered the entire community against them at the entrance of the Tent.

verses.latin: descendit gloria Domini super omnem multitudinem.
verses.english: Then the glory of the Lord appeared over the entire community.

verses.latin: Et locutus est Dominus ad Moysen et Aaron, dicens:
verses.english: And the Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying:

verses.latin: Separate vos de medio multitudinis istius, ut eos repente deleam.
verses.english: 'Separate yourselves from the midst of this community, so that I may instantly destroy them.'

verses.latin: Ceciderunt illi proni in faciem, atque dixerunt: Fortissime Deus spirituum universæ carnis, num pro peccato unius, contra omnes irasceris?
verses.english: They both fell face down and said: 'Oh, most mighty God of the spirits of all humankind! Will you be angry with everyone for the sin of just one man?'

verses.latin: Locutus est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: The Lord then spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Præcipe universo populo ut separentur a tabernaculis Core et Dathan et Abiron.
verses.english: 'Command all the people to separate themselves from the tents of Korah, Dathan, and Abiram.'

verses.latin: Et dixit ad turbam: Recedite a tentoriis hominum impiorum, et nolite tangere quæ ad eos pertinent, ne involvamini in peccatis eorum.
verses.english: Moses then said to the crowd: 'Go away from the tents of these wicked men, and do not touch anything that belongs to them, so that you are not swept away in their sins.'

verses.latin: Steteruntque in omni latere a tabernaculis Core et Dathan et Abiron. Dathan vero et Abiron egressi stabant in introitu papilionum suorum cum uxoribus et liberis, omnique parvo et grandi familia.
verses.english: So the people moved away from the tents of Korah, Dathan, and Abiram on every side. Meanwhile, Dathan and Abiram had come out and were standing at the entrance of their own tents, along with their wives, their children, and all their young and old family members.

verses.latin: Et ait Moyses: In hoc scietis quod Dominus miserit me ut facerem universa quæ videtis, et non a meipso hæc excogitaverim:
verses.english: And Moses said: 'By this sign, you will know that the Lord has sent me to do all these things that you see, and that I have not devised them on my own authority.'

verses.latin: si communi more moriuntur hominum, et visitatione communi visitantur, non misit me Dominus:
verses.english: 'If these men die a natural death, the way all people die, and if they are punished by a common human affliction, then the Lord has truly not sent me.'

verses.latin: sin autem novam rem fecerit Dominus, aperiens terra os suum, et devorans illos atque omnia quæ ad illos pertinent, descenderintque vivi in inferos, scietis quoniam blasphemaverunt Dominum.
verses.english: 'But if the Lord does something completely new— if the earth opens its mouth and swallows them and everything that belongs to them, and they go down alive into the realm of the dead— then you will know for certain that these men have blasphemed the Lord.'

verses.latin: Statimque ut cessavit loqui, dirupta est terra sub pedibus eorum:
verses.english: Immediately, as soon as Moses finished speaking, the ground under their feet split apart.

verses.latin: et aperiens os suum, devoravit illos cum tabernaculis suis, et universa substantia eorum.
verses.english: The earth opened its mouth and swallowed them with their tents and all their possessions.

verses.latin: Descenderuntque illi vivi in infernum, clausitque eos terra, et perierunt de medio multitudinis.
verses.english: So they went down alive into the realm of the dead. The earth closed over them, and they perished from among the community.

verses.latin: Omnis etiam Israël, qui stabat per gyrum, hujus rei timens interitum, fugit, clamans: ne forte et nos devoret terra.
verses.english: All the people of Israel who stood around them, fearing this destruction, fled, crying out: 'Lest the earth swallow us too!'

verses.latin: Sed et ignis egressus a Domino, interfecit ducentos quinquaginta viros, qui offerebant incensum.
verses.english: But a fire also came out from the Lord and killed the two hundred and fifty men who were offering incense.

verses.latin: Locutus est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Præcipe Eleazaro filio Aaron sacerdotis, ut tollat thuribula quæ jacent in incendio, et ignem huc illucque dispergat, quoniam sanctificata sunt.
verses.english: 'Command Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, to take the censers that are lying in the fire, and scatter the fire from them here and there, because the censers have become holy.'

verses.latin: In mortibus enim peccatorum eorum, sanctificata sunt, et jube eos fabrefieri in laminas, et affigi altari, quia oblatum est incensum Domini, et sanctificatum est ut sint in signum filiis Israël.
verses.english: 'For they became holy because they were used by these sinners in their deaths. So order them to be hammered into thin plates and fastened to the altar. This is because the incense was offered before the Lord, and so it became holy, to serve as a sign to the sons of Israel.'

verses.latin: Tulit ergo Eleazar sacerdos thuribula ænea, in quibus obtulerant hi quos ignis Domini devoraverat, et extendit ea in laminas, affigens altari:
verses.english: So Eleazar the priest took the bronze censers which had been used by those men whom the Lord's fire had consumed, and he hammered them into thin plates and fastened them to the altar.

verses.latin: ut essent monimentum filiis Israël, ne quis accedere auderet alienus, id est, qui non est de semine Aaron, ad ponendum incensum Domino, ne simile quid ei contingeret, sicut Core et omni concioni ejus, loquente Domino ad Moysen.
verses.english: This was done to serve as a permanent reminder to the sons of Israel, so that no unauthorized person— meaning, anyone not from the lineage of Aaron— would dare to approach to offer incense before the Lord, lest a similar fate happen to him, just as it happened to Korah and his entire assembly, exactly as the Lord had told Moses.

verses.latin: Et locutus est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: The Lord then spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Praecipe Eleazaro filio Aaron sacerdotis, ut tollat turibula de incendio, et cinerem hinc spargat longius: quia sanctificata sunt
verses.english: Command Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, to take the censers from the burning place, and scatter the ashes far away from this place, because they have become holy.

verses.latin: in periculis animarum eorum, qui peccaverant, et propitiatus est Dominus.
verses.english: —for they put their lives in danger—those who had sinned. The Lord has shown His favor.

verses.latin: Fabricentque ex eis laminas, et affigant altari, eo quod oblatum sit in igne Domini, et sanctificatum, ac propterea sit in signum filiis Israel.
verses.english: And from these censers, they are to make thin plates and fasten them to the altar, because they were offered in the Lord's fire and made holy. Therefore, they will serve as a sign for the children of Israel.

verses.latin: Ne quis assumat alienus incensum adolere coram Domino, nec sit sicut Chore, et omnis concio ejus, quemadmodum locutus est Dominus.
verses.english: No unauthorized person may take up incense to burn before the Lord, nor may they become like Korah and all his company. The Lord had already spoken about this.

verses.latin: Praecepit ergo Eleazar sacerdos filio suo, ut tolleret turibula aenea, in quibus obtulerant hi quos ignis Domini combusserat: et extendens in laminas, affigeret altari,
verses.english: So Eleazar the priest commanded his son to take the bronze censers in which those whom the Lord's fire had consumed had offered their sacrifice. He was to flatten them into plates and fasten them to the altar.

verses.latin: ut essent monumentum filiis Israel, ne quis accedaverit alienigena, qui non est de stirpe Aaron, ad offerendum incensum Domino, ne similem pateretur Core, sicut locutus est Dominus ad Moysen.
verses.english: These were to be a memorial for the children of Israel, so that no outsider who is not from the lineage of Aaron would approach to offer incense to the Lord, lest he suffer a fate like Korah. This is what the Lord had said to Moses.

verses.latin: Murmuraverunt ergo omnis multitudo filiorum Israel postridie contra Moysen et Aaron, dicentes: Vos interfecistis populum Domini.
verses.english: Nevertheless, the entire congregation of the children of Israel complained against Moses and Aaron the next day, saying: "You have killed the Lord's people!"

verses.latin: Cumque concitata esset turba, et vidisset Moyses et Aaron concionem scissis tentoriis, velabant eos nubes, et apparebat gloria Domini.
verses.english: When the assembly had gathered against them, and Moses and Aaron saw the congregation's tents were being pulled down by the people, a cloud began to cover them, and the glory of the Lord appeared.

verses.latin: Et ingressi sunt Moyses et Aaron tabernaculum testimonii.
verses.english: Moses and Aaron then entered the tabernacle of testimony.

verses.latin: Et locutus est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Recedite de medio multitudinis istius, et statim delam ego eos. Cecideruntque in faciem suam.
verses.english: "Get away from the midst of this congregation, and I will destroy them immediately." Moses and Aaron fell on their faces in supplication.

verses.latin: Et dixit Moyses ad Aaron: Tolle turibulum, et hauri de igne altaris, projectum desuper, et injice incensum superpositum, et vade cito ad populum ut expies pro eis. Jam enim egressa est ira a Domino, et plaga desævit.
