verses.english: Moses then said to Aaron: "Take a censer and put fire from the altar upon it. Place incense on it, and go quickly to the people to make atonement for them. For the Lord's wrath has already gone out, and a plague is raging."

verses.latin: Cumque fecisset Aaron sicut dixerat Moyses, et cucurrisset ad mediam multitudinem, vidit jam cœpisse plagam in populo. Et succedens obtulit incensum,
verses.english: Aaron did as Moses had said, and he ran into the midst of the congregation. He saw that the plague had already begun among the people. He then offered the incense, performing atonement.

verses.latin: et stans inter mortuos et vivas, oravit pro eis. Et impedita est plaga.
verses.english: And standing between the dead and the living, he prayed for them. And the plague was stopped.

verses.latin: Et quatuordecim millia hominum et septingenti perierunt foras præter eos, qui perierant in seditione Chore.
verses.english: But fourteen thousand seven hundred people had already perished, in addition to those who had died in Korah's rebellion.

verses.latin: Reversusque est Aaron ad Moysen ad ostium tabernaculi testimonii, postquam retenta erat plaga.
verses.english: Aaron then returned to Moses at the entrance of the tabernacle of testimony, after the plague had been stopped.

verses.latin: Locutus est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Loquere ad filios Israel, et accipe ab eis virgas singulas per cognationes suas, a cunctis principibus tribuum virgas duodecim, et nomen uniuscujusque scribes super virgam suam.
verses.english: "Speak to the children of Israel and take from them one rod for each of their ancestral tribes, from all the leaders of their tribes, twelve rods in total. You are to write each man's name on his rod.

verses.latin: Nomen autem Aaron super virgam Levi scribes: unusquisque princeps cognationum pro tribu sua virgam dabit.
verses.english: But you are to write Aaron's name on the rod for the tribe of Levi. Each leader of the ancestral tribes will give one rod for his tribe.

verses.latin: Et pones eas in tabernaculo testimonii coram fœderis testimonio, ubi loquar ad te.
verses.english: You are to place these rods in the tabernacle of testimony, before the ark of the covenant—where I speak with you.

verses.latin: Quamcumque virgam germinare videris, ipsam elegi mihi, ut quiescere faciam de me querelas filiorum Israel, quibus adversum vos murmurant.
verses.english: The rod that I see sprout, that is the one I have chosen for myself, to put an end to the complaints of the children of Israel that they are grumbling against you.

verses.latin: Locutusque est Moyses ad filios Israel: et dederunt ei omnes principes virgas singulas per tribus et cognationes suas: et fuerunt duodecim virgae absque virga Aaron.
verses.english: Moses then spoke to the children of Israel, and all the leaders gave him a single rod for each of their tribes and ancestral lines. There were twelve rods, not counting Aaron's rod.

verses.latin: Cumque posuisset Moyses virgas coram Domino in tabernaculo testimonii,
verses.english: Moses then placed the rods before the Lord in the tabernacle of testimony.

verses.latin: sequenti die reversus invenit germinasse virgam Aaron in domo Levi: et pullulaverant folia, et de botris jam calices eruperant in flores, qui mitescent in amygdalas.
verses.english: The next day, when Moses returned, he found that Aaron's rod, for the house of Levi, had sprouted. It had put forth leaves, and from its clusters, flowers had already burst forth, which would ripen into almonds.

verses.latin: Protulitque Moyses omnes virgas de conspectu Domini ad omnes filios Israel: et viderunt, et receperunt singuli virgas suas.
verses.english: Moses then brought out all the rods from the presence of the Lord to all the children of Israel. They all saw them, and each man took back his own rod.

verses.latin: Dixitque Dominus ad Moysen: Refer virgam Aaron in tabernaculum testimonii, ut servetur ibi in signum rebellibus filiis Israel, et quiescant ultra querelae eorum a me, ne moriantur.
verses.english: The Lord then said to Moses: "Return Aaron's rod to the tabernacle of testimony, so that it may be kept there as a sign for the rebellious children of Israel. This way, their complaints against Me will cease, and they will not die."

verses.latin: Fecitque Moyses sicut præceperat Dominus.
verses.english: And Moses did exactly as the Lord had commanded him.

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Aaron: Tu et filii tui, et domus patris tui tecum, portabitis iniquitatem sanctuarii: et tu et filii tui simul sustinebitis peccata sacerdotii vestri.
verses.english: The Lord then spoke to Aaron: "You and your sons, and your father's house with you, will bear the responsibility for any offense against the sanctuary. And you and your sons together will bear the responsibility for the sins of your priesthood."

verses.latin: Sed et fratres tuos de tribu Levi, et sceptro patris tui, sume tecum, et sint juncti, et ministrent tibi. Tu autem et filii tui ministrabitis in tabernaculo testimonii.
verses.english: "Also, take your brethren from the tribe of Levi, from your ancestral line, with you. They are to be joined to you and serve you. But you and your sons are the ones who will serve in the tabernacle of testimony itself."

verses.latin: Excubabuntque ad præcepta tua, et quicquid ad cultum pertinet tabernaculi: ita dumtaxat ut ad vasa sanctuarii et altaris non accedant, ne et illi moriantur et vos.
verses.english: "They will keep watch, according to your commands, over everything that pertains to the service of the tabernacle. However, they must not approach the vessels of the sanctuary or the altar, lest both they and you die."

verses.latin: Sintque tecum, et excubent in custodiis tabernaculi, et in omnibus cæremoniis ejus. Alienigena non miscebitur vobis.
verses.english: "They are to be with you and keep watch over the duties of the tabernacle and all its ceremonies. No unauthorized person may join you."

verses.latin: Excubate in custodiis sanctuarii, et in officio altaris: ne oriatur indignatio super filios Israel.
verses.english: "You yourselves are to keep watch over the duties of the sanctuary and the service of the altar, so that wrath may not again arise against the children of Israel."

verses.latin: Ecce ego dedi vobis fratres vestros Levitas de medio filiorum Israel, et tradidi donum Domino, ut serviant in ministeriis tabernaculi fœderis.
verses.english: "Look, I have given you your brethren the Levites from among the children of Israel. I have given them as a gift to the Lord, so that they may serve in the ministries of the tabernacle of the covenant."

verses.latin: Tu autem et filii tui custodite sacerdotium vestrum, et omnia quæ ad ritum altaris et velaminis pertinent: et universa quæ intra sanctuarium fiunt, a solis sacerdotibus ministrabuntur. Alienigena non accedet ad vos.
verses.english: "But you and your sons are to keep your priesthood, and all that pertains to the ritual of the altar and the veil. All things that are done within the sanctuary will be ministered by priests alone. No unauthorized person will approach you."

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Aaron: Ecce ego dedi tibi custodiam primitiarum mearum. Omnia quæ sanctificantur a filiis Israel, tibi tradidi et filiis tuis pro officio vestro, jure perpetuo.
verses.english: The Lord then spoke to Aaron: "Look, I have given you the responsibility for My sacred offerings. All that is set apart as holy by the children of Israel, I have given to you and your sons for your duty, by a perpetual right."

verses.latin: Hæc ergo accipies de his quæ sanctificantur et offeruntur mihi. Omnia quæ separantur a filiis Israel, tibi dedi et filiis tuis ac filiabus, jure perpetuo. Sanctissima comedetis,
verses.english: "Therefore, these are what you will receive from those things that are consecrated and offered to Me. All that is set apart by the children of Israel, I have given to you and your sons and daughters, by a perpetual right. You are to eat the most holy portions."

verses.latin: in sanctuario comedes ea: masculus tantum comedet ex eis, quia sancta sunt tibi.
verses.english: "You are to eat them in the sanctuary. Only males may eat from them, because they are holy to you."

verses.latin: Primitias autem separatas de cunctis muneribus filiorum Israel, atque oblationibus et donariis ad te et ad filios tuos et filias tuas jure perpetuo dedi. Omnis qui mundus est in domo tua, comedet ex eis.
verses.english: "But the separated firstfruits of all the gifts of the children of Israel, and their offerings and donations, I have given to you and to your sons and your daughters by a perpetual right. Everyone in your household who is clean may eat from them."

verses.latin: Omne optimum olei, et vini, et frumenti, quidquid offerunt Domino, tibi dedi.
verses.english: "All the best oil, and wine, and grain, whatever they offer to the Lord, I have given to you."

verses.latin: Dixitque Dominus ad Aaron : Tu, et filii tui, et domus patris tui tecum, portabitis iniquitatem sanctuarii : et tu, et filii tui simul, sustinebitis peccata sacerdotii vestri.
verses.english: The Lord then spoke to Aaron, saying: "You, your sons, and your entire ancestral house with you, will bear the moral responsibility for the purity of the sanctuary. And you and your sons together will be accountable for the sins of your priesthood."

verses.latin: Sed et fratres tuos de tribu Levi, et sceptrum patris tui, sume tecum, et sint juncti, et ministrent tibi : tu autem et filii tui ministrabitis in tabernaculo testimonii.
verses.english: "But also take your brothers from the tribe of Levi—your ancestral tribe—with you. They are to be joined with you and minister to you. However, you and your sons alone will minister in the Tabernacle of the Testimony."

verses.latin: Excubabuntque ad præcepta tua, et ad cuncta opera tabernaculi : ita dumtaxat ut ad vasa sanctuarii et altaris non accedant, ne et illi moriantur, et vos simul.
verses.english: "They will keep watch, obeying your instructions and performing all the work of the Tabernacle. However, they are strictly forbidden from approaching the sacred vessels of the sanctuary or the altar, lest they die, and you too, by allowing such a profanation."

verses.latin: Sintque tecum, et excubent in custodiis tabernaculi, et in cunctis cæremoniis ejus. Alienigena non accedet ad vos.
verses.english: "They will be with you and keep watch over the duties of the Tabernacle and all its ceremonies. No unauthorized person—no one not appointed for this sacred service—may approach you."

verses.latin: Excubate in custodiis sanctuarii et in officio altaris : et irascetur ultra indignatio mea super filios Israël.
verses.english: "You are to keep watch over the duties of the sanctuary and the service of the altar. Do this so that My righteous anger may no longer break out against the children of Israel."

verses.latin: Ego enim dedi vobis fratres vestros Levitas de medio filiorum Israël, et tradidi donum Domino, ut serviant in ministeriis tabernaculi fœderis :
verses.english: "For I Myself have given your brothers, the Levites, from among the children of Israel. I have handed them over as a special gift to the Lord, so that they may serve in the ministries of the Tabernacle of the Covenant."

verses.latin: Tu autem et filii tui custodite sacerdotium vestrum pro omni cultu altaris et veli, et quicquid intra hæc est : per ministerium tradidi vobis sacerdotium. Alienigena qui applicatus fuerit, morietur.
verses.english: "But you and your sons are to guard your priesthood for all the service of the altar and the veil, and everything that is within these sacred spaces. Through this consecrated service, I have given you the priesthood. Any unauthorized person who approaches these sacred things will surely die."

verses.latin: Locutus est Dominus ad Aaron : Ecce dedi tibi custodiam primitiarum benedictionum mearum, omnia quæ sanctificantur a filiis Israël, tibi et filiis tuis pro officio tribuens sempiternæ unctionis.
verses.english: The Lord then spoke further to Aaron, saying: "Behold, I have given you the charge over the first-offerings of My blessings—all things consecrated by the children of Israel. I allot these to you and your sons by virtue of your perpetually consecrated office."

verses.latin: Hæc igitur erunt quæ accipies de his quæ sanctificantur et oblata fuerint Domino. Omnis oblatio, et omne sacrificium, et quicquid pro peccato atque delicto redditur mihi, et ad sancta sanctorum pertinet, tuum erit et filiorum tuorum.
verses.english: "Therefore, these are the things you will receive from those that are consecrated and offered to the Lord: every offering, every sacrifice, and whatever is rendered to Me for sin and for trespass, and whatever belongs to the most holy things. This will be yours and your sons'."

verses.latin: In sanctuario comedetis ea : masculus tantum comedet ex eis, quia consecrata sunt tibi.
verses.english: "You will eat these in the sanctuary. Only males may eat of them, because they are consecrated specifically for you."

verses.latin: Primitias quoque donorum tuorum, atque omnium quæ offerunt filii Israël, ego dedi tibi et filiis tuis et filiabus tuis jure perpetuo. Qui mundus est in domo tua, comedet ex eis.
verses.english: "Also, the first-offerings of all your gifts and everything the children of Israel offer, I have given to you and your sons and your daughters by a perpetual right. Anyone who is ritually clean in your household may eat of them."

verses.latin: Omnem medullam olei, et vini, et frumenti, quicquid offerunt Domino in primitiis, tibi dedi.
verses.english: "All the choicest part of the oil, and of the wine, and of the grain—whatever they offer to the Lord as first-fruits—I have given to you."

verses.latin: Quicquid primum nascetur in terra, et affertur Domino, tuum erit : omne quod ex his mundum est in domo tua, vescetur.
verses.english: "Whatever first grows in the land and is brought to the Lord will be yours. Everyone in your household who is ritually clean may eat of it."

verses.latin: Omne anatema, quicquid fuerit consecratum in Israël, tuum erit.
verses.english: "Every devoted thing—whatever has been consecrated to utter destruction or exclusion from common use in Israel—will be yours."

verses.latin: Omne quod aperit vulvam de cuncta carne, quam offerunt Domino, sive de hominibus, sive de pecoribus, et primogenita virorum et jumentorum, tua erunt.
verses.english: "Everything that opens the womb of all flesh that they offer to the Lord, whether of humans or of animals, and the firstborn of men and of beasts, will be yours."

verses.latin: Pro primogenitis autem hominum suscipies pretium, et jumentorum immundorum pecunia redimentur, unius anni a mense, sex siclis argenti, pondere sanctuarii. Siclus habet viginti obolos.
verses.english: "However, for the firstborn of humans, you must receive a redemption price. Unclean animals will be redeemed with money: from one month old, at a value of six shekels of silver, according to the standard weight of the sanctuary. A shekel has twenty *obols*—or *gerahs*."

verses.latin: Primogenita vero bovis et ovis et capræ non facies redimi, quia consecrata sunt Domino : sanguinem tantum eorum fundes super altare, et carnes comedetis.
verses.english: "But the firstborn of an ox, or a sheep, or a goat, you shall not have redeemed, because they are consecrated to the Lord. You will only pour their blood upon the altar, and you yourselves may eat their meat."

verses.latin: Et hoc erit vobis sanctificatum : sicut pectus consecratum, et armus dexter.
verses.english: "And this meat will be consecrated to you, just like the consecrated breast and the right shoulder are given to you."

verses.latin: Omnes primitias sanctuarii, quas offerunt filii Israël Domino, dedi tibi et filiis tuis ac filiabus tuis jure perpetuo. Pactum salis est sempiternum coram Domino, tibi ac filiis tuis.
verses.english: "All the consecrated first-offerings that the children of Israel offer to the Lord, I have given to you and your sons and your daughters by a perpetual right. This is an everlasting covenant of salt—a sacred, unbreakable agreement—before the Lord, for you and your sons."

verses.latin: Dixitque Dominus ad Aaron : In terra eorum nihil possidebitis, nec habebitis partem inter eos : Ego pars et hæreditas tua in medio filiorum Israël.
verses.english: The Lord also spoke to Aaron: "You will possess nothing in their land, nor will you have any inheritance among them, for I am your portion and your inheritance among the children of Israel."

verses.latin: Filiis autem Levi dedi omnes decimas Israël in possessionem, pro ministerio quo serviunt mihi in tabernaculo fœderis :
verses.english: "But to the children of Levi, I have given all the tithes in Israel as their inheritance, for the service by which they minister to Me in the Tabernacle of the Covenant."

verses.latin: ut non accedant ultra filii Israël ad tabernaculum, nec peccatum incurrant mortis.
verses.english: "This is so that the children of Israel may no longer approach the Tabernacle directly and thereby incur the sin that brings death."

verses.latin: Soli Levitae servient mihi in tabernaculo fœderis, et portabunt peccata sua : sempiternum erit religiosum institutum in generationibus vestris. Nihil aliud possidebunt,
verses.english: "Only the Levites will serve Me in the Tabernacle of the Covenant, and they will bear their own sins related to this service—meaning they will be held accountable for any failures in their duties. This will be an everlasting sacred ordinance throughout your generations. They will possess nothing else as property, for their unique role,"

verses.latin: decimarum oblatione contenti, quas in usus eorum et necessaria separavi.
verses.english: "They will be content with the offering of tithes, which I have set apart for their use and necessities."

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens :
verses.english: The Lord then spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Præcipe Levitis, atque denuntia : Cum acceperitis a filiis Israël decimas, quas in usus vestros dedi vobis, separetis ex eis primitias Domino, id est, decimam partem decimæ :
verses.english: "Command the Levites, and declare to them: When you receive the tithes from the children of Israel, which I have given to you for your needs, you must set apart from them a first-offering for the Lord. This is to be the tenth part of the tithe you received."

verses.latin: ut reputetur vobis in oblationem primitivæ frugis, tam de areis, quam de torcularibus.
verses.english: "This will be reckoned to you as an offering of first-fruits, just as if it were from the threshing floor or from the winepress."

verses.latin: Et de cunctis quorum accipitis primitias, offerte Domino, et date Aaron sacerdoti.
verses.english: "Thus, from all the first-offerings that you receive, present a first-offering to the Lord, and give it to Aaron the priest."

verses.latin: Omnia quæ sanctificantur de donariis et de decimis, in optimo quoque et electo, sanctificabis Domino.
verses.english: "From all the sacred gifts and tithes, you will consecrate to the Lord the choicest and the very best part."

verses.latin: Dicesque ad eos : Si præclara et pinguia comederitis ex eis, non peccabitis : quia nec vos, nec filii vestri, contaminabimini ex eo, quod de re sacra comedistis.
verses.english: "And you are to say to them: 'If you eat the rich and choice portions from these offerings, you will not incur sin, because neither you nor your sons will be defiled by eating that which is sacred, provided you have properly offered the Lord's choicest portion beforehand.'"

verses.latin: Et comedetis ea in omnibus locis vestris, tam vos, quam familiæ vestræ : quia merces est operis vestri pro tabernaculo testimonii.
verses.english: "You and your households may eat these offerings in any of your dwelling places, because it is your reward for your service in the Tabernacle of the Testimony."

verses.latin: Et non peccabitis super hoc, ne polluatis primitias filiorum Israël, quæ Domino sanctificantur : et moriemini.
verses.english: "You will not incur sin concerning this matter—meaning eating the portion given to you—provided you do not profane the first-offerings of the children of Israel, which are consecrated to the Lord. If you profane them, you will surely die."

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen et Aaron, dicens:
verses.english: The Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron, giving them this instruction:

verses.latin: Ista est lex sacrificii, quam constituit Dominus: Praecipe filiis Israël, ut adducant tibi vaccam rufam, immaculatam, in qua nulla sit macula, nec portaverit jugum.
verses.english: “This is the ordinance for a specific offering which the Lord has established: Command the children of Israel to bring you a red heifer that is without blemish, and which has no imperfection, and which has never had a yoke placed upon it.

verses.latin: Tradetisque eam Eleazaro sacerdoti, qui eductam extra castra, immolabit in conspectu omnium.
verses.english: And you shall give it to Eleazar the priest, who shall lead the heifer outside the camp and sacrifice it in the sight of everyone.

verses.latin: Et tingens digitum in sanguine ejus, asperget contra fores tabernaculi septem vicibus.
verses.english: And Eleazar will dip his finger into its blood and sprinkle some of the blood seven times towards the front of the Tent of Meeting.

verses.latin: Et comburet vaccam in conspectu ejus, pellis, et carnes, et sanguis, ac fimum ignis vorabit.
verses.english: Then, in Eleazar’s sight, the heifer shall be burned completely: its hide, its flesh, its blood, and its dung shall all be consumed by the fire.

verses.latin: Tollensque sacerdos lignum cedrinum, et hyssopum, coccumque bis tinctum, mittet in ignem qui vaccam comburit.
verses.english: And the priest shall take cedar wood, hyssop, and scarlet yarn dyed twice, and throw them into the fire that is burning the heifer.

verses.latin: Et tunc lotis vestibus, et corpore suo aqua, ingredietur in castra, et immundus erit usque ad vesperum.
verses.english: Afterward, the priest must wash his clothes and bathe his body with water; only then may he enter the camp. However, he will remain ritually unclean until evening.

verses.latin: Sed et qui combusserit eam, lavabit vestimenta sua, et corpus aqua, et immundus erit usque ad vesperum.
verses.english: Similarly, the one who burned the heifer must also wash his clothes and bathe his body with water, and he too will remain ritually unclean until evening.

verses.latin: Colliget autem vir mundus cineres vaccae, et effundet eos extra castra in loco purissimo, ut sint synagogae filiorum Israël in custodiam aquae aspersionis: quia pro peccato vacca combusta est.
verses.english: Then, a ritually clean man shall gather the ashes of the heifer and pour them out outside the camp in a very clean place. These ashes are to be kept by the congregation of the children of Israel to prepare the water of purification for sprinkling—because the heifer was burned as a sin offering to remove uncleanness.

verses.latin: Cumque laverit qui portaverit cineres, vestimenta sua, immundus erit usque ad vesperum. Habebunt hoc filii Israël, et advenae qui peregrinantur apud eos, jure perpetuo.
verses.english: And the man who carried the ashes must wash his clothes, and he too will be ritually unclean until evening. This ordinance shall be a perpetual statute for the children of Israel and for the foreigners who live among them.

verses.latin: Qui tetigerit cadaver hominis, et propter hoc septem diebus immundus fuerit,
verses.english: Whoever touches the dead body of a human being will become ritually unclean for seven days because of that contact.

verses.latin: aspergatur hac aqua die tertio et septimo, et sic mundabitur. Si die tertio aspersus non fuerit, septimo non purgabitur.
verses.english: Such a person must purify himself with this water on the third day and on the seventh day; only then will he be clean. If he is not purified on the third day, then he will not be made clean on the seventh day either.

verses.latin: Omnis qui tetigerit humani corporis morticinum, et aspersus hac commixtione non fuerit, polluet tabernaculum Domini, et peribit de Israël: quia aqua purificationis non est aspersus, immundus erit, et manebit immunditia ejus super eum.
verses.english: Anyone who touches a dead human body and does not purify himself with this mixture of water will defile the Lord’s Tent of Meeting and must be cut off from Israel. Because the water of purification was not sprinkled upon him, he remains ritually unclean, and his uncleanness stays upon him.

verses.latin: Ista est lex hominis qui mortuus fuerit in tabernaculo: Omnes qui ingrediuntur tentorium illius, et universa vasa quae ibi sunt, polluta erunt septem diebus.
verses.english: This is the law concerning a man who dies within a tent: Everyone who enters that tent, and all the objects within it, will become ritually defiled for seven days.

verses.latin: Vas quod non habuerit operculum nec ligaturam desuper, immundum erit.
verses.english: Any open vessel that does not have a lid or a covering sealed upon it will also become ritually unclean.

verses.latin: Si quis in agro mortuo aut interfecto, vel quocumque modo mortuo tetigerit, septem diebus immundus erit.
verses.english: If anyone in the open field touches a person who has died naturally, or a person who has been killed, or touches someone dead in any other manner, that person will be ritually unclean for seven days.

verses.latin: Et tollet de cinere combustionis atque peccati, et mittet in aquam vivam in vas:
verses.english: For the unclean person, some of the ashes from the burnt offering made for sin must be taken and mixed with running spring water in a vessel.

verses.latin: In quo cum homo mundus tinxerit hyssopum, asperget ex eo omne tentorium, et cunctam supellectilem, et homines qui illic fuerint, et qui morticinum tetigerint, sive humatum, sive interfectum, sive ossa hominis, sive sepulcrum.
verses.english: Then a ritually clean person shall dip a sprig of hyssop into this mixture and sprinkle it on the tent and all its furnishings, and on the people who were in the tent, and on anyone who touched a dead body—whether it was buried, or killed, or merely human bones, or a grave.

verses.latin: Atque ita mundus asperget immundum die tertio et septimo: et expiatus die septimo, lavabit et se et vestimenta sua, et mundus erit vesperi.
verses.english: And the ritually clean person shall sprinkle the unclean person on the third day and on the seventh day. After being purified on the seventh day, the unclean person must wash his own clothes and bathe himself, and then he will be ritually clean by evening.

verses.latin: Si quis hoc ritu purificatus non fuerit, peribit de medio ecclesiæ, eo quod fanum Domini polluerit, et aqua purificationis non sit aspersus: immundus est.
verses.english: But if anyone who is ritually unclean is not purified by this prescribed rite, that person will be cut off from the assembly of the people. This is because he has defiled the Lord’s Holy Sanctuary by remaining unclean, and the water of purification was not sprinkled on him. Such a person remains ritually unclean.

verses.latin: Erit hoc præceptum legitimum sempiternum. Qui aspergit aquas, lavabit vestimenta sua. Omnis qui tetigerit aquas purificationis, immundus erit usque ad vesperum.
verses.english: This shall be an enduring, lawful commandment. The person who sprinkles the water of purification must wash his clothes. And anyone who merely touches the water of purification will become ritually unclean until evening.

verses.latin: Omne quod tetigerit immundus, immundum faciet: et anima quæ tetigerit, immunda erit usque ad vesperum.
verses.english: Whatever the ritually unclean person touches will become ritually unclean; and any person who touches that unclean person will also become ritually unclean until evening.

verses.latin: Veneruntque filii Israël et omnis multitudo in desertum Sin mense primo, et mansit populus in Cades. Mortuaque est ibi Maria et sepulta.
verses.english: The children of Israel, the whole multitude of them, entered the desert of Sin in the first month. The people settled in Kadesh, and there, Mary—the sister of Moses and Aaron—died and was buried.

verses.latin: Cumque indigeret aqua multitudo, convenerunt adversum Moysen et Aaron:
verses.english: But when the multitude needed water, they gathered together against Moses and Aaron.

verses.latin: et jurgati sunt contra Moysen, atque dixerunt: Utinam perissemus inter fratres nostros coram Domino.
verses.english: They argued with Moses and said, "We wish we had died with our brothers before the Lord!"

verses.latin: Cur eduxistis ecclesiam Domini in solitudinem, ut et nos et nostra pecora moriamur?
verses.english: Why did you bring the assembly of the Lord into this wilderness, for us and our livestock to die here?

verses.latin: Quare de Ægypto fecistis nos ascendere, et adduxistis in locum istum pessimum, qui seri non potest, qui nec ficum, nec uvas, nec mala granata, nec aquam habet?
verses.english: Why did you make us leave Egypt and bring us to this terrible place? It is a place where nothing can be sown, and there are no fig trees, no grapevines, no pomegranates, and no water!

verses.latin: Abieruntque Moyses et Aaron, dimissa multitudine, ad tabernaculum fœderis, et proni jacuerunt in terram, clamantes ad Dominum, atque dicentes: Domine Deus, ad te clamavimus, dicentes: Perii populus tuus. Et apparuit gloria Domini super eos.
verses.english: So Moses and Aaron left the multitude and went to the Tent of the Covenant. They fell face down on the ground, crying out to the Lord and saying, "Lord God, we have cried out to You, saying: Your people are perishing!" And the glory of the Lord appeared over them.

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Tolle virgam, et congrega populum, tu et Aaron frater tuus, et loquimini ad petram coram illis, et dabis eis aquas. Cumque eduxeris aquam de petra, bibet omnis multitudo et jumenta eorum.
verses.english: Take the staff, and gather the people—you and Aaron your brother. Speak to the rock in front of them, and it will give them water. When you bring forth water from the rock, the whole multitude and their livestock will drink.

verses.latin: Tulit igitur Moyses virgam de conspectu Domini, sicut ei præceperat.
verses.english: So Moses took the staff from before the Lord, just as the Lord had commanded him.

verses.latin: Congregatisque turbis ante petram, dixit eis: Audite, rebelles et increduli: Num de petra hac vobis aquam poterimus ejicere?
verses.english: Then, after gathering the crowds before the rock, Moses said to them, "Listen, you rebels and unbelievers! Do you think we can bring water out for you from this rock?"

verses.latin: Cumque elevasset Moyses manum, et percussisset silicem virga bis, egressæ sunt aquæ plurimæ, ita ut biberet populus et jumenta.
verses.english: Then Moses lifted his hand and struck the rock with his staff twice. A great abundance of water gushed out, so much that the people and their livestock drank.

verses.latin: Dixitque Dominus ad Moysen et Aaron: Quia non credidistis mihi, ut sanctificaretis me coram filiis Israël, non introducetis hos populos in terram, quam dabo eis.
verses.english: And the Lord said to Moses and Aaron, "Because you did not trust Me enough to show My holiness before the children of Israel, you will not lead these people into the land that I will give them."

verses.latin: Hæc est aqua contradictionis, ubi jurgati sunt filii Israël contra Dominum, et sanctificatus est in eis.
verses.english: This is the Water of Contradiction, where the children of Israel argued against the Lord, and where His holiness was manifested among them.

verses.latin: Misit interea Moyses nuntios de Cades ad regem Edom, qui dicerent: Hæc mandat frater tuus Israël: Nosti omnem laborem qui apprehendit nos:
verses.english: In the meantime, Moses sent messengers from Kadesh to the king of Edom to say this: "Your brother Israel sends this message: You know all the hardship that has come upon us."

verses.latin: Quomodo descenderunt patres nostri in Ægyptum, et habitavimus ibi multo tempore, afflixeruntque nos Ægyptii et patres nostros:
verses.english: Our fathers went down into Egypt, and we lived there for a long time. The Egyptians afflicted both us and our fathers.

verses.latin: et quomodo clamavimus ad Dominum, et exaudivit nos, et misit angelum, qui eduxit nos de Ægypto: et ecce nunc in urbe Cades positi sumus in extremis finibus tuis.
verses.english: And we cried out to the Lord, and He heard us and sent an angel who led us out of Egypt. Now, here we are, in the city of Kadesh, right at the edge of your territory.

verses.latin: Obsecramus, ut nobis transire liceat per terram tuam. Non ibimus per agros, nec per vineas: non bibemus aquas de puteis tuis, sed gradiemur via publica, nec ad dextram declinabimus, nec ad sinistram, donec transeamus terminos tuos.
verses.english: We beg you, allow us to pass through your land. We will not go through the fields or vineyards; we will not drink water from your wells. We will travel only on the public road and will not turn right or left until we have passed through your borders.

verses.latin: Cui respondit Edom: Non transibis per terram meam, alioquin armatus occurram tibi.
verses.english: Edom answered him, "You shall not pass through my land; otherwise, I will come out against you with weapons."

verses.latin: Dixeruntque filii Israël: Per tritam gradiemur viam: et si aquam tuam biberimus nos et pecora nostra, dabimus tibi pretium: tantum ut nobis liceat transire velociter.
verses.english: And the children of Israel said, "We will go along the beaten path. And if we or our livestock drink any of your water, we will pay you for it. We only ask that you let us pass through quickly."

verses.latin: At ille respondit: Non habebis facultatem transeundi. Statimque egressus est obviam eis cum infinita multitudine, et manu forti.
verses.english: But Edom replied, "You will not be allowed to pass." And immediately, he came out to meet them with a vast army and great strength.

verses.latin: Nec voluit pati Edom, ut transiret Israël per fines suos: reversusque est Israël ab eo.
verses.english: Edom refused to let Israel pass through his territory, so Israel turned away from him.

verses.latin: Cumque castra movissent de Cades, venerunt in montem Hor, qui est in finibus terræ Edom.
verses.english: After they moved their camp from Kadesh, they came to Mount Hor, which is on the border of the land of Edom.

verses.latin: Ubi locutus est Dominus ad Moysen et Aaron in monte Hor in terminis terræ Edom, dicens:
verses.english: There, on Mount Hor, at the borders of the land of Edom, the Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying:

verses.latin: Adsume Aaron, et congrega illum ad populos suos. Non enim intrabit terram quam dedi filiis Israël, eo quod incredulus fuerit ori meo ad aquas contradictionis.
verses.english: Take Aaron and gather him to his people—meaning, he will die. For he will not enter the land that I have given to the children of Israel, because he was disobedient to My command at the Water of Contradiction.

verses.latin: Tolle Aaron et filium ejus Eleazar, et duc eos in montem Hor:
verses.english: Take Aaron and his son Eleazar, and lead them up to Mount Hor.

verses.latin: cumque nudaveris patrem veste sua, indues Eleazarum filium ejus. Aaron vero aggregabitur ad populos suos et morietur ibi.
verses.english: When you have stripped the father of his vestments, dress his son Eleazar in them. Aaron will then be gathered to his people—he will die there.

verses.latin: Fecit Moyses sicut præceperat Dominus coram omni multitudine: ascenditque in montem Hor.
verses.english: Moses did just as the Lord had commanded, in front of the whole multitude, and they went up Mount Hor.

verses.latin: Cumque exuvisset Aaron vestimentis suis, induit Eleazarum filium ejus.
verses.english: And when Moses stripped Aaron of his garments, he dressed his son Eleazar in them.

verses.latin: Aaron autem in montis supercilio mortuus est: descenditque Moyses et Eleazar de monte.
verses.english: Aaron died there, on the summit of the mountain. Then Moses and Eleazar came down from the mountain.

verses.latin: Cumque audisset Chananæus rex Arad, qui habitabat ad meridiem, venisse Israel per viam exploratorum, pugnavit contra eum, et vicit in parte.
verses.english: When the Canaanite king of Arad, who lived in the south, heard that Israel was coming by the way of the spies, he fought against them and gained a partial victory over them.

verses.latin: Vovit itaque Israel votum Domino, et ait: Si tradideris populum istum in manu mea, delebo urbes eorum.
verses.english: So Israel made a solemn vow to the Lord and said, 'If You deliver this people into my hand, I will utterly destroy their cities.'

verses.latin: Audivitque Dominus preces Israel, et tradidit Chananæum, quem interfecit ille et urbes ejus: et vocavit nomen loci illius Horma, id est, Anathema.
verses.english: And the Lord heard Israel's prayers and delivered the Canaanites to them. Israel utterly destroyed them and their cities, and they named that place Hormah, which means 'utterly destroyed and consecrated to God'.

verses.latin: Profectique sunt de monte Hor per viam quæ ducit ad Mare Rubrum, ut circuirent terram Edom. Et cœpit tædere populum itineris et laboris.
verses.english: And they set out from Mount Hor, taking the road that leads to the Red Sea, in order to go around the land of Edom. The people became impatient due to the long journey and the hardships.

verses.latin: Et loquens contra Deum et Moysen, ait: Cur eduxisti nos de Ægypto ut moreremur in solitudine? deest panis, non sunt aquæ: anima nostra jam nauseat super cibis his levissimis.
verses.english: And speaking against God and against Moses, they said, 'Why have you led us out of Egypt, only for us to die in this wasteland? There is no bread here, and no water. Our souls are disgusted by this very light food' —referring to the manna God miraculously provided.

verses.latin: Quam ob rem immisit Dominus in populum ignitos serpentes, qui mordebant eos, et plurimi interierunt ex Israel.
verses.english: For this reason, the Lord sent fiery serpents among the people, which bit them, and many of the Israelites died.

verses.latin: Venit ergo populus ad Moysen, et ait: Peccavimus, quia locuti sumus contra Dominum et te: ora ut auferat a nobis serpentes. Oravitque Moyses pro populo.
verses.english: Therefore, the people came to Moses and said, 'We have sinned, because we have spoken against the Lord and against you. Pray that He may take away these serpents from us.' And Moses prayed for the people.

verses.latin: Et locutus est Dominus ad eum: Fac serpentem æneum, et pone eum pro signo: qui percussus aspexerit eum, vivet.
verses.english: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying, 'Make a bronze serpent, and set it up as a standard. Whoever is bitten, when he looks at it, will live.'

verses.latin: Fecit ergo Moyses serpentem æneum, et exaltavit eum pro signo: quem cum aspicerent percussi, sanabantur.
verses.english: So Moses made a bronze serpent and set it up as a standard. When those who were bitten looked at it, they were healed.

verses.latin: Profectique filii Israel, castrametati sunt in Oboth.
verses.english: And the children of Israel set out and encamped in Oboth.

verses.latin: Unde egressi, fixerunt tentoria in Jeabarim, in solitudine quæ respicit Moab contra orientalem plagam.
verses.english: From there, they journeyed and pitched their tents in Ije-Abarim, in the wilderness that faces Moab, towards the eastern side.

verses.latin: Et inde profecti, venerunt in torum Zared.
verses.english: And from there, they set out and came to the valley of Zered.

verses.latin: Quo egressi, castrametati sunt trans Arnon, quæ est in deserto, et profluit de finibus Amorrhæi. Siquidem Arnon est terminus Moab, et inter Madianitas atque Amorrhæos.
verses.english: From there they departed and encamped beyond the Arnon River, which is in the wilderness and flows from the border of the Amorites. For the Arnon is the border of Moab, lying between the Midianites and the Amorites.

verses.latin: Ideo dicitur in libro bellorum Domini: Sicut fecit in Mari Rubro, sic in torrentibus Arnon.
verses.english: Therefore, it is said in the book of the Wars of the Lord: 'As He did at the Red Sea, so He did at the torrents of Arnon.'

verses.latin: Fluenta torrentium incurvaverunt ut caderent in terram urbium, et tenderentur usque ad fines Moab.
verses.english: The channels of the torrents curved down to the land of the cities, extending all the way to the borders of Moab.

verses.latin: Deinceps inde venerunt in puteum: hic est puteus de quo locutus est Dominus ad Moysen: Congrega populum, et dabo eis aquam.
verses.english: From there they came to the well; this is the well about which the Lord spoke to Moses, saying, 'Gather the people, and I will give them water.'

verses.latin: Tunc cecinit Israel carmen istud: Ascendat puteus. Succedat ei chorus.
verses.english: Then Israel sang this song: 'Spring up, O well! Let the people sing to it.'

verses.latin: Puteus, quem foderunt principes, et paraverunt duces populi in legislatore, et in baculis suis. De solitudine Madian, in Nahaliel.
verses.english: This is the well that the princes dug, and which the leaders of the people prepared, guided by the Lawgiver —Moses— and with their staffs. From the wilderness of Mattanah, they went to Nahaliel.

verses.latin: De Nahaliel in Bamoth:
verses.english: From Nahaliel, they went on to Bamoth.

verses.latin: De Bamoth in vallem, quæ est in regione Moab, super verticem Phasga, et respicit contra desertum.
verses.english: From Bamoth, they traveled to the valley that is in the region of Moab, on the summit of Pisgah, overlooking the desert.

verses.latin: Misitque Israel nuntios ad Sehon regem Amorrhæorum, dicens:
verses.english: And Israel sent messengers to Sihon, king of the Amorites, saying:

verses.latin: Transire liceat mihi per terram tuam: non divertemus per agros, nec per vineas, non bibemus aquas de puteis tuis: sed gradiemur via publica, donec transeamus fines tuos.
verses.english: 'Allow us to pass through your land. We will not turn aside through your fields or through your vineyards. We will not drink water from your wells. But we will travel along the King's Highway until we have passed through your borders.'

verses.latin: Et ille non concessit Israeli ut transiret per fines suos: quin potius multitudinem congregans, egressus est contra eum in desertum, et venit in Jasa, et pugnavit contra illum.
verses.english: But Sihon did not permit Israel to pass through his borders. Instead, he gathered a large army, went out against them into the wilderness, came to Jahaz, and fought against them.

verses.latin: Quem percussit Israel in ore gladii, et possedit terram ejus ab Arnon usque Jaboc, et filios Ammon: quoniam fortis erat terminus Amorrhæorum Jaboc.
verses.english: And Israel struck him down with the edge of the sword and took possession of his land from the Arnon River to the Jabbok River, and up to the children of Ammon. For the boundary of the Amorites at the Jabbok River was a strong and fortified boundary.

verses.latin: Tulit ergo Israel omnes civitates ejus, et habitavit in urbibus Amorrhæorum, in Hesebon scilicet, et in vicis ejus.
verses.english: So Israel took all his cities and dwelt in the cities of the Amorites, specifically in Heshbon and its surrounding villages.

verses.latin: Hesebon urbs Sehon regis Amorrhæorum fuerat, qui pugnavit contra regem Moab prior, et tulit omnem terram de manu ejus usque ad Arnon.
verses.english: For Heshbon had been the city of Sihon, king of the Amorites, who had fought against the former king of Moab and taken all his land from his hand as far as the Arnon River.

verses.latin: Idcirco dicunt per proverbium: Venite in Hesebon, ædificetur, et construatur civitas Sehon.
verses.english: Therefore, people speak in a proverb, saying: 'Come to Heshbon! Let it be rebuilt, and let the city of Sihon be restored!'

verses.latin: Ignis egressus est de Hesebon, flamma de oppido Sehon, et devoravit Ar Moabitarum, et habitatores excelsorum Arnon.
verses.english: For fire went forth from Heshbon, a flame from the city of Sihon, and it devoured Ar of Moab, along with the inhabitants of the high places of Arnon.

verses.latin: Væ tibi Moab: peristi popule Chamos. Dedit filios suos fugientes, et filias in captivitatem Sehon regi Amorrhæorum.
verses.english: Woe to you, Moab! You are ruined, O people of Chemosh —your national god—! He gave his sons who fled, and his daughters, into captivity to Sihon, king of the Amorites.

verses.latin: Jugum ipsorum dissipatum est ab Hesebon usque Dibon: perierunt usque Nophe, et usque Medaba.
verses.english: Their yoke was broken from Heshbon even to Dibon. They perished as far as Nophah and as far as Medeba.

verses.latin: Habitavit itaque Israel in terra Amorrhæi.
verses.english: So Israel dwelt in the land of the Amorites.

verses.latin: Misitque Moyses qui explorarent Jazer: cujus ceperunt viculos, et possederunt habitatores ejus.
verses.english: And Moses sent men to spy out Jazer, and they captured its villages and took possession of its inhabitants.

verses.latin: Et reversi, ascenderunt per viam Basan: egressusque est Og rex Basan cum omni populo suo occurrere eis in Edrai, et pugnavit contra eos.
verses.english: Then they turned and went up by the way to Bashan. And Og, the king of Bashan, with all his people, came out to meet them at Edrei and fought against them.

verses.latin: Dixitque Dominus ad Moysen: Ne timeas eum, quia in manu tua tradidi illum, et omnem populum, et terram ejus: faciesque illi sicut fecisti Sehon regi Amorrhæorum, habitatori Hesebon.
verses.english: And the Lord said to Moses, 'Do not fear him, for I have delivered him, and all his people, and his land into your hand. You shall do to him as you did to Sihon, king of the Amorites, who lived in Heshbon.'

verses.latin: Percusserunt igitur eum et filios ejus, et omnem populum ejus usque ad internecionem, et possederunt terram illius.
verses.english: So they struck down Og and his sons and all his people until not a single survivor remained, and they took possession of his land.

verses.latin: Profectique filii Israel, castrametati sunt in campestribus Moab, trans Jordanem contra Jericho.
verses.english: The Sons of Israel then broke camp and set up their tents in the plains of Moab, on the other side of the Jordan River, directly opposite Jericho.

verses.latin: Videns autem Balac filius Sephor, omnia quae fecerat Israel Amorrhaeo,
verses.english: Now Balak, the son of Zippor, saw everything that the Sons of Israel had done to the Amorites.

verses.latin: timuit Moab valde, et expavit ad conspectum populi, eo quod multus esset.
verses.english: Moab was greatly afraid and was terrified at the sight of the people because there were so many of them.

verses.latin: Dixitque ad majores Madian: Nunc deglutiet hic populus omnes qui in circuitu nostro sunt, sicut solet bos herbas comedere usque ad radices. Eo tempore rex in Moab Balac filius Sephor erat.
verses.english: So they said to the elders of Midian: 'This people will now consume all of our surrounding lands, just as an ox eats grass down to its roots.' At that time, Balak, the son of Zippor, was king in Moab.

verses.latin: Misit ergo nuntios ad Balaam filium Beor, haruspicem, qui habitabat super flumen terrae filiorum Ammab, ut vocarent eum, et dicerent: Ecce egressus est populus ex Aegypto, qui operuit superficiem terrae, sedens contra me.
verses.english: So Balak sent messengers to Balaam, the son of Beor, a diviner who lived by the river in the land of the sons of Ammab, to call him and say: 'Behold, a people has come out of Egypt who now cover the face of the earth, and they are settled directly opposite me.'

verses.latin: Veni ergo, et maledic populo huic, quia fortior me est: si quo modo possim percutere et ejicere eum de terra mea: scio enim quod cui benedixeris, benedictus sit, et cui maledixeris, maledictus.
verses.english: 'Therefore, come now and curse this people for me, because they are stronger than I am. Perhaps then I will be able to strike them and drive them out of my land. For I know that whoever you bless is blessed, and whoever you curse is cursed.'

verses.latin: Perrexerunt igitur seniores Moab et majores Madian, habentes pretium divinationis in manibus suis. Cumque venissent ad Balaam, et narrassent ei omnia verba Balac,
verses.english: So the elders of Moab and the elders of Midian went, carrying the fee for divination in their hands. When they came to Balaam and told him all the words of Balak,

verses.latin: ille respondit: Manete hic nocte hac, et respondebo vobis quidquid mihi dixerit Dominus. Manentibus illis apud Balaam,
verses.english: he answered: 'Stay here tonight, and I will tell you whatever the Lord says to me.' So they stayed with Balaam.

verses.latin: venit Deus ad Balaam, et ait illi: Qui sunt homines isti apud te?
verses.english: God came to Balaam and said to him: 'Who are these men with you?'

verses.latin: Respondit Balaam: Balac filius Sephor, rex Moabitarum, misit ad me,
verses.english: Balaam answered: 'Balak, the son of Zippor, the king of the Moabites, has sent word to me,' -

verses.latin: dicens: Ecce egressus est populus ex Aegypto, et operuit superficiem terrae: veni, et maledic ei, si quo modo possim pugnare contra eum, et ejicere illum.
verses.english: saying: 'Behold, a people has come out of Egypt and now covers the face of the earth. Come and curse them for me, so that perhaps I can fight against them and drive them out.'

verses.latin: Dixitque Deus ad Balaam: Ne vadas cum eis, nec maledicas populo: quia benedictus est.
verses.english: And God said to Balaam: 'Do not go with them, and do not curse the people, because they are blessed.'

verses.latin: Qui mane consurgens, dixit principibus Balac: Ite in terram vestram, quia prohibuit me Dominus vobiscum venire.
verses.english: Balaam rose early in the morning and said to Balak's officials: 'Go back to your own land, because the Lord has forbidden me to come with you.'

verses.latin: Reversi principes, dixerunt Balac: Noluit Balaam venire nobiscum.
verses.english: The officials returned and told Balak: 'Balaam refused to come with us.'

verses.latin: Rursum ille plures, et nobiliores quam prius, misit nuntios.
verses.english: Again, Balak sent more messengers, and they were more numerous and more honorable than the first ones.

verses.latin: Qui cum venissent ad Balaam, dixerunt: Hæc dicit Balac filius Sephor: Ne retineris obsecro, quin venias ad me:
verses.english: When they came to Balaam, they said: 'This is what Balak, the son of Zippor, says: Please do not let anything stop you from coming to me!'

verses.latin: grandis honoris cumulum tribuo tibi, et quidquid volueris dabo: veni, et maledic populo huic.
verses.english: 'I will bestow great honor upon you, and whatever you wish, I will give you. Come, therefore, and curse this people for me.'

verses.latin: Respondit Balaam: Si dederit mihi Balac plenam domum suam argenti et auri, non potero immutare verbum Domini Dei mei, ut vel minimum, vel majus quidquam loquar.
verses.english: Balaam answered: 'Even if Balak were to give me his house full of silver and gold, I could not change the word of the Lord, my God, to speak anything, great or small, contrary to it.'

verses.latin: Obsecro ut hic maneatis et vos hac nocte, et sciam quid rursum mihi respondeat Dominus.
verses.english: 'Please, you also stay here tonight, so that I may know what the Lord will say to me again.'

verses.latin: Venit ergo Deus ad Balaam nocte, et ait ei: Si vocare te venerunt homines isti, surge, et vade cum eis: verumtamen quod præcepero tibi, hoc facias.
verses.english: So God came to Balaam at night and said to him: 'If these men have come to call you, then get up and go with them. Nevertheless, only do what I command you.'

verses.latin: Surrexit Balaam mane, et jumenta stravit, et perrexit cum principibus Moab.
verses.english: Balaam rose early in the morning, saddled his donkey, and went with the officials of Moab.

verses.latin: Et iratus est Deus. Irrisoris illius qui pergebat: stetitque angelus Domini in via contra eum. Qui pergebat asino suo, et duos famulos habebat secum.
verses.english: And God was angry at him for going. The Angel of the Lord stood in the way against him. Balaam was riding on his donkey, and he had two servants with him.

verses.latin: Vidit asinus Angelum stantem in via, evaginato gladio, et divertit de via, et ibat per agrum. Quem verberare cœpit Balaam, et rursum reducere ad viam.
verses.english: The donkey saw the Angel standing in the road with a drawn sword, and it turned off the road and went into the field. Balaam began to beat it, trying to force it back onto the road.

verses.latin: Stetitque angelus in angustiis duarum maceriarum, quibus vineæ claudebantur.
verses.english: Then the Angel stood in a narrow path between two walls, where vineyards were enclosed.

verses.latin: Quo cum vidisset asinus, junxit se paries, et adflixit Balaam. Qui rursum verberabat eam.
verses.english: When the donkey saw the Angel, it pressed itself against the wall and crushed Balaam's foot against it. And he beat it again.

verses.latin: Et pertransiens angelus iterum, stetit in loco stricto, ubi non erat declinandi locus, vel ad dextram, vel ad sinistram.
verses.english: The Angel then passed further on and stood in an even narrower place, where there was no room to turn either to the right or to the left.

verses.latin: Cumque vidisset asinus Angelum stantem, concidit sub pedibus sedentis. Iratusque Balaam vehementius, cædebat fuste latus ejus.
verses.english: When the donkey saw the Angel standing there, it collapsed under Balaam, who was riding it. Balaam became even more furious and beat its side with a stick.

verses.latin: Aperuitque Dominus os asinæ, et locuta est: Quid feci tibi? quid est cur percutis me jam tertio?
verses.english: Then the Lord opened the mouth of the donkey, and it spoke: 'What have I done to you? Why have you beaten me these three times already?'

verses.latin: Respondit Balaam: Quia irrisisti me: utinam haberem gladium, ut te interficerem!
verses.english: Balaam answered: 'Because you have made a fool of me! If only I had a sword, I would kill you!'

verses.latin: Ait asina: Nonne ego sum jumentum tuum, in quo sedere consuevisti ante hanc diem? Numquam feci tibi tale quid? At ille respondit: Numquam.
verses.english: The donkey said: 'Am I not your own donkey, on which you have ridden all your life until this very day? Have I ever done such a thing to you before?' He answered: 'No, never.'

verses.latin: Statinque aperuit Dominus oculos Balaam, et vidit Angelum stantem in via, et evaginato gladio, restitit ei: et adoravit prona in terram.
verses.english: Immediately, the Lord opened Balaam's eyes, and he saw the Angel standing in the road with a drawn sword, blocking his way. And Balaam bowed down, prostrating himself on the ground in worship.

verses.latin: Et ait Angelus: Cur percutis asinam tuam jam tertio? ego veni ut resisterem tibi, quia perversa est via tua, mihique contraria:
verses.english: And the Angel said: 'Why have you beaten your donkey these three times already? I have come to stand against you, because your way is perverse and contrary to my will.'

verses.latin: quod nisi asina declinasset de via, interfecissem te, et illam quidem vivam reservassem.
verses.english: 'If the donkey had not turned aside from the road, I would have killed you and spared its life.'

verses.latin: Dixitque Balaam: Peccavi, quia ignorabam te stare contra me. Et nunc si displicet tibi, revertar.
verses.english: Balaam said: 'I have sinned, for I did not know that you were standing in my way. Now, if it displeases you, I will turn back.'

verses.latin: Ait Angelus: Vade cum viris istis, et quidquid tibi præcepero, loquere.
verses.english: The Angel said to Balaam: 'Go with these men, but only speak what I command you.'

verses.latin: Perrexit ergo cum principibus Balac. Quo cum audisset Balac venire, egressus est obviam ei in oppidum Moabitarum, quod situm est in finibus Arnon,
verses.english: So Balaam went with Balak's officials. When Balak heard that Balaam was coming, he went out to meet him in the city of the Moabites, which is situated on the border of the Arnon River.

verses.latin: atque ait Balaam: Misimus ad te nuntios, ut vocarent te. Cur non statim venisti ad me? an non potero dignum te honore remunerare?
verses.english: And Balak said to Balaam: 'Did we not send messengers to you to call you? Why did you not come to me immediately? Do you truly believe that I cannot reward you with enough honor?'

verses.latin: Cui respondit: Ecce adsum: num quid possum ultra, quam quod Deus posuerit in ore meo, loqui?
verses.english: Balaam answered him: 'Behold, I am here now. Can I speak anything more than what God puts into my mouth?'

verses.latin: Ierunt ergo simul, et venerunt in civitatem, quæ in extremis regni ejus confinibus erat.
verses.english: So they went together and came to the city that was on the outermost borders of his kingdom.

verses.latin: Mactatis itaque Balac bubus et ovibus, misit ad Balaam, et principes qui cum eo erant.
verses.english: So Balak sacrificed oxen and sheep, and he sent some of the meat to Balaam and to the officials who were with him.

verses.latin: Dixitque Balaam ad Balac: Ædifica mihi hic septem aras, et para totidem vitulos, et arietes totidem.
verses.english: Balaam then said to Balak, 'Build seven altars for me here' — these were for the pagan sacrifices Balaam was about to perform — 'and prepare seven young bulls and seven rams for them.'

verses.latin: Fecitque Balac ut locutus erat Balaam: et impositis vitulis et arietibus super aras,
verses.english: Balak did exactly what Balaam had told him. He placed a young bull and a ram on each of the seven altars for sacrifice.

verses.latin: dixit Balaam ad eum: Sta paulisper juxta holocaustum tuum, donec vadam, si forte occurrat mihi Dominus, et quodcumque præceperit, nuntiavero tibi.
verses.english: Balaam then said to Balak, 'Stay here by your burnt offering for a little while. I am going to see if the Lord will meet me; whatever He reveals to me, I will tell you.'

verses.latin: Cumque isset velocius, occurrit ei Deus.
verses.english: So Balaam went off quickly. And God met him.

verses.latin: Cui loquens, Dominus posuit sermonem in ore ejus, et dixit: Revertere ad Balac, et hæc loqueris.
verses.english: And the Lord spoke to Balaam, putting a specific message into his mouth. The Lord said, 'Go back to Balak, and this is what you are to say.'

verses.latin: Reversus invenit stantem Balac juxta holocaustum suum, et omnes principes Moabitarum cum eo.
verses.english: Balaam returned and found Balak still standing by his burnt offering, along with all the leaders of the Moabites.

verses.latin: Assumptaque parabola sua, dixit: De Aram adduxit me Balac, rex Moabitarum, de montibus orientis: Veni, inquit, et maledic Jacob: propera, et detestare Israël.
verses.english: Then Balaam delivered his prophetic message, saying: 'Balak, the king of the Moabites, brought me here from Aram, from the mountains in the east. He told me, "Come, put a curse on Jacob's people! Hurry, denounce Israel!"'

verses.latin: Quomodo maledicam, cui non maledixit Deus? Qua ratione detester, quem Dominus non detestatur?
verses.english: But how can I curse those whom God Himself has not cursed? How can I denounce those whom the Lord has not denounced?

verses.latin: De summis silicibus video eum, et de collibus considero illum: populus solus habitabit, et inter nationes non reputabitur.
verses.english: From these high rocks, I see the people of Israel; from these hills, I look upon them. They are a people who will live apart, unique and distinct, and they will not be counted among the other nations.

verses.latin: Quis potest dinumerare pulvisculum Jacob, et scire numerum stirpis Israël? Moriatur anima mea morte justorum, et fiant novissima mea illis similia.
verses.english: Who could possibly count the countless descendants of Jacob, or number even a quarter of the people of Israel? May my own soul die the death of the righteous, and may my final end be like theirs!

verses.latin: Dixitque Balac ad Balaam: Quid est hoc quod agis? Ut maledicas inimicis meis, adduxi te: et tu e contrario benedicis eis.
verses.english: Balak then said to Balaam, 'What are you doing? I brought you here to curse my enemies, but instead, you have blessed them!'

verses.latin: Cui ille respondit: Numquid non ea quæ præcepit Dominus, hæc loqui possum?
verses.english: Balaam answered him, 'Do I not have to speak exactly what the Lord puts into my mouth and commands me to say?'

verses.latin: Dixit ergo Balac: Veni mecum in alterum locum, unde partem Israël videas, et totum videre non possis, inde maledicito ei.
verses.english: Then Balak said, 'Come with me to another place, from where you can see only a part of the Israelites, but not all of them. Perhaps from there you can curse them for me.'

verses.latin: Cumque duxisset eum in excelsum speculam, super verticem montis Phasga, ædificavit illic septem aras, impositisque vitulis et arietibus,
verses.english: So Balak led Balaam to a high lookout point, the summit of Mount Pisgah. There, Balak built another seven altars and placed a young bull and a ram on each.

verses.latin: dixit: Sta hic juxta holocaustum tuum, dum ego obvius vadam.
verses.english: Balaam said to Balak, 'Stay here by your burnt offering, while I go to meet with the Lord again.'

verses.latin: Cui cum Dominus occurrisset, posuit sermonem in ore ejus, et ait: Revertere ad Balac, et hæc loqueris ei.
verses.english: And when the Lord met Balaam, He again put a specific message into his mouth. The Lord said, 'Go back to Balak, and this is what you are to say to him.'

verses.latin: Reversus invenit eum stantem juxta holocaustum suum, et principes Moabitarum cum eo.
verses.english: Balaam returned and found Balak still standing by his burnt offering, with the leaders of Moab assembled with him.

verses.latin: Cui cum nuntiasset Balaam, ait Balac: Quid locutus est Dominus?
verses.english: When Balaam announced his return, Balak immediately asked, 'What has the Lord spoken this time?'

verses.latin: Assumpta parabola sua, ait: Non est Deus quasi homo, ut mentiatur: nec sicut filius hominis, ut mutetur.
verses.english: Then Balaam delivered his prophetic message, saying: 'God is not a mere man, that He should lie; nor is He a son of man, that He should change His mind or regret His decisions.'

verses.latin: Numquid dixit, et non faciet? locutus est, et non implebit?
verses.english: Has God said something, and He will not do it? Has He spoken a word, and He will not bring it to pass?

verses.latin: Non est in Jacob idolum, nec videtur in Israël labor.
verses.english: God sees no iniquity in Jacob, and He sees no evil or trouble in Israel to curse them for.

verses.latin: Dominus Deus ejus cum eo est, et clangor victoriæ regis in illo.
verses.english: The Lord their God is with them, and the joyful shout of their King's triumph is heard among them.

verses.latin: Non est augurium in Jacob, nec divinatio in Israël.
verses.english: For there is no magic spell that can work against Jacob, nor any divination that can succeed against Israel.

verses.latin: Temporibus suis dicetur Jacob et Israël: Quid operatus sit Deus!
verses.english: At the proper time, it will be said of Jacob and Israel, 'See what great things God has accomplished for them!'

verses.latin: Quid facis? inquit Balac ad Balaam: nec maledicis, nec benedicis.
verses.english: Balak said to Balaam, 'What is this you are doing? You are neither cursing them, nor are you blessing them!'

verses.latin: Cui ille respondit: Nonne quodcumque præceperit Dominus, hoc ego loquar?
verses.english: Balaam answered him, 'Did I not tell you that whatever the Lord commands, that is what I must speak?'

verses.latin: Et ait Balac ad eum: Veni, et ducam te ad alium locum: si forte placeat Deo, ut inde maledicas eis.
verses.english: Then Balak said to him, 'Come, I will lead you to yet another place. Perhaps from there, it will finally please God to let you curse them for me.'

verses.latin: Cumque duxisset eum super verticem montis Phogor, qui respicit solitudinem,
verses.english: So Balak led Balaam to the very top of Mount Peor, which overlooks the desolate wilderness.

verses.latin: dixit illi Balaam: Ædifica mihi hic septem aras, et para totidem vitulos, et arietes totidem.
verses.english: Balaam said to Balak, 'Build seven more altars for me here, and prepare seven young bulls and seven rams again.'

verses.latin: Fecit Balac ut Balaam dejerans dixerat: imponensque vitulos et arietes per singulas aras.
verses.english: Balak did exactly as Balaam had earnestly requested, placing a young bull and a ram on each of the altars.

verses.latin: Videns autem Balaam quod placeret Domino benedicere Israël, nequaquam ultra abiit juxta consuetudinem suam, ut quæreret augurium: sed dirigens vultum suum contra desertum,
verses.english: When Balaam saw that it truly pleased the Lord to bless Israel, he no longer went off by himself, as was his custom, to seek divination or omens. Instead, he fixed his gaze toward the wilderness,

verses.latin: elevatis oculis, vidit Israël tabernacula figentem per tribus suas: et irruente in se spiritu Dei,
verses.english: and as he looked up, he saw Israel encamped, tribe by tribe. Then the Spirit of God powerfully came upon him,

verses.latin: assumpta parabola sua, ait: Dixit Balaam filius Beor, dixit homo cujus obturatus est oculus:
verses.english: and Balaam delivered his prophetic message, saying: 'This is the declaration of Balaam, son of Beor; the declaration of the man whose spiritual eyes have been opened by God;'

verses.latin: dixit auditor sermonum Dei, qui visionem Omnipotentis vidit in somnis, id est, revelata sibi lumina.
verses.english: He declares what he heard of the words of God, who saw the vision of the Almighty while in a trance, receiving divine light and revelation.

verses.latin: Quam pulchra tabernacula tua, Jacob! et tentoria tua, Israël!
verses.english: How beautiful are your dwelling places, O Jacob! How lovely are your tents, O Israel!

verses.latin: Sicut valles nemorosæ, sicut horti juxta fluvios irrigui, sicut tabernacula quæ fixit Dominus, quasi cedri prope aquas.
verses.english: They are like lush valleys stretching out, like gardens beside flowing rivers, like the tents that the Lord Himself has pitched, like cedar trees standing tall by abundant waters.

verses.latin: Fluet aqua de situla ejus, et semen illius erit in aquas multas.
verses.english: Water will flow abundantly from their buckets, and their descendants will spread out like abundant waters, growing and multiplying.

verses.latin: Tollitur rex eorum Agag, et elevabitur regnum illius.
verses.english: Their king shall be more exalted than Agag—a symbol of powerful, hostile rulers—and his kingdom shall be lifted up in greatness.

verses.latin: Deus eduxit eum de Ægypto, cujus fortitudo similis est rynocerotis.
verses.english: God brought them out of Egypt, and His strength is like the immense power of a wild ox.

verses.latin: comedent gentes hostes illius, et ossa eorum confringent, et sagittæ ejus perforabunt.
verses.english: They shall devour the nations that are their enemies, they shall crush their bones, and pierce them through with their arrows.

verses.latin: Videns autem Balaam quod placeret Domino ut benediceret Israel, non est abiit sicut prius in occursum auguri, sed dirigens vultum suum contra desertum.
verses.english: Balaam realized that the Lord intended to bless Israel. So, unlike his previous attempts, he did not go out to look for omens or divination; instead, he directed his gaze towards the wilderness.

verses.latin: Levatisque oculis vidit Israel tabernans per tribus suas: et irruente in se spiritu Dei,
verses.english: He lifted his eyes and saw Israel encamped, tribe by tribe. Then, the Spirit of God came powerfully upon him.

verses.latin: assumpta parabola sua, ait:
verses.english: He then delivered his prophetic message, saying:

verses.latin: Dixit Balaam filius Beor: dixit vir cujus obturatus est oculus:
verses.english: “This is the oracle of Balaam, son of Beor. This is the oracle of the man whose spiritual eyes have been opened.”

verses.latin: dixit auditor sermonum Dei, qui intuitionem Omnipotentis videt, in somnis cadens, revelata sibi lumina:
verses.english: “This is the oracle of one who hears the words of God, who sees visions from the Almighty. He falls into a trance, yet his spiritual eyes are opened to divine revelations.”

verses.latin: Quam pulchra sunt tabernacula tua, Jacob: et tentoria tua, Israel.
verses.english: “How beautiful are your tents, O Jacob, and your dwellings, O Israel.”

verses.latin: Ut valles nemorosae, ut horti juxta fluvios irrigui, ut tabernacula quae fixit Dominus, quasi cedri prope aquas.
verses.english: “They are like shaded valleys, like gardens beside flowing rivers. They are like the dwellings the Lord Himself has set up, like cedars growing near abundant waters.”

verses.latin: Manabit aqua de situla ejus, et semen illius erit in aquis multis. Elevabitur propter Agag rex ejus, et auferetur regnum illius.
verses.english: “Water will flow from his buckets, ensuring abundant prosperity. His offspring will spread widely, like many waters. His king will be exalted above Agag, and his kingdom will be lifted high.”

verses.latin: Quasi cubans dormiet leo, et velut leaena quam nemo suscitare audebit. Benedictus qui benedixerit tibi, et maledictus qui maledixerit tibi.
verses.english: “He lies down like a lion, and like a lioness, none dare awaken him. Blessed is he who blesses you, and cursed is he who curses you.”

verses.latin: Iratusque Balac contra Balaam complosis manibus, ait: Ad maledicendum inimicis meis vocavi te: et tu e contrario tribus vicibus benedixisti eis.
verses.english: Enraged, Balak clapped his hands in anger at Balaam and said, “I called you to curse my enemies, but instead, you have blessed them these three times!”

verses.latin: Proinde fuge in locum tuum: pecuniam quidem quam promiseram, me negante perderes.
verses.english: “Therefore, flee back to your own home! I had promised you great honor, but the Lord Himself has deprived you of that honor.”

verses.latin: Respondit Balaam: Nonne et priorum nuntiorum tuorum, quos ad me misisti, locutus sum dicens:
verses.english: Balaam answered, “Did I not tell your messengers, whom you sent to me before, saying:”

verses.latin: Si dederit mihi Balac plenam domum suam argenti et auri, non potero praeterire sermonem Domini Dei mei, ut vel parvum quid aut majus loquar ex meo?
verses.english: “‘Even if Balak were to give me his house full of silver and gold, I cannot go beyond the command of the Lord my God to speak anything, whether small or great, on my own authority. I can only speak what God says.’”

verses.latin: Verumtamen nunc revertar ad populum meum: dabo consilium quid populus iste populo tuo faciat in diebus novissimis.
verses.english: “Nevertheless, now I am going back to my own people. But first, I will advise you on what this people, Israel, will do to your people in the last days.”

verses.latin: Assumpta igitur parabola sua, rursum locutus est: Dixit Balaam filius Beor: dixit vir cujus obturatus est oculus:
verses.english: Then he delivered his prophetic message once more, saying: “This is the oracle of Balaam, son of Beor. This is the oracle of the man whose spiritual eyes have been opened.”

verses.latin: Dixit auditor sermonum Dei, qui novit doctrinam Altissimi, et visiones Omnipotentis videt, cadens in somnum, et revelatos habens oculos:
verses.english: “This is the oracle of one who hears the words of God, who understands the knowledge of the Most High, and who sees visions from the Almighty. He falls into a trance, yet his eyes remain open to divine revelations.”

verses.latin: Videbo eum, sed non modo: intuebor illum, sed non prope. Orietur stella ex Jacob, et consurget virga de Israel: et percutiet duces Moab, vastabitque omnes filios Seth.
verses.english: “I see him, but not in this present time. I behold him, but not nearby. A star will rise from Jacob, and a scepter will emerge from Israel. He will crush the leaders of Moab and destroy all the sons of Seth.”

verses.latin: Et erit Idumaea possessio ejus, et haereditas ejus Seir: Israel vero fortiter aget.
verses.english: “Edom will become his possession, and Seir will be his inheritance. Israel will act with great strength.”

verses.latin: De Jacob exibit qui dominetur, et perdet residuum civitatis.
verses.english: “From Jacob will come a ruler who will destroy the remnant that survives from the city.”

verses.latin: Cumque vidisset Amalec, assumens parabolam suam, ait: Principium gentium Amalec, cujus etiam extrema perdentur.
verses.english: When Balaam saw Amalek, he delivered his prophetic message, saying: “Amalek was once the foremost among the nations, but its end will be utter destruction.”

verses.latin: Vidit quoque Cinaei, et assumpta parabola sua, ait: Quam fortis est habitatio tua, sed et in petra posuisti nidum tuum!
verses.english: He also saw the Kenites, and delivering his prophetic message, he said: “How strong is your dwelling place! You have set your nest securely in the rock.”

verses.latin: Et tamen eris in direptionem, quousque Assyrius captivetur.
verses.english: “Nevertheless, you too will be plundered and carried away, until Asshur takes you captive.”

verses.latin: Assumptaque rursum parabola sua, locutus est: Heu, quis vivet, quando faciet haec Deus?
verses.english: And again, he delivered his prophetic message, saying: “Alas! Who will survive when God brings these things to pass?”

verses.latin: Venient in trieribus de Italia, superabunt Assyrios, vastabuntque Hebraeos, et illi simul peribunt.
verses.english: “Warships will come from Italy, and they will afflict Asshur and also the Hebrews. And they themselves, the invaders, will perish in the end.”

verses.latin: Surrexitque Balaam, et reversus est in locum suum: Balac quoque abiit via qua venerat.
verses.english: Then Balaam rose up and returned to his own place. Balak also departed by the way he had come.

verses.latin: Mansitque Israel in Sittim, et fornicatus est populus cum filiabus Moab.
verses.english: The people of Israel settled in the region of Sittim, and they committed grave sin by engaging in fornication with the daughters of Moab.

verses.latin: Quae invitaverunt eos ad sacrificia deorum suorum. Qui comedentes et adorantes eos.
verses.english: These women then invited the Israelite men to the sacrifices offered to their pagan gods. And the Israelite men ate the sacrificial food and worshipped these false gods.

verses.latin: Initiatus est Israel Beelphegor: et iratus est Dominus contra eum.
verses.english: In this way, Israel consecrated themselves to Baal-Peor, a false god of the Moabites. Because of this, the Lord became very angry with them.

verses.latin: Dixitque Dominus ad Moysen: Tolle cunctos principes populi, et suspendito eos in patibulis contra solem, ut avertatur furor meus ab Israel.
verses.english: Then the Lord said to Moses: 'Take all the leaders of the people who have committed this sin, and execute them publicly before the sun, by hanging them up for all to see. Do this so that my fierce anger may be turned away from the people of Israel.'

verses.latin: Et ait Moyses judicibus Israel: Occidat unusquisque proximum suum, qui initiatus est Beelphegor.
verses.english: And so, Moses said to the judges of Israel: 'Let each of you, with your own hand, kill those among your kinsmen who have consecrated themselves to Baal-Peor.'

verses.latin: Et ecce unus de filiis Israel ingressus est coram fratribus suis ad scortum Madianitidem, vidente Moyse, et omni turba filiorum Israel, qui flebant juxta fores tabernaculi.
verses.english: And behold, while Moses and the entire assembly of the sons of Israel were weeping in repentance at the entrance of the tabernacle, one of the sons of Israel went openly before his brothers to a Midianite prostitute.

verses.latin: Quod cum vidisset Phinees filius Eleazari filii Aaron sacerdotis, surrexit de medio multitudinis, et arrepta machaera.
verses.english: When Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, who was the son of Aaron the priest, saw this sinful act, he rose from the midst of the congregation and took a spear in his hand.

verses.latin: Ingressus est post hominem Israelitem in lupanar, et perfodit ambos simul, virum scilicet, et mulierem in locis genitalibus. Et cessavit plaga a filiis Israel:
verses.english: He followed the Israelite man into the tent where the sin was being committed, and he pierced both of them through at the same time—the man and the woman, right through their reproductive organs. Immediately, the plague among the sons of Israel stopped.

verses.latin: occisique sunt quatuor et viginti millia.
verses.english: Before the plague stopped, twenty-four thousand people had been killed.

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Phinees filius Eleazari filii Aaron sacerdotis avertit iram meam a filiis Israel: quia zelo meo commotus est contra eos, nec potui delere filios Israel, sicut irascebar.
verses.english: 'Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, has turned my divine wrath away from the sons of Israel. He did this because he was stirred up with my own divine zeal against them. And because of his action, I did not destroy the sons of Israel as I was angry enough to do.'

verses.latin: Idcirco loquere ad eum: Ecce do illi pacem foederis mei.
verses.english: 'Therefore, tell him: Behold, I am giving him my covenant of peace.'

verses.latin: Et erit tam ipsi, quam semini ejus post eum, pactum sacerdotii sempiternum: quia zelatus est pro Deo suo, et expiavit scelus filiorum Israel.
verses.english: 'This covenant will be for him and for his descendants after him, a perpetual covenant of the priesthood. This is because he was zealous for his God, and in doing so, he made atonement for the wickedness of the sons of Israel.'

verses.latin: Nomen autem viri Israelitae, qui occisus est cum Madianitide scorto, Zamri filius Salu, dux cognationis et stirpis Simeon.
verses.english: Now the name of the Israelite man who was killed with the Midianite prostitute was Zimri, the son of Salu. He was a leader of a family and a tribe within Simeon.

verses.latin: Mulieris vero Madianitidis, quae cum eo pariter interfecta est, Cozbi filia Sur nobilissimi principis Madianitarum.
verses.english: And the name of the Midianite woman who was killed with him was Cozbi, the daughter of Zur, who was a noble chieftain of the Midianites.

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Hostes sibi habete Madianitas, et percutite eos:
verses.english: 'Consider the Midianites your enemies, and you must strike them down.'
