verses.latin: quia et ipsi hostiliter egerunt contra vos, et deceperunt vos per idolum Phogor, et Cozbi filiam ducis Madian, sororem suam, quae percussa est in die plagae pro scelere Phogor.
verses.english: 'You must strike them down because they also acted hostilely against you. They deceived you through the idol Peor, and through Cozbi, the daughter of a Midianite leader, who was one of their own, and who was killed on the day of the plague because of the wickedness involving Peor.'

verses.latin: Post quam interfecti sunt, dixit Dominus ad Moysen, et ad Eleazarum filium Aaron sacerdotem:
verses.english: After that great plague, in which so many had died, the Lord God spoke to Moses and to Eleazar, Aaron’s son, who was the priest.

verses.latin: Numerare capita cunctae multitudinis filiorum Israel a viginti annis et supra, per domos et familias suas, omnes qui possunt ad bella procedere.
verses.english: Take a census of all the people of Israel, starting from twenty years old and upwards, counting them according to their family lines and households. Include everyone who is able to go out to war.

verses.latin: Locuti sunt ergo Moyses et Eleazar sacerdos in campestribus Moab super Jordanem contra Jericho, ad eos qui fuerant a viginti annis et supra, sicut præceperat Dominus.
verses.english: So Moses and Eleazar the priest spoke in the plains of Moab, beside the Jordan River, opposite Jericho, to all those who were twenty years old and upwards, just as the Lord God had commanded them.

verses.latin: Horum nomina sunt filiorum Israel, qui egressi sunt de terra Ægypti: Ruben primogenitus Israel.
verses.english: These are the names of the sons of Israel, who had come out of the land of Egypt. Reuben was the firstborn of Israel.

verses.latin: Filii Ruben: Henoch, a quo familia Enochitarum: et Phallu, a quo familia Phalluitarum:
verses.english: The sons of Reuben were: Hanoch, from whom came the family of the Hanochites; Pallu, from whom came the family of the Palluites;

verses.latin: Hesron, a quo familia Hesronitarum: et Charmi, a quo familia Charmitarum.
verses.english: Hezron, from whom came the family of the Hezronites; and Carmi, from whom came the family of the Carmites.

verses.latin: Hæ sunt familiæ Ruben; quarum numerus fuit quadraginta tres millia septingenti triginta.
verses.english: These were the families of the tribe of Reuben. Their registered number was forty-three thousand, seven hundred and thirty men.

verses.latin: Filius Phallu, Eliab.
verses.english: The son of Pallu was Eliab.

verses.latin: Filii Eliab: Namuel, et Dathan, et Abiron. Hi sunt Dathan et Abiron principes populi, qui concitati sunt adversum Moysen et Aaron in seditione Core, quando rebelles extiterunt contra Dominum:
verses.english: The sons of Eliab were Nemuel, Dathan, and Abiram. These are the Dathan and Abiram who were prominent leaders in the assembly, and who rebelled against Moses and Aaron during Korah’s rebellion, when they rebelled against the Lord God.

verses.latin: dehiscensque terra absorbuit illos, et Core in interitu ejus, quando ignis combussit ducentos quinquaginta viros, factumque est grande miraculum.
verses.english: The earth then opened up and swallowed them and Korah, in the midst of their destruction, at the time when the fire consumed two hundred and fifty men. That was a great and fearsome warning from God.

verses.latin: Filii autem Core non sunt mortui.
verses.english: However, the sons of Korah did not die.

verses.latin: Filii Simeon per familias suas: Namuel, a quo familia Namuelitarum: Jamin, a quo familia Jaminitarum: Jachin, a quo familia Jachinitarum:
verses.english: The sons of Simeon, according to their families, were: Nemuel, from whom came the family of the Nemuelites; Jamin, from whom came the family of the Jaminites; Jachin, from whom came the family of the Jachinites;

verses.latin: Zare, a quo familia Zaritarum: Saul, a quo familia Saulitarum.
verses.english: Zerah, from whom came the family of the Zerahites; and Shaul, from whom came the family of the Shaulites.

verses.latin: Hæ sunt familiæ Simeon: quarum omnis numerus viginti duo millia ducenti.
verses.english: These were the families of the tribe of Simeon. Their total registered number was twenty-two thousand, two hundred men.

verses.latin: Filii Gad per familias suas: Sephon, a quo familia Sephonitarum: Haggi, a quo familia Haggitarum: Suni, a quo familia Sunitarum:
verses.english: The sons of Gad, according to their families, were: Zephon, from whom came the family of the Zephonites; Haggi, from whom came the family of the Haggites; Shuni, from whom came the family of the Shunites;

verses.latin: Ozni, a quo familia Ozinitarum: Her, a quo familia Heritarum:
verses.english: Ozni, from whom came the family of the Oznites; Eri, from whom came the family of the Erites;

verses.latin: Arod, a quo familia Aroditarum: Ariel, a quo familia Arielitarum.
verses.english: Arod, from whom came the family of the Arodites; and Areli, from whom came the family of the Arelites.

verses.latin: Hæ sunt familiæ Gad: quarum numerus fuit quadraginta millia quingenti.
verses.english: These were the families of the tribe of Gad. Their registered number was forty thousand, five hundred men.

verses.latin: Filii Juda: Her, et Onan, qui ambo mortui sunt in terra Chanaan.
verses.english: The sons of Judah were Er and Onan. Both of them died in the land of Canaan.

verses.latin: Fueruntque filii Juda per familias suas: Sela, a quo familia Selaitarum: Phares, a quo familia Pharesitarum: Zara, a quo familia Zaraitarum.
verses.english: The remaining sons of Judah, according to their families, were: Shelah, from whom came the family of the Shelanites; Perez, from whom came the family of the Perezites; and Zerah, from whom came the family of the Zerahites.

verses.latin: Porro filii Phares: Hesron, a quo familia Hesronitarum: et Hamul, a quo familia Hamulitarum.
verses.english: Furthermore, the sons of Perez were: Hezron, from whom came the family of the Hezronites; and Hamul, from whom came the family of the Hamulites.

verses.latin: Hæ sunt familiæ Juda: quarum numerus fuit septuaginta sex millia quingenti.
verses.english: These were the families of the tribe of Judah. Their registered number was seventy-six thousand, five hundred men.

verses.latin: Filii Issachar per familias suas: Thola, a quo familia Tholaitarum: Phua, a quo familia Phuaitarum:
verses.english: The sons of Issachar, according to their families, were: Tola, from whom came the family of the Tolaites; Puvah, from whom came the family of the Puvahites;

verses.latin: Jasub, a quo familia Jasubitarum: Semran, a quo familia Semranitarum.
verses.english: Jashub, from whom came the family of the Jashubites; and Shimron, from whom came the family of the Shimronites.

verses.latin: Hæ sunt familiæ Issachar: quarum numerus fuit sexaginta quatuor millia trecenti.
verses.english: These were the families of the tribe of Issachar. Their registered number was sixty-four thousand, three hundred men.

verses.latin: Filii Zabulon per familias suas: Sared, a quo familia Sareditarum: Elon, a quo familia Elonitarum: Jahel, a quo familia Jahelitarum.
verses.english: The sons of Zebulun, according to their families, were: Sered, from whom came the family of the Seredites; Elon, from whom came the family of the Elonites; and Jahleel, from whom came the family of the Jahleelites.

verses.latin: Hæ sunt familiæ Zabulon: quarum numerus fuit sexaginta millia quingenti.
verses.english: These were the families of the tribe of Zebulun. Their registered number was sixty thousand, five hundred men.

verses.latin: Filii Joseph per familias suas: Manasses et Ephraim.
verses.english: The sons of Joseph, according to their families, were Manasseh and Ephraim.

verses.latin: Filii Manasse: Machir, a quo familia Machiritarum: Machir genuit Galaad, a quo familia Galaaditarum.
verses.english: The sons of Manasseh were: Machir, from whom came the family of the Machirites. Machir was the father of Gilead, from whom came the family of the Gileadites.

verses.latin: Hi sunt filii Galaad: Jezer, a quo familia Jezeritarum: et Helec, a quo familia Heleclitarum:
verses.english: These are the sons of Gilead: Iezer, from whom came the family of the Iezerites; and Helek, from whom came the family of the Helekites;

verses.latin: Asriel, a quo familia Asrielitarum: et Sechem, a quo familia Sechemitarum:
verses.english: Asriel, from whom came the family of the Asrielites; and Shechem, from whom came the family of the Shechemites;

verses.latin: Semida, a quo familia Semidaitarum: et Hepher, a quo familia Hepheritarum.
verses.english: Shemida, from whom came the family of the Shemidaites; and Hepher, from whom came the family of the Hepherites.

verses.latin: Porro Salphaad filius Hepher non habuit masculos, sed tantum filias: quarum nomina hæc sunt: Maala, et Noa, et Hegla, et Melcha, et Thersa.
verses.english: Moreover, Zelophehad, the son of Hepher, had no sons, but only daughters. Their names were: Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.

verses.latin: Hæ sunt familiæ Manasse: quarum numerus fuit quinquaginta duo millia septingenti.
verses.english: These were the families of the tribe of Manasseh. Their registered number was fifty-two thousand, seven hundred men.

verses.latin: Filii Ephraim per familias suas: Sutala, a quo familia Sutalaitarum: Becher, a quo familia Becheritarum: Thaan, a quo familia Thaanitarum.
verses.english: The sons of Ephraim, according to their families, were: Shuthelah, from whom came the family of the Shuthelahites; Becher, from whom came the family of the Becherites; and Tahan, from whom came the family of the Tahanites.

verses.latin: Porro filius Sutala, Heran, a quo familia Heranitarum.
verses.english: Furthermore, the son of Shuthelah was Eran, from whom came the family of the Eranites.

verses.latin: Hæ sunt familiæ filiorum Ephraim: quarum numerus fuit triginta duo millia quingenti. Isti sunt filii Joseph per familias suas.
verses.english: These were the families of the sons of Ephraim. Their registered number was thirty-two thousand, five hundred men. These are all the sons of Joseph, according to their families.

verses.latin: Filii Benjamin per familias suas: Bela, a quo familia Belaitarum: Asbel, a quo familia Asbelitarum: Ahiram, a quo familia Ahiramitarum:
verses.english: The sons of Benjamin, according to their families, were: Bela, from whom came the family of the Belaites; Ashbel, from whom came the family of the Ashbelites; Ahiram, from whom came the family of the Ahiramites;

verses.latin: Supham, a quo familia Suphamitarum: Hupham, a quo familia Huphamitarum.
verses.english: Shephupham, from whom came the family of the Shephuphamites; and Hupham, from whom came the family of the Huphamites.

verses.latin: Filii Bela: Ard, et Naaman, a quibus familia Arditarum et Naamanitarum. Hæ sunt familiæ Benjamin per familias suas: quarum numerus fuit quadraginta quinque millia sexcenti.
verses.english: The sons of Bela were Ard and Naaman, from whom came the families of the Ardites and the Naamanites. These were the families of Benjamin, according to their families. Their registered number was forty-five thousand, six hundred men.

verses.latin: Accesserunt autem filiae Salphaad filii Hepher, filii Galaad, filii Machir, filii Manasse, qui fuit filius Joseph: quarum haec sunt nomina, Maala et Noa et Hegla et Melcha et Thersa.
verses.english: The daughters of Zelophehad approached. He was the son of Hepher, the son of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh, who was the son of Joseph. These were their names: Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.

verses.latin: Steteruntque coram Moyse et Eleazaro sacerdote et cunctis principibus populi ad ostium tabernaculi foederis, atque dixerunt:
verses.english: They stood before Moses, Eleazar the priest, and all the leaders of the people at the entrance of the Tabernacle of the Covenant, and they spoke:

verses.latin: Pater noster mortuus est in deserto, nec fuit in seditione quae concitata est contra Dominum sub Core, sed in peccato suo mortuus est: et non habuit mares filios.
verses.english: Our father died in the desert. He was not among those who rebelled against the Lord with Korah. Instead, he died for his own sins, just like all of his generation in the desert. He had no sons.

verses.latin: Cur aufertur nomen patris nostri de familia sua, eo quod non habuerit filium? Da nobis possessionem inter cognatos patris nostri.
verses.english: Why should our father's name be cut off from his family just because he had no son? Give us a land inheritance among our father’s relatives.

verses.latin: Rettulitque Moyses causam earum ad Dominum.
verses.english: So Moses brought their legal case before the Lord for judgment.

verses.latin: Qui locutus est ad eum, dicens:
verses.english: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Recte filiae Salphaad loquuntur: da illis possessionem inter cognatos patris sui, et succedant ei.
verses.english: The daughters of Zelophehad are speaking correctly. Give them a land inheritance among their father’s relatives, and let them inherit his portion of the land.

verses.latin: Ad filios quoque Israël loqueris: Homo si mortuus fuerit absque filio, ad filiam ejus transibit haereditas.
verses.english: Also, you must speak to the sons of Israel regarding this law: If a man dies without a son, his inheritance will pass to his daughter.

verses.latin: Si filiam non habuerit, succedent ei fratres ejus.
verses.english: If he has no daughter, then his brothers will inherit from him.

verses.latin: Quod si et fratres non fuerint, dabitis haereditatem cognatis patris ejus.
verses.english: But if he has no brothers, you will give his inheritance to his father's relatives.

verses.latin: Si nec pater habuerit cognatos, dabitur haereditas his qui ei proximi sunt. Eritque hoc filiis Israël sanctum, lege perpetua.
verses.english: And if his father also has no relatives, then the inheritance will be given to those who are nearest to him in family relationship. This will be a holy and permanent law for the sons of Israel.

verses.latin: Dixitque Dominus ad Moysen: Ascende in montem istum Abarim, et contemplare inde terram, quam daturus sum filiis Israël.
verses.english: Then the Lord said to Moses: "Go up this Abarim mountain, and from there, look at the land that I am about to give to the sons of Israel."

verses.latin: Cumque eam videris, ad patres tuos congregaberis, sicut congregatus est Aaron frater tuus:
verses.english: When you have seen it, you will be gathered to your ancestors in death, just as your brother Aaron was gathered.

verses.latin: Quia offendistis me in deserto Sin in contentione multitudinis, nec sanctificastis me coram populo ad aquas.
verses.english: This is because you offended Me in the Desert of Sin during the contention of the multitude, and you did not show My holiness before the people at the waters.

verses.latin: Responditque Moyses:
verses.english: And Moses responded:

verses.latin: Providat Dominus Deus spirituum omnis carnis hominem, qui sit super multitudinem:
verses.english: "May the Lord, the God of the spirits of all humankind, appoint a man to be over this multitude of people."

verses.latin: Qui egrediatur et ingrediatur ante eos, et ducat eos vel reducat: ne sit congregatio Domini sicut oves absque pastore.
verses.english: "Let this man go out before them and come in before them, and let him lead them out and bring them in, so that the congregation of the Lord may not be like sheep without a shepherd."

verses.latin: Dixitque Dominus ad Moysen: Sume Josue filium Nun, virum in quo est spiritus, et pone manum tuam super eum.
verses.english: Then the Lord said to Moses: "Take Joshua, the son of Nun, a man in whom the Spirit is present, and lay your hand upon him."

verses.latin: Qui stabit coram Eleazaro sacerdote et omni turba filiorum Israël: dabisque ei praecepta, audientibus cunctis.
verses.english: "He will stand before Eleazar the priest and all the assembly of the sons of Israel. You are to give him instructions in the hearing of everyone."

verses.latin: Et dabis partem gloriae tuae super eum, ut audiat omnis synagoga filiorum Israël.
verses.english: "And you will give him some of your authority and honor, so that all the congregation of the sons of Israel may obey him."

verses.latin: Si quid autem faciendum erit, Eleazar sacerdos consulet Dominum. Judicio et responsa illius ingredietur et egredietur ipse et omnes filii Israël cum eo, et cetera multitudo.
verses.english: "If anything needs to be done, Eleazar the priest will consult the Lord for him, using the Urim and Thummim. Joshua, and all the sons of Israel with him, along with the rest of the multitude, will go out and come in according to Eleazar's judgment and divine answers from the Lord."

verses.latin: Fecit ergo Moyses sicut praeceperat Dominus: et assumpto Josue, statuit eum coram Eleazaro sacerdote et omni coetu populi.
verses.english: So Moses did just as the Lord had commanded. He took Joshua and presented him before Eleazar the priest and all the assembly of the people.

verses.latin: Posuitque manus suas super caput ejus, et ordinavit eum, sicut praeceperat Dominus.
verses.english: And Moses laid his hands on Joshua's head, ordaining him just as the Lord had commanded.

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying to him:

verses.latin: Praecipe filiis Israel, et dices ad eos: Oblationes meas, et panes, atque incendia suavissimi odoris, offertis mihi in temporibus suis.
verses.english: “Command the children of Israel and tell them: ‘You must offer my sacred gifts to me at their appointed times. These offerings include the bread and the burnt sacrifices that produce a pleasing aroma.’”

verses.latin: Haec sunt sacrificia quae offerre debetis: Agnos anniculos immaculatos duos, quotidie in holocaustum sempiternum:
verses.english: “These are the sacrifices you must offer: two perfect, year-old male lambs each day as a perpetual burnt offering.”

verses.latin: unum mane, et alterum ad vesperam:
verses.english: “One lamb in the morning, and the other in the evening.”

verses.latin: et decimam partem ephi similae in sacrificio, quae conspersa sit oleo purissimo, et habeat quartam partem hin.
verses.english: “And for the grain offering, a tenth of an ephah of fine flour mixed with a quarter of a hin of pure olive oil.”

verses.latin: Holocausitum sempiternum est, quod in monte Sinai obtulistis in odorem suavissimum, et sacrificium ignis Domino.
verses.english: “This is the perpetual burnt offering, the same as what you offered on Mount Sinai, which produced a pleasing aroma and was a sacrifice made by fire to the Lord.”

verses.latin: Libamenta quoque eorum, quartam partem hin per agnos singulos, in sanctuario Domini fundes in vino forti.
verses.english: “For their drink offerings, you must pour out a quarter of a hin of strong wine for each lamb in the Lord's sanctuary.”

verses.latin: Et alterum agnum offeres ad vesperam juxta ritum matutini sacrificii, et libamentorum ejus, simul offeres.
verses.english: “And you will offer the other lamb in the evening, according to the ritual of the morning sacrifice and its drink offerings—you must offer them both together.”

verses.latin: Die autem sabbati, agnos duos anniculos immaculatos, et duas decimam partes similae quae conspersa sit oleo, et libamenta ejus.
verses.english: “On the Sabbath day, you must offer two perfect, year-old male lambs, along with two-tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with olive oil, as a grain offering, and its drink offerings.”

verses.latin: Quae sunt holocausta sabbatorum per singula sabbata.
verses.english: “These are the burnt offerings for each Sabbath, in addition to the regular daily burnt offering and its drink offering.”

verses.latin: In kalendis quoque, id est, in principio mensium, offeretis holocaustum Domino, vitulos de armento duos, arietem unum, agnos anniculos septem immaculatos:
verses.english: “Also, at the beginning of each month—on the New Moon—you must offer a burnt offering to the Lord: two young bulls, one ram, and seven perfect, year-old male lambs.”

verses.latin: et tres decimam partes similae conspersae oleo per singulos vitulos, et duas decimam partes similae conspersae oleo per arietem unum,
verses.english: “And for the grain offering with each bull, three-tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with olive oil. And with the one ram, two-tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with olive oil.”

verses.latin: et decimam partem similae conspersae oleo per agnos singulos in holocaustum suavissimi odoris, atque incendii Domini.
verses.english: “And with each lamb, one-tenth of an ephah of fine flour mixed with olive oil. This is a burnt offering that produces a pleasing aroma, a sacrifice made by fire to the Lord.”

verses.latin: Libamenta autem singulorum haec erunt: medietas hin vini per singulos vitulos, et tertia pars hin per arietem, et quarta pars per agnos singulos. Hoc erit holocaustum sempiternum, quod offeretis per menses singulos in anno.
verses.english: “Their drink offerings will be as follows: half a hin of wine for each bull, a third of a hin for the ram, and a quarter of a hin for each lamb. This will be the perpetual burnt offering that you must offer each month throughout the year.”

verses.latin: Hircum quoque unum caprarum pro peccato, cum holocaustis sempiternis, et libamentis ejus offeretis.
verses.english: “And you must also offer one male goat as a sin offering, in addition to the perpetual burnt offering and its drink offerings.”

verses.latin: Mense primo, quartadecima die mensis, Phase Domini est:
verses.english: “In the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month, is the Lord's Passover.”

verses.latin: et quintadecima die mensis hujus, solemnitas erit: septem diebus azymis comedentur.
verses.english: “And on the fifteenth day of that same month, there will be a solemn feast. For seven days, unleavened bread must be eaten.”

verses.latin: Dieque primo celeberrimus erit, nihilque operis servilis facietis in eo.
verses.english: “On the first day of this feast, there will be a sacred assembly, and you must not do any ordinary work.”

verses.latin: Offeretisque holocaustum Domino, vitulos de armento duos, arietem unum, agnos anniculos septem immaculatos.
verses.english: “You must offer a burnt offering to the Lord: two young bulls, one ram, and seven perfect, year-old male lambs.”

verses.latin: Et in sacrificio similae, tres decimam partes quae conspersa sit oleo per singulos vitulos, et duas decimam partes arietis:
verses.english: “And for their grain offering of fine flour mixed with olive oil, three-tenths of an ephah for each bull, and two-tenths of an ephah for the ram.”

verses.latin: et decimam partem per agnos singulos, id est, per septem agnos:
verses.english: “And for each of the seven lambs, one-tenth of an ephah.”

verses.latin: et hircum pro peccato, ut expietur pro vobis.
verses.english: “And one male goat as a sin offering, to make atonement for you.”

verses.latin: Praeter holocaustum matutinum, quod semper offeretis.
verses.english: “You must offer these in addition to the regular morning burnt offering.”

verses.latin: His omnibus singulos dies septem, simili ritu offeretis in odorem suavissimum, et in sacrificium ignis Domino, absque quotidiano holocausto et libamentis ejus.
verses.english: “In this same way, you must offer all of these, for seven days, each day, as a sacrifice made by fire to the Lord, a pleasing aroma. This is in addition to the daily burnt offering and its drink offerings.”

verses.latin: Dieque septimo, celeberrimus erit dies, nihilque operis servilis facietis in eo.
verses.english: “And on the seventh day, there will be a sacred assembly, and you must not do any ordinary work.”

verses.latin: Die etiam primitiarum, quando offeretis munus novarum frugum Domino, post hebdomadas vestras, celeberrimus erit dies, omne opus servile non facietis in eo.
verses.english: “Also, on the day of the firstfruits, when you bring a new grain offering to the Lord after your weeks have passed, there will be a sacred assembly, and you must not do any ordinary work on it.”

verses.latin: Offeretisque in holocaustum in odorem suavissimum Domino, vitulos de armento duos, arietem unum, agnos anniculos septem immaculatos.
verses.english: “You must offer a burnt offering that produces a pleasing aroma to the Lord: two young bulls, one ram, and seven perfect, year-old male lambs.”

verses.latin: In sacrificiis quoque eorum similae quae conspersa sit oleo, tres decimam partes per singulos vitulos, duas decimam partes per arietem:
verses.english: “And for their grain offering of fine flour mixed with olive oil, three-tenths of an ephah for each bull, and two-tenths of an ephah for the ram.”

verses.latin: decimam partem per singulos agnos, qui sunt simul septem agni.
verses.english: “And one-tenth of an ephah for each of the seven lambs.”

verses.latin: Hircum quoque unum, qui immolatur pro peccato, ad expiandum vos:
verses.english: “Also, one male goat, which is to be sacrificed as a sin offering, to make atonement for you.”

verses.latin: praeter holocaustum sempiternum, et sacrificia ejus, et libamenta eorum offeretis omnia immaculata.
verses.english: “You must offer all of these, along with the perpetual burnt offering, its grain offering, and its drink offerings, making sure they are all perfect.”

verses.latin: Mense quoque septimo, prima die mensis, erit vobis sancta solemnitas: omne opus servile non facietis in ea, quia dies clangoris est atque tubarum.
verses.english: In the seventh month of the year, on the first day of that month, you shall have a holy festival. No work of any kind that makes you a servant of anyone but God shall be done on that day, because it is the Day of Trumpets, a day of loud blasts and shofar calls.

verses.latin: Et offeretis holocaustum in odorem suavissimum Domino, vitulum de armento unum, arietem unum, agnos immaculatos anniculos septem,
verses.english: And you shall offer a burnt offering to the Lord, which is a sweet aroma to Him. This offering shall consist of one young bull from the herd, one ram, and seven male lambs, each a year old and without blemish.

verses.latin: et in sacrificium eorum tres decimas similae oleo conspersae per singulos vitulos, et duas decimas similae oleo conspersae per singulos arietes,
verses.english: Along with these, for the meal offering that accompanies them, you shall prepare three-tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with oil for each young bull. And for each ram, you shall prepare two-tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with oil.

verses.latin: et decimam similae oleo conspersae per singulos agnos septem,
verses.english: And for each of the seven male lambs, you shall prepare one-tenth of an ephah of fine flour mixed with oil.

verses.latin: et hircum unum pro peccato, ut expietur pro vobis,
verses.english: You shall also offer one male goat as a sin offering, so that atonement may be made for you.

verses.latin: absque holocausto mensis, et sacrificio ejus, et holocausto perpetuo, et sacrificio illius, et libaminibus solitis: ritu et odore suavissimo Domino.
verses.english: These offerings are in addition to the monthly burnt offering and its associated meal offering. They are also in addition to the daily perpetual burnt offering and its meal offering, along with their usual drink offerings. All these offerings are to be made according to their prescribed ritual and are a sweet aroma to the Lord.

verses.latin: Die decimo mensis hujus septimi, erit vobis sancta et solemne. Affligetis animas vestras: omne opus servile non facietis in eo.
verses.english: On the tenth day of this seventh month, you shall have a holy and solemn assembly— this is the Day of Atonement. You shall humble yourselves by fasting and repentance, and you shall do no work of any kind that makes you a servant of anyone but God on that day.

verses.latin: Offeretisque holocaustum Domino in odorem suavissimum, vitulum de armento unum, arietem unum, agnos anniculos immaculatos septem:
verses.english: Then you shall offer a burnt offering to the Lord, which is a sweet aroma to Him: one young bull from the herd, one ram, and seven male lambs, each a year old and without blemish.

verses.latin: et in sacrificium eorum tres decimas similae oleo conspersae per singulos vitulos, et duas decimas similae pari modo per singulos arietes,
verses.english: For the meal offering that accompanies them, you shall prepare three-tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with oil for each young bull, and two-tenths of an ephah of fine flour prepared in the same way for each ram.

verses.latin: et decimam similae oleo conspersae per singulos agnos septem,
verses.english: And one-tenth of an ephah of fine flour mixed with oil for each of the seven male lambs.

verses.latin: et hircum pro peccato, absque his quae pro peccato semper offerri solent, et holocausto assiduo, et sacrificio et libaminibus eorum.
verses.english: You shall also offer one male goat as a sin offering. This is in addition to the sin offering regularly made for atonement, and in addition to the daily perpetual burnt offering, its meal offering, and their drink offerings.

verses.latin: Die quoque quintadecima mensis septimi, erit vobis sancta et solemne: omne opus servile non facietis in eo, sed celebrabitis solemnitatem Domini septem diebus.
verses.english: On the fifteenth day of this seventh month, you shall have another holy and solemn assembly— this is the Feast of Tabernacles. You shall do no work of any kind that makes you a servant of anyone but God on that day, but you shall celebrate the Lord's festival for seven days.

verses.latin: Offeretisque holocaustum in odorem suavissimum Domino, vitulos de armento tredecim, arietes duos, agnos anniculos immaculatos quatuordecim:
verses.english: You shall offer a burnt offering to the Lord, which is a sweet aroma to Him: thirteen young bulls from the herd, two rams, and fourteen male lambs, each a year old and without blemish.

verses.latin: et in sacrificium eorum tres decimas similae oleo conspersae per singulos vitulos, et duas decimas similae per singulos arietes,
verses.english: For the meal offering that accompanies them, you shall prepare three-tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with oil for each young bull, and two-tenths of an ephah of fine flour for each ram.

verses.latin: et decimam similae oleo conspersae per singulos agnos quatuordecim:
verses.english: And one-tenth of an ephah of fine flour mixed with oil for each of the fourteen male lambs.

verses.latin: et hircum unum pro peccato, absque holocausto assiduo, et sacrificio, et libamine ejus.
verses.english: You shall also offer one male goat as a sin offering. This is in addition to the daily perpetual burnt offering, its meal offering, and its drink offering.

verses.latin: Die secundo, vitulos de armento duodecim, arietes duos, agnos anniculos immaculatos quatuordecim:
verses.english: On the second day of the festival, you shall offer twelve young bulls from the herd, two rams, and fourteen male lambs, each a year old and without blemish.

verses.latin: et in sacrificium eorum et libamina singulorum vitulorum, et arietum, et agnorum, juxta numerum et ritum:
verses.english: And for their meal offerings and drink offerings, these shall be prepared for each individual young bull, ram, and lamb, according to their prescribed number and ritual.

verses.latin: et hircum unum pro peccato, absque holocausto assiduo, et sacrificio, et libamine ejus.
verses.english: You shall also offer one male goat as a sin offering. This is in addition to the daily perpetual burnt offering, its meal offering, and its drink offering.

verses.latin: Die tertio, vitulos undecim, arietes duos, agnos anniculos immaculatos quatuordecim:
verses.english: On the third day of the festival, you shall offer eleven young bulls, two rams, and fourteen male lambs, each a year old and without blemish.

verses.latin: et in sacrificium eorum et libamina singulorum vitulorum, et arietum, et agnorum, juxta numerum et ritum:
verses.english: And for their meal offerings and drink offerings, these shall be prepared for each individual young bull, ram, and lamb, according to their prescribed number and ritual.

verses.latin: et hircum unum pro peccato, absque holocausto assiduo, et sacrificio, et libamine ejus.
verses.english: You shall also offer one male goat as a sin offering. This is in addition to the daily perpetual burnt offering, its meal offering, and its drink offering.

verses.latin: Die quarto, vitulos decem, arietes duos, agnos anniculos immaculatos quatuordecim:
verses.english: On the fourth day of the festival, you shall offer ten young bulls, two rams, and fourteen male lambs, each a year old and without blemish.

verses.latin: et in sacrificium eorum et libamina singulorum vitulorum, et arietum, et agnorum, juxta numerum et ritum:
verses.english: And for their meal offerings and drink offerings, these shall be prepared for each individual young bull, ram, and lamb, according to their prescribed number and ritual.

verses.latin: et hircum unum pro peccato, absque holocausto assiduo, et sacrificio, et libamine ejus.
verses.english: You shall also offer one male goat as a sin offering. This is in addition to the daily perpetual burnt offering, its meal offering, and its drink offering.

verses.latin: Die quinto, vitulos novem, arietes duos, agnos anniculos immaculatos quatuordecim:
verses.english: On the fifth day of the festival, you shall offer nine young bulls, two rams, and fourteen male lambs, each a year old and without blemish.

verses.latin: et in sacrificium eorum et libamina singulorum vitulorum, et arietum, et agnorum, juxta numerum et ritum:
verses.english: And for their meal offerings and drink offerings, these shall be prepared for each individual young bull, ram, and lamb, according to their prescribed number and ritual.

verses.latin: et hircum unum pro peccato, absque holocausto assiduo, et sacrificio, et libamine ejus.
verses.english: You shall also offer one male goat as a sin offering. This is in addition to the daily perpetual burnt offering, its meal offering, and its drink offering.

verses.latin: Die sexto, vitulos octo, arietes duos, agnos anniculos immaculatos quatuordecim:
verses.english: On the sixth day of the festival, you shall offer eight young bulls, two rams, and fourteen male lambs, each a year old and without blemish.

verses.latin: et in sacrificium eorum et libamina singulorum vitulorum, et arietum, et agnorum, juxta numerum et ritum:
verses.english: And for their meal offerings and drink offerings, these shall be prepared for each individual young bull, ram, and lamb, according to their prescribed number and ritual.

verses.latin: et hircum unum pro peccato, absque holocausto assiduo, et sacrificio, et libamine ejus.
verses.english: You shall also offer one male goat as a sin offering. This is in addition to the daily perpetual burnt offering, its meal offering, and its drink offering.

verses.latin: Die septimo, vitulos septem, arietes duos, agnos anniculos immaculatos quatuordecim:
verses.english: On the seventh day of the festival, you shall offer seven young bulls, two rams, and fourteen male lambs, each a year old and without blemish.

verses.latin: et in sacrificium eorum et libamina singulorum vitulorum, et arietum, et agnorum, juxta numerum et ritum:
verses.english: And for their meal offerings and drink offerings, these shall be prepared for each individual young bull, ram, and lamb, according to their prescribed number and ritual.

verses.latin: et hircum unum pro peccato, absque holocausto assiduo, et sacrificio, et libamine ejus.
verses.english: You shall also offer one male goat as a sin offering. This is in addition to the daily perpetual burnt offering, its meal offering, and its drink offering.

verses.latin: Die octavo, erit vobis ex sacris solemnitas: omne opus servile non facietis in ea.
verses.english: On the eighth day of the festival, you shall have a sacred and solemn assembly. This marks the conclusion of the Feast of Tabernacles. You shall do no work of any kind that makes you a servant of anyone but God on that day.

verses.latin: Offeretisque holocaustum Domino in odorem suavissimum, vitulum unum, arietem unum, agnos anniculos immaculatos septem:
verses.english: You shall then offer a burnt offering to the Lord, which is a sweet aroma to Him: one young bull, one ram, and seven male lambs, each a year old and without blemish.

verses.latin: et in sacrificium eorum et libamina singulorum vitulorum, et arietum, et agnorum, juxta numerum et ritum:
verses.english: And for their meal offerings and drink offerings, these shall be prepared for each individual young bull, ram, and lamb, according to their prescribed number and ritual.

verses.latin: et hircum unum pro peccato, absque holocausto assiduo, et sacrificio, et libamine ejus.
verses.english: You shall also offer one male goat as a sin offering. This is in addition to the daily perpetual burnt offering, its meal offering, and its drink offering.

verses.latin: Haec offeretis Domino in solemnitatibus vestris: absque votis et sponte oblatis, in holocausto et sacrificio, in libamine et victimis pacificis.
verses.english: These are the offerings you shall present to the Lord during your appointed festivals. They are to be offered in addition to any votive offerings, which are pledges made to God, and any freewill offerings, which are given voluntarily, whether they are burnt offerings, meal offerings, drink offerings, or peace offerings.

verses.latin: Exposuitque Moyses filiis Israel omnia quae sibi Dominus imperaverat.
verses.english: And so Moses explained to the children of Israel everything that the Lord had commanded him to tell them.

verses.latin: Locutusque est Moyses ad principes tribuum filiorum Israel: Hæc est res, quam præcepit Dominus:
verses.english: Moses then spoke to the leaders of the tribes of the children of Israel, saying, "This is the directive which the Lord has commanded:"

verses.latin: Si quis vir votum Domino voverit, aut se sacramento constrinxerit: non faciet irritum sermonem suum, sed omne quod egressum est de ore suo, perimplebit.
verses.english: "If any man makes a vow to the Lord, or binds himself by a sworn oath, he must not break his promise. Instead, he must fulfill everything that he has spoken with his own mouth."

verses.latin: Si qua mulier votum Domino voverit, et se constrinxerit juramento, quæ est in ætate puellari in domo patris sui:
verses.english: "If any woman makes a vow to the Lord, and binds herself by an oath, while she is a young woman living in her father's household:"

verses.latin: Si cognoverit pater votum, quod filia vovit, et juramentum quo se obligavit, et tacuerit, voti rea erit: et omne quod promisit, exequetur.
verses.english: "If her father learns of the vow his daughter has made, and the oath by which she has bound herself, and he remains silent about it—then she will be held accountable for her vow, and she must carry out everything she has promised."

verses.latin: Sin autem audierit pater, et contradixerit, vota ejus, et juramenta irrita erunt, nec in aliquid tenebitur, eo quod pater contradixerit.
verses.english: "But if her father hears about it and immediately forbids it, then her vows and oaths will be invalid; she will not be bound by anything, because her father has forbidden it."

verses.latin: Si maritum acceperit, et votum fecerit, aut semel de ore ejus aliquid audierit, quo animam suam obligaverit:
verses.english: "If a woman takes a husband, and she has made a vow, or has let something pass from her mouth by which she binds herself by an oath:"

verses.latin: Si vir ejus, audito, tacuerit, et in die quo audierit, non contradixerit, vovens voti rea erit: et reddet quodcumque promiserat.
verses.english: "If her husband, upon hearing it, remains silent and does not forbid it on the day he hears it, then the woman who made the vow will be held accountable for it; she must fulfill whatever she has promised."

verses.latin: Sin autem statim ut audierit, contradixerit, et irritum fecerit votum ejus, atque sermonem, qui de ore ejus egressus fuerat, et Dominus ei propitius erit.
verses.english: "But if, as soon as he hears it, her husband forbids it and invalidates her vow and the word that had come from her mouth, then the Lord will be merciful to her, and she will not be held accountable."

verses.latin: Votum viduæ et repudiatæ, quidquid semel de ore ejus egressum fuerit, ratum erit.
verses.english: "Any vow made by a widow or a divorced woman, whatever she has spoken from her mouth, will be binding and valid."

verses.latin: Si quæ in domo viri sui voverit, et se sacramento constrinxerit:
verses.english: "If a woman makes a vow while living in her husband's house, and binds herself with an oath:"

verses.latin: Si vir ejus audierit, et tacuerit, nec contradixerit sermoni, voti rea erit, et reddet.
verses.english: "If her husband hears it, and remains silent, and does not forbid the promise, then she will be held accountable for her vow, and she must fulfill it."

verses.latin: Quod si audiens, statim irritum fecerit, et vota ejus, et verba, quibus obstrinxerat animam suam, nulla erunt: et Dominus ei propitius erit.
verses.english: "But if, upon hearing it, her husband immediately invalidates her vows and the words by which she had bound her soul, then they will be void; and the Lord will be merciful to her, so she will not be bound."

verses.latin: Omnia vota, et juramenta, quibus se mulier devoverit, et animam suam obligavertit, in arbitrio viri erunt, ut valeant, an irrita fiant.
verses.english: "All vows and oaths by which a woman has consecrated herself or bound her soul will be subject to her husband's decision, whether they are to be valid or invalidated."

verses.latin: Si audiens vir, tacuerit, et in diem alterum distulerit, rata erunt vota mulieris, et juramenta perimplebit, eo quod, audita, tacuerit.
verses.english: "If her husband hears it, and remains silent, and postpones action until the next day, then the woman's vows will be binding, and she must fulfill her oaths. This is because he heard them and remained silent."

verses.latin: Si vero contradixerit statim, irrita faciet vota ejus, et sermones de labiis ejus prolatos, atque juramenta, quibus animam suam obligavertit: et feret Dominus ei propitius.
verses.english: "But if he immediately forbids it, he will invalidate her vows, and the words spoken from her lips, and the oaths by which she had bound her soul. Then the Lord will be merciful to her, and she will be free from the obligation."

verses.latin: Hæc est lex votorum, quam constituit Dominus Moysi inter virum et uxorem, inter patrem et filiam, quæ in puellari ætate est, vel in domo patris sui.
verses.english: "This is the law concerning vows, which the Lord established for Moses: defining the relationship between a husband and wife, and between a father and his daughter who is a young woman, still living in her father's household."

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: The Lord God then spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Ulter vindica filios Israël de Madian, et sic colligeris ad populum tuum.
verses.english: "You must exact vengeance for the children of Israel against the Midianites. After you do this, you will die and join your ancestors."

verses.latin: Protinus locutus est Moyses ad populum, dicens: Armamini viros ex vobis ad pugnam, qui eant et exequantur vindictam Domini in Madian.
verses.english: Immediately Moses spoke to the people, saying: "Arm men from among you for battle. They must go and execute the Lord's vengeance against Midian."

verses.latin: Mille ex singulis tribubus Israël mittetis ad bellum.
verses.english: "From each tribe of Israel, you will send a thousand men to war."

verses.latin: Misi que sunt ex millibus Israël, mille de tribu uniuscujusque, duodecim millia parata ad pugnam.
verses.english: So out of the thousands of Israel, a thousand from each tribe were sent—twelve thousand in total, prepared for battle.

verses.latin: Quos misit Moyses cum Phinees filio Eleazari sacerdotis, qui portavit vasa sancta, et tubas ad sonandum.
verses.english: Moses sent them with Phinehas, the son of Eleazar the priest. Phinehas carried the holy vessels and the trumpets for sounding the battle cry.

verses.latin: Cumque pugnassent contra Madian, et vicissent eos, occiderunt omnes masculos.
verses.english: When they had fought against Midian and conquered them, they killed all the male inhabitants.

verses.latin: Et reges Madian, Evi, et Recem, et Sur, et Hur, et Rebe, quinque simul duces gentis, Balac quoque filium Beor, et Balaam filium Beor, interfecerunt gladio.
verses.english: They also killed the kings of Midian: Evi, Rekem, Zur, Hur, and Reba—all five leaders of that nation. Additionally, they killed Balaam, the son of Beor, with the sword.

verses.latin: Ceperuntque filii Israël mulieres eorum, et parvulos, et omnia jumenta, et pecora, et quidquid habere potuerunt: universam praedam asportantes.
verses.english: The children of Israel captured their women and their little ones. They also took all their cattle, all their flocks, and everything they could possess, carrying away all the plunder.

verses.latin: Cunctasque urbes, et viculos, et castella Madian, igni combusserunt.
verses.english: And they burned all the cities, villages, and fortified camps of Midian with fire.

verses.latin: Et dividentes spolia, et quidquid ceperant, tam de hominibus, quam de jumentis, ad Moysen et Eleazarum sacerdotem, et ad omnem coetum filiorum Israël, duxerunt ad castra in campestribus Moab, juxta Jordanem contra Jericho.
verses.english: Then, dividing the spoils and everything they had captured—both people and animals—they brought them to Moses, and to Eleazar the priest, and to the whole assembly of the children of Israel, to their camp in the plains of Moab, beside the Jordan River across from Jericho.

verses.latin: Egressi sunt autem Moyses et Eleazar sacerdos, et omnes principes coetus obviam eorum.
verses.english: Moses, Eleazar the priest, and all the leaders of the assembly went out to meet them.

verses.latin: Iratusque est Moyses adversum principes exercitus, tribunos, et centuriones, qui veniebant de bello.
verses.english: Moses became angry with the leaders of the army, the tribunes (commanders of a thousand men), and the centurions (commanders of a hundred men), who were returning from the war.

verses.latin: Et ait: Quare reservastis omnes feminas?
verses.english: He asked them: "Why have you kept all the women alive?"

verses.latin: Hae sunt quae deceperunt filios Israël, suasu Balaam, et seduxerunt vos ad praevaricationem Domini super peccato Phogor: et occisi sunt homines XXIII millia populi.
verses.english: "These are the very women who, at Balaam’s instigation, deceived the children of Israel. They led you to betray the Lord in the matter of Peor, which resulted in twenty-three thousand men of the people being killed."

verses.latin: Igitur interficite omnes masculos in parvulis, et matres eorum quae cognoverunt viros in complexu dormientes.
verses.english: "Therefore, kill every male among the little ones, and kill every mother who has known a man by sleeping with him."

verses.latin: Puellas autem et omnes feminas quae non noverunt viriles concubitus, reservate vobis.
verses.english: "But keep all the young girls and all the women who have not known a man through sexual intercourse alive for yourselves."

verses.latin: Sed et manete extra castra septem diebus. Qui occiderit hominem, vel tetigerit occisum, lustrabitur die tertio et septimo.
verses.english: "Moreover, you must remain outside the camp for seven days. Whoever has killed a person or touched a dead body must purify himself on the third and seventh day."

verses.latin: Et de omni praeda, vestimento, et vasis de pellibus, et opere cilicio, et omni ligneo, mundabitis vos.
verses.english: "You must also purify yourselves, along with all your plunder: clothing, articles made of skins, woven goats' hair, and anything made of wood."

verses.latin: Dixitque Dominus ad Moysen:
verses.english: The Lord then spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Haec est lex sacrificii quam praecepit Dominus:
verses.english: "This is the law of purification that the Lord has commanded."

verses.latin: Aurum, et argentum, et aes, et ferrum, et stannum, et plumbum,
verses.english: "Anything that is gold, silver, bronze, iron, tin, or lead—"

verses.latin: et omne quod potest ignem perferre, per ignem transibit, et mundabitur: et quidquid ignem non potest sustinere, aquae lustrabitur.
verses.english: "and everything that can endure fire—you must pass it through fire, and it will be made clean. And whatever cannot withstand fire must be purified with water."

verses.latin: Et lavabitis vestimenta vestra die septimo, et mundi eritis: et postea intrabitis in castra.
verses.english: "And on the seventh day, you must wash your clothes, and then you will be clean. After that, you may enter the camp."

verses.latin: Locutus est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: The Lord then spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Separa spolia, et quidquid captum est, ab homine usque ad pecus, et in duas partes divide inter eos qui ad bellum profecti sunt, et totius populi multitudinem.
verses.english: "Separate the spoils—everything that has been captured, from people to livestock—and divide it into two parts. One part will go to those who went to war, and the other to the entire multitude of the people."

verses.latin: Et auferes unum de quingentis, tam de hominibus, quam de bobus, et asinis, et ovibus,
verses.english: "From the half belonging to the soldiers, you must take one out of every five hundred—from both people and from cattle, donkeys, and sheep."

verses.latin: in partem Domini de his qui pugnaverunt: dabisque Eleazaro sacerdoti, quia primitiae sunt Domini.
verses.english: "This portion belongs to the Lord, taken from those who fought. You will give it to Eleazar the priest, because these are the Lord’s firstfruits (the first offerings)."

verses.latin: De medietate autem filiorum Israël, id est, de his quae pertinent ad turbam, et ad reliquos, unum de quinquaginta capies, tam de hominibus, quam de bobus, et asinis, et ovibus, et cunctis animantibus: dabisque Levitis qui excubant in custodiis tabernaculi Domini.
verses.english: "From the half belonging to the children of Israel—that is, from what pertains to the multitude and the rest of the people—you will take one out of every fifty, from both people and from cattle, donkeys, sheep, and all living creatures. You will give this portion to the Levites, who stand guard over the Lord's tabernacle."

verses.latin: Fecitque Moyses et Eleazar sicut praeceperat Dominus.
verses.english: Moses and Eleazar did exactly as the Lord had commanded.

verses.latin: Fuitque praeda, exceptis his quae singuli rapiunt, sexcenta septuaginta quinque millia ovium,
verses.english: The total plunder, apart from what each individual soldier took for himself, amounted to six hundred seventy-five thousand sheep,

verses.latin: septuaginta duo millia boum,
verses.english: seventy-two thousand cattle,

verses.latin: sexaginta unum millia asinorum,
verses.english: sixty-one thousand donkeys,

verses.latin: et triginta duo millia animarum de femininis sexus, quae nunquam concubuerant cum viro.
verses.english: and thirty-two thousand human souls of the female sex, who had never lain with a man.

verses.latin: Factaque est pars eorum qui ierant ad bellum, ad numerum triginta trium millium septingentarum quinquaginta ovium.
verses.english: The portion for those who had gone to war was thirty-three thousand seven hundred fifty sheep.

verses.latin: De quibus, in partem Domini, septuaginta quinque ovium.
verses.english: From these, seventy-five sheep were designated as the Lord's portion.

verses.latin: Boum vero triginta sex millia: et ex his in partem Domini, septuaginta duo.
verses.english: Of the cattle, there were thirty-six thousand, and from these, seventy-two were designated as the Lord's portion.

verses.latin: Asinorum triginta millia quingenta: et ex his in partem Domini, sexaginta unum.
verses.english: Of the donkeys, there were thirty thousand five hundred, and from these, sixty-one were designated as the Lord's portion.

verses.latin: Animarum quoque quindecim millia centum: et ex his in partem Domini, triginta duo.
verses.english: Of the human souls, there were fifteen thousand one hundred, and from these, thirty-two were designated as the Lord's portion.

verses.latin: Et dedit Moyses Eleazaro sacerdoti, et Levitis, et omni multitudini Israël, partes divisas sicut praeceperat Dominus.
verses.english: And Moses gave to Eleazar the priest, to the Levites, and to the entire multitude of Israel, the divided portions just as the Lord had commanded.

verses.latin: Filii autem Ruben et Gad habebant pecora multa et inmensa, et cum vidissent terras Iazer et Galaad aptas pecoribus,
verses.english: Now the descendants of Reuben and Gad owned an immense amount of livestock. When they saw the regions of Jazer and Gilead, they recognized that these lands were very suitable for their herds.

verses.latin: venerunt ad Moysen et ad Eleazarum sacerdotem et ad principes multitudinis atque dixerunt:
verses.english: So they came to Moses, to Eleazar the priest, and to the leaders of the assembly, and they spoke to them.

verses.latin: Ataroth et Dibon et Iazer et Nemra et Esebon et Eleale et Sabama et Nebo et Beon,
verses.english: They spoke concerning Ataroth, Dibon, Jazer, Nemra, Heshbon, Elealeh, Sibmah, Nebo, and Beon.

verses.latin: terram quam percussit Dominus in conspectu multitudinis Israhel, terra est uberrima ad pastum pecorum nostrorum.
verses.english: This is the land that the Lord conquered before the eyes of the assembly of Israel—it is a very fertile land for the pasturing of our immense herds.

verses.latin: Idcirco oramus si invenimus gratiam coram te, ut des nobis famulis tuis possessionem ejus, et ne transducas nos Iordanem.
verses.english: Therefore, we beg you: if we have found favor in your sight, please give this land to us, your servants, as our possession. Do not make us cross the Jordan River.

verses.latin: Dixitque Moyses ad filios Gad et Ruben: Num fratres vestri ibunt ad pugnam, vos autem hic manebitis?
verses.english: Moses then said to the descendants of Gad and Reuben: 'Are your brothers going to war, while you yourselves remain here?'

verses.latin: Cur subvertitis mentes filiorum Israhel, ne transire audeant in terram quam Dominus daturus est eis?
verses.english: Why are you discouraging the minds of the other descendants of Israel, preventing them from daring to cross into the land that the Lord is about to give them?

verses.latin: Sic fecerunt patres vestri, quando misi eos de Cadesbarne ad explorandam terram.
verses.english: Your fathers did the same thing when I sent them from Kadesh-barnea to explore the promised land.

verses.latin: Cumque ascendissent usque ad vallem Botri, et lustrassent universam terram, averterunt cor filiorum Israhel, ut non ingrederentur fines, quos eis Dominus dederat.
verses.english: When they went up as far as the Valley of Eshcol and surveyed the entire land, they turned away the hearts of the descendants of Israel, so that they would not enter the borders that the Lord had given them.

verses.latin: Iratusque Dominus, et jurans ait:
verses.english: Therefore, the Lord became angry and swore an oath, saying:

verses.latin: Si videbunt homines isti generationis huius pessimae, terram quam sub juramento pollicitus sum Abraham et Isaac et Jacob, qui noluerunt me sequi.
verses.english: Surely none of these men of this evil generation will see the land that I solemnly promised by oath to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob—because they refused to follow Me completely.

verses.latin: Praeter Caleb filium Jephone Cenezaei, et Josue filium Nun, isti impleverunt mandatum Domini.
verses.english: Except for Caleb, the son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite, and Joshua, the son of Nun; only these two completely fulfilled the command of the Lord.

verses.latin: Iratusque Dominus in Israhel, triginta et octo annis circumduxit eos per desertum, donec consumeretur omnis generatio quae fecerat malum in conspectu ejus.
verses.english: And so, the Lord's anger burned against Israel. He made them wander for thirty-eight years through the desert, until that entire generation who had done evil in His sight had completely perished.

verses.latin: Et ecce vos successistis patribus vestris, incrementa hominum peccatorum, ut augeatis furorem Domini contra Israhel.
verses.english: And look, you have now followed in your fathers' footsteps, a new generation of sinful men, only to further increase the Lord's burning fury against Israel.

verses.latin: Si enim nolueritis eum sequi, addet ultra ut vos deseramus in deserto, et perdetis omnem populum istum.
verses.english: For if you refuse to follow Him, He will abandon us all again in this desert, and you will bring ruin upon this entire people.

verses.latin: At illi propius accedentes, dixerunt: Ovile tantum aedificabimus et stabula pecoribus nostris, parvulis quoque nostris urbes muratas.
verses.english: But they came closer and said to Moses: 'We will only build sheepfolds for our immense herds and construct walled cities for our little ones and our families.'

verses.latin: Nos autem ipsi armati et accincti pergemus ante filios Israhel, et introducemus eos in loca sua, relinquemus parvulos nostros munitionibus propter insidias habitatorum.
verses.english: But we ourselves will arm ourselves and go forward, prepared for battle, before the other descendants of Israel. We will lead them into their allotted places. We will leave our children and our families in fortified cities because of the ambushes of the inhabitants of this land.

verses.latin: Non revertemur in domos nostras, donec possideant filii Israhel omnes hereditatem suam.
verses.english: We will not return to our homes until all the other descendants of Israel have taken possession of their full inheritance.

verses.latin: Nec quicquam ultra poscemus ultra Iordanem, quia jam habemus possessionem nostram in hac parte ad orientalem plagam.
verses.english: Furthermore, we will not ask for any additional land beyond the Jordan, because we already have our full possession here, on the eastern side of the river.

verses.latin: Quibus respondit Moyses: Si facitis quod promittitis, expeditique pergetis coram Domino ad pugnam,
verses.english: Moses responded to them: 'If you truly do what you promise, and if you go forth, ready for battle, before the Lord, to fight—'

verses.latin: Et omnis vir vester armatus transierit Iordanem, donec subvertat Dominus inimicos suos,
verses.english: '—And every armed man among you crosses the Jordan, until the Lord has completely overthrown His enemies—'

verses.latin: Et terra subjecta sit vobis: tunc revertemini et eritis innoxii coram Domino et coram Israhel, et possidebitis regiones quas elegistis, coram Domino.
verses.english: '—and the land is subdued before you; then you may return. You will be held blameless before the Lord and before Israel. And you will truly possess these regions that you have chosen, by the Lord’s authority.'

verses.latin: Sin autem quod dicitis, non feceritis, absque dubio peccatis in Dominum: et scitote quia scelus vestrum vos comprehendet.
verses.english: But if you do not do what you say, then without a doubt, you will be sinning against the Lord. And be assured: your sin will certainly find you out and catch you.

verses.latin: Aedificate ergo urbes parvulis vestris, et ovilia et stabula pecoribus: et quod promittitis, implete.
verses.english: Therefore, build your cities for your children and your families, and construct sheepfolds and stables for your immense herds. But most importantly, fulfill what you have promised.

verses.latin: Responderuntque filii Gad et Ruben ad Moysen: Servi tui faciemus sicut dominus noster praecipit.
verses.english: The descendants of Gad and Reuben responded to Moses: 'We, your servants, will do exactly as our lord commands.'

verses.latin: Parvuli nostri, et conjuges, et pecora, et omnia armenta in urbibus Galaad manebunt.
verses.english: Our children, our wives, our immense herds, and all our other livestock will remain in the cities of Gilead.

verses.latin: Tui autem servi, omnes expediti ad bellum, transibunt coram Domino in certamen, sicut dominus noster loquitur.
verses.english: But your servants, every one of us prepared for battle, will cross over before the Lord into the conflict, just as our lord has spoken.

verses.latin: Praecepit ergo Moyses de illis Eleazaro sacerdoti et Josue filio Nun, et principibus familiarum per tribus Israhel,
verses.english: Moses therefore gave these instructions concerning them to Eleazar the priest, to Joshua the son of Nun, and to the chiefs of the family units within each tribe of Israel.

verses.latin: Si transierint filii Gad et Ruben vobiscum Jordanem, omnes expediti ad pugnam, et vobis fuerit terra subjecta: date eis possessionem Galaad.
verses.english: He said: 'If the descendants of Gad and Reuben cross the Jordan with you, all of them prepared for battle, and if the land is subdued before you, then you are to give them the land of Gilead as their possession.'

verses.latin: Si noluerint transire vobiscum armati in terram Chanaan: possideant inter vos in terra Chanaan.
verses.english: But if they are unwilling to cross the Jordan with you, armed for battle, into the land of Canaan, then they will forfeit their request for Gilead. Instead, they must then receive their portion among you, within the land of Canaan itself, just like the other tribes.

verses.latin: Responderuntque filii Gad et Ruben, dicentes: Sicut locutus est Dominus servis suis, ita faciemus.
verses.english: The descendants of Gad and Reuben responded, saying: 'Just as the Lord has spoken to His servants through you, so we will do.'

verses.latin: Nos armati transibimus ad terram Chanaan, et postquam optinuerimus possessionem nostram trans Iordanem, revertemur.
verses.english: We will cross over, armed, to the land of Canaan. And only after we have helped to secure the possession for the other tribes beyond the Jordan, will we then return to our own possession on this side of the Jordan.

verses.latin: Dedit itaque Moyses filiis Gad et Ruben, et dimidiae tribui Manasse filii Joseph regnum Sehon regis Amorraei, et regnum Og regis Basan, omnemque terram cum urbibus suis per circuitum.
verses.english: So Moses gave to the descendants of Gad and Reuben, and to half the tribe of Manasseh, the son of Joseph, the kingdom of Sihon, king of the Amorites, and the kingdom of Og, king of Bashan. This included all the land with its surrounding cities.

verses.latin: Aedificaveruntque filii Gad Dibon et Ataroth et Aroer,
verses.english: And the descendants of Gad built or rebuilt the cities of Dibon, Ataroth, and Aroer.

verses.latin: Et Ataroth Sophan et Jazer et Jogbaa,
verses.english: They also built Atroth-shophan, Jazer, and Jogbehah.

verses.latin: Et Bethnemra et Betharan, urbes muratas, et ovilia pecorum.
verses.english: They also built Beth-nimrah and Beth-haran as walled cities, and constructed sheepfolds for their immense herds.

verses.latin: Filii vero Ruben aedificaverunt Esebon et Eleale et Cariathaim,
verses.english: But the descendants of Reuben built or rebuilt Heshbon, Elealeh, and Kiriathaim.

verses.latin: Necnon et Nabo et Baalmeon versis nominibus, Sabbama quoque, dando nomina urbibus quas aedificaverunt.
verses.english: They also rebuilt Nebo and Baal-meon, giving them new names, and they rebuilt Sibmah. They were assigning new names to all the cities they rebuilt or constructed.

verses.latin: Filii quoque Machir filii Manasse perrexerunt in Galaad, et vastaverunt eam, interficiens Amorrhaeum habitatorem ejus.
verses.english: Furthermore, the descendants of Machir, the son of Manasseh, went into Gilead and devastated it, killing all the Amorite inhabitants who lived there.

verses.latin: Dedit ergo Moyses Galaad Machir filio Manasse, qui habitavit in ea.
verses.english: Therefore, Moses gave the region of Gilead to Machir, the son of Manasseh, and his descendants settled there.

verses.latin: Haec sunt mansiones filiorum Israel, qui egressi sunt de Ægypto per turmas suas in manu Moysi et Aaron.
verses.english:
These are the stages of the journey for the sons of Israel.
They departed from Egypt, organized by their family groups and tribes,
under the leadership and guidance of Moses and Aaron.

verses.latin: Quas scripsit Moyses itinerum mutatos a Domino per singula castra.
verses.english:
Moses recorded these stages of their journey, each one changing at the Lord’s command,
listing every encampment.

verses.latin: Profecti sunt de Ramesse mense primo, quintadecima die mensis primi, altera die Paschae, in conspectu omnium Ægyptiorum.
verses.english:
They departed from Rameses in the first month.
It was the fifteenth day of that first month, on the day after the Passover observance,
while all the Egyptians watched.

verses.latin: Sepelientes primogenita, quae percusserat Dominus in Ægypto, et in diis eorum faciens ultionem.
verses.english:
The Egyptians were busy burying their firstborn children,
whom the Lord had struck down throughout Egypt.
Through these judgments, the Lord had exacted vengeance upon their gods.

verses.latin: Profectique filii Israel de Ramesse, castrametati sunt in Succoth.
verses.english:
Then the sons of Israel departed from Rameses
and set up camp in Succoth.

verses.latin: De Succoth, venerunt in Etham, quae est in extremis finibus solitudinis.
verses.english:
From Succoth, they journeyed to Etham,
which is located at the very edge of the wilderness.

verses.latin: Inde egressi, venerunt contra Phihahiroth, quae respicit Beelsephon, et castrametati sunt contra Magdalum.
verses.english:
Departing from there, they came and encamped before Pi-Hahiroth,
which faces Baal-Zephon,
and they set up their camp opposite Migdol.

verses.latin: Profecti de Phihahiroth, transierunt per medium maris in solitudinem: et ambulantes tribus diebus per desertum Etham, castrametati sunt in Mara.
verses.english:
Journeying from Pi-Hahiroth,
they passed through the midst of the sea into the wilderness.
They traveled for three days through the wilderness of Etham
and then encamped in Marah.

verses.latin: De Mara, venerunt in Elim, ubi erant duodecim fontes aquarum, et septuaginta palmae: et castrametati sunt juxta aquas.
verses.english:
From Marah, they came to Elim.
In Elim, there were twelve springs of water and seventy palm trees.
They then set up camp beside these waters.

verses.latin: Profectique de Elim, castrametati sunt juxta mare Rubrum.
verses.english:
Departing from Elim,
they established their camp beside the Red Sea.

verses.latin: De mari Rubro, egressi sunt in desertum Sin.
verses.english: From the Red Sea, they proceeded into the Wilderness of Sin.

verses.latin: De deserto Sin, profecti sunt in Daphca.
verses.english:
From the Wilderness of Sin,
they journeyed to Dophkah.

verses.latin: De Daphca, venerunt in Alus.
verses.english:
From Dophkah,
they arrived at Alush.

verses.latin: De Alus, profecti sunt, et castrametati in Raphidim, ubi aquam populus non habuit ad bibendum.
verses.english:
Departing from Alush, they traveled
and set up camp in Rephidim.
In this place, the people had no water to drink.

verses.latin: De Raphidim, profecti sunt in desertum Sinai.
verses.english: From Rephidim, they journeyed into the Wilderness of Sinai.

verses.latin: De deserto Sinai, venerunt in sepulchra Concupiscentiae.
verses.english:
From the Wilderness of Sinai,
they came to Kibroth-Hattaavah, which means 'the graves of craving'.

verses.latin: De sepulchris Concupiscentiae, profecti sunt in Haseroth.
verses.english:
From Kibroth-Hattaavah,
they journeyed to Hazeroth.

verses.latin: De Haseroth, venerunt in Rethma.
verses.english:
From Hazeroth,
they arrived at Rithmah.

verses.latin: De Rethma, profecti sunt in Remmonphares.
verses.english:
From Rithmah,
they journeyed to Rimmon-Perez.

verses.latin: De Remmonphares, venerunt in Lebna.
verses.english:
From Rimmon-Perez,
they arrived at Libnah.

verses.latin: De Lebna, profecti sunt in Ressa.
verses.english:
From Libnah,
they journeyed to Rissah.

verses.latin: De Ressa, venerunt in Cehelatha.
verses.english:
From Rissah,
they arrived at Kehelathah.

verses.latin: De Cehelatha, profecti sunt in montem Sepher.
verses.english:
From Kehelathah,
they journeyed to Mount Shepher.

verses.latin: De monte Sepher, venerunt in Harada.
verses.english:
From Mount Shepher,
they arrived at Haradah.

verses.latin: De Harada, profecti sunt in Maceloth.
verses.english:
From Haradah,
they journeyed to Makheloth.

verses.latin: De Maceloth, venerunt in Thahath.
verses.english:
From Makheloth,
they arrived at Tahath.

verses.latin: De Thahath, profecti sunt in Thare.
verses.english:
From Tahath,
they journeyed to Terah.

verses.latin: De Thare, venerunt in Methca.
verses.english:
From Terah,
they arrived at Mithkah.

verses.latin: De Methca, profecti sunt in Hesmona.
verses.english:
From Mithkah,
they journeyed to Hashmonah.

verses.latin: De Hesmona, venerunt in Moseroth.
verses.english:
From Hashmonah,
they arrived at Moseroth.

verses.latin: De Moseroth, profecti sunt in Benejaacan.
verses.english:
From Moseroth,
they journeyed to Bene-Jaakan.

verses.latin: De Benejaacan, venerunt in horum montem, unde mortuus est Aaron.
verses.english:
From Bene-Jaakan,
they arrived at Hor-Hagidgad.

verses.latin: De Hor, profecti sunt in Gadgad.
verses.english:
From Hor-Hagidgad,
they journeyed to Jotbathah.

verses.latin: De Gadgad, venerunt in Jethabatha.
verses.english:
From Jotbathah,
they arrived at Ebronah.

verses.latin: De Jethabatha, profecti sunt in Ebrona.
verses.english:
From Ebronah,
they journeyed to Ezion-Geber.

verses.latin: De Ebrona, profecti sunt in Asiongaber, castrametati sunt in deserto Sin, haec est Cades.
verses.english:
From Ezion-Geber,
they journeyed to the Wilderness of Zin, which is Kadesh.

verses.latin: De Cades, profecti sunt in montem Hor, in extremis finibus terrae Edom.
verses.english:
From Kadesh,
they journeyed to Mount Hor, which is on the border of the land of Edom.

verses.latin: Cumque ascendisset Aaron sacerdos in montem Hor, jubente Domino, trigesimo et nono anno egressionis eorum de terra Ægypti, quinto mense, prima die mensis.
verses.english:
When Aaron the priest ascended Mount Hor, as the Lord commanded,
it was in the thirty-ninth year after the sons of Israel’s departure from the land of Egypt,
in the fifth month, on the first day of that month.

verses.latin: Habensque annos centum viginti tres, ibi mortuus est.
verses.english:
Aaron was one hundred and twenty-three years old,
and there, on that mountain, he died.

verses.latin: Audivit Chananaeus rex Arad, qui habitabat ad meridiem, in terra Chanaan, venisse filios Israel.
verses.english:
The Canaanite king of Arad, who lived in the Negeb—the southern part of the land of Canaan—
had heard that the sons of Israel were approaching.

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen dicens:
verses.english: The Lord then spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Præcipe filiis Israël, et dices ad eos: Cum ingressi fueritis terram Chanaan, et in possessionem vobis sorte ceciderit, his terminis finietur:
verses.english: Give a command to the children of Israel and say to them: 'When you enter the land of Chanaan, and it falls to you by lot as your possession, it will be marked by these specific boundaries:

verses.latin: Pars meridiana ab eremo Sin, quæ est contra Edom, per eos limites ducetur latitudinis maris Salsissimi orientalis.
verses.english: The southern part of the border will be marked out from the wilderness of Sin, which is opposite Edom. This border will extend along the width of the eastern Salt Sea, which is also known as the Dead Sea.

verses.latin: Et circumibit per meridiem, contra ascensum Scorpionis, et transibit in Senna, pervenietque ad Cadesbarne, et inde ad villam nomine Adar pertinget, et usque ad Asemona.
verses.english: The border will then curve around to the south, opposite the Ascent of Scorpions. It will pass into Senna, and reach Cadesbarne. From there, it will extend to the town named Adar and continue as far as Asemona.

verses.latin: Tandem circumiens ab Asemona per torrentem Ægyptiæ, et egredietur ad finem maris occidentalis.
verses.english: Finally, circling from Asemona, the border will follow the Brook of Egypt and will extend to the edge of the western sea.

verses.latin: Terminus quoque occidentalis ab hoc mari usque ad magnum mare protendetur, et hic erit littus.
verses.english: The western boundary will also extend from this sea all the way to the Great Sea—the Mediterranean Sea. This will be your coastline.

verses.latin: Porro septentrionalis plaga a magno mari usque ad montem Altissimum præfinita erit.
verses.english: Furthermore, the northern side will be defined from the Great Sea, all the way to Mount Altissimus.

verses.latin: Ab Altissimo monte perveniet usque Emath, et a finibus ejus usque ad Sedada.
verses.english: From Mount Altissimus, it will reach as far as Emath. From the borders of Emath, it will extend to Sedada.

verses.latin: Ibuntque termini usque Sephron, et pervenient in villam Enan. Hæc erit meta in parte septentrionali.
verses.english: The borders will continue as far as Sephron and will reach the town of Enan. This will be your boundary on the northern side.

verses.latin: Inde ad orientalem plagam termini diriguntur de villa Enan usque Sephama.
verses.english: From there, the borders will be directed towards the eastern side, from the town of Enan as far as Sephama.

verses.latin: Et de Sephama descendent in Rabla, contra fontem, et pervenient usque ad mare Cenereth orientem.
verses.english: And from Sephama, they will descend to Rabla, opposite the spring. They will then reach as far as the eastern Sea of Cenereth, also known as the Sea of Galilee.

verses.latin: Et perveniet usque ad Jordanem, et ad mare Salsissimum. Hæc erit terra vestra per circuitum litoribus suis.
verses.english: The border will extend to the Jordan River and to the Salt Sea—the Dead Sea. This will be your land all around its borders.

verses.latin: Præcepitque Moyses filiis Israël, dicens: Hæc est terra, quam possidebitis sorte, et quam jussit Dominus dari novem tribubus, et dimidiæ tribui.
verses.english: Moses then commanded the children of Israel, saying: 'This is the land that you will possess by lot, and which the Lord has commanded to be given to the nine tribes and the half-tribe of Manasseh.

verses.latin: Tribus enim Ruben per familias suas, et tribus Gad juxta cognationes suas, media quoque tribus Manasse, jam acceperunt partem suam.
verses.english: For the tribe of Ruben, according to its families, and the tribe of Gad, according to its clans, and also the half-tribe of Manasseh, have already received their portion of the land.

verses.latin: Trans Jordanem contra Jericho ad orientalem plagam.
verses.english: This portion of land is beyond the Jordan River, opposite Jericho, on the eastern side.

verses.latin: Et locutus est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: The Lord then spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Hæc sunt nomina virorum, qui terram vobis divident: Eleazar sacerdos, et Josue filius Nun.
verses.english: These are the names of the men who will divide the land for you: Eleazar the priest, and Josue, the son of Nun.

verses.latin: Singulorum quoque tribuum principem.
verses.english: A prince will also be appointed for each of the tribes.

verses.latin: Horum sunt nomina: tribus Juda, Caleb filius Jephone.
verses.english: These are their names: For the tribe of Juda, Caleb, the son of Jephone.

verses.latin: Tribus Simeon, Samuel filius Ammiud.
verses.english: For the tribe of Simeon, Samuel, the son of Ammiud.

verses.latin: Tribus Benjamin, Elidad filius Chaselon.
verses.english: For the tribe of Benjamin, Elidad, the son of Chaselon.

verses.latin: Tribus Dan, Bocci filius Jogli.
verses.english: For the tribe of Dan, Bocci, the son of Jogli.

verses.latin: Filiorum Joseph, tribus Manasse, Haniel filius Ephod.
verses.english: For the sons of Joseph, for the tribe of Manasseh, Haniel, the son of Ephod.

verses.latin: Tribus Ephraim, Camuel filius Sephtan.
verses.english: For the tribe of Ephraim, Camuel, the son of Sephtan.

verses.latin: Tribus Zabulon, Elisaphan filius Pharnach.
verses.english: For the tribe of Zabulon, Elisaphan, the son of Pharnach.

verses.latin: Tribus Issachar, Phaltiel princeps filius Ozan.
verses.english: For the tribe of Issachar, Phaltiel, the prince, the son of Ozan.

verses.latin: Tribus Aser, Ahiud filius Salomi.
verses.english: For the tribe of Aser, Ahiud, the son of Salomi.

verses.latin: Tribus Nephthali, Phedael filius Ammiud.
verses.english: For the tribe of Nephthali, Phedael, the son of Ammiud.

verses.latin: Hi sunt, quibus præcepit Dominus, ut distribuerent terram Chanaan filiis Israël.
verses.english: These are the men whom the Lord commanded to distribute the land of Chanaan to the children of Israel.

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen in campestribus Moab, super Jordanem, contra Jericho, dicens:
verses.english: The Lord spoke to Moses in the plains of Moab, by the Jordan River, opposite Jericho, saying:

verses.latin: Praecipe filiis Israel, ut de possessionibus suis dent Levitis civitates ad habitandum, et suburbana earum in circuitu.
verses.english: “Command the children of Israel that out of their inherited lands, they are to give the Levites cities to live in, along with their surrounding pasture lands.

verses.latin: Ut habitent in oppidis, et suburbana sint pecoribus et jumentis suis.
verses.english: So that the Levites may dwell in these towns, and the pasture lands may be for their cattle and all their other livestock.

verses.latin: Quae suburbana a moenibus civitatum forinsecus, per mille passus in circuitu tendentur.
verses.english: These pasture lands, extending from the city walls outwards, are to reach one thousand paces in every direction.

verses.latin: Itaque ad orientem mille, et ad meridiem mille, et ad occidentem mille, et ad septentrionem mille passus habebunt: et erit civitas in medio.
verses.english: Therefore, they shall have one thousand paces to the east, one thousand to the south, one thousand to the west, and one thousand to the north, with the city located in the center.

verses.latin: De ipsis vero civitatibus quas dabitis Levitis, sex erunt in fugitivorum subsidium, et ad eas confugiet qui occiderit hominem: et absque his, alias quadraginta duas urbes.
verses.english: Among these cities that you will give to the Levites, six are to be designated as cities of refuge, where anyone who has killed another person may flee for safety. In addition to these six, you are to give them forty-two other cities.

verses.latin: Omnes igitur civitates simul quadraginta octo, cum suburbanis earum.
verses.english: Thus, all the cities together, including their pasture lands, will total forty-eight.

verses.latin: De possessionibus filiorum Israel, et majoribus et minoribus, dabitis urbes.
