verses.english: From the inherited lands of the children of Israel, you shall give these cities, taking more from the larger tribes and less from the smaller tribes, according to their possessions.

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: The Lord then spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Loquere filiis Israel, et dices ad eos: Quando transgressi fueritis Jordanem in terram Chanaan,
verses.english: “Speak to the children of Israel and tell them: ‘When you have crossed the Jordan River into the land of Canaan,

verses.latin: decernite quas urbes esse velitis in subsidium fugitivorum, ut ad eas confugiat qui per imprudentiam sanguinem fuderit.
verses.english: you shall designate certain cities to be cities of refuge, so that anyone who has unintentionally shed blood —that is, killed someone without intent— may flee to them for safety.

verses.latin: Et erunt vobis civitates securitatis, ne proximus sanguinis occisum persequatur, et antequam stet in conspectu judicii, moriatur.
verses.english: These cities will be places of safety for you, so that the avenger of blood —the victim’s relative— does not pursue and kill the one who has caused the death before he has had the chance to stand trial before the assembly.

verses.latin: De ipsis autem civitatibus quas in fugitivorum subsidium dare debetis, tres ultra Jordanem erunt, et tres in terra Chanaan.
verses.english: Of these cities that you are to designate as cities of refuge, three are to be located east of the Jordan River, and three are to be located in the land of Canaan.

verses.latin: Et stabunt sex civitates ejusdem numeri ad fugitivorum subsidium, et ad eas confugiet omnis qui sanguinem fuderit.
verses.english: These six cities of refuge will stand ready; anyone who has shed blood —even if unintentionally— may flee to them.

verses.latin: Tam filii Israel, quam advenae et peregrini habebunt eadem loca fugii: ut confugiat ad ea qui per imprudentiam sanguinem fuderit.
verses.english: Both the children of Israel, as well as any foreigners or temporary residents living among you, shall have access to these same places of refuge, so that anyone who has unintentionally shed blood may flee to them.

verses.latin: Si quis ferro percusserit, et mortuus fuerit qui percussus est, reus est homicidii: ipse morietur.
verses.english: If anyone strikes another person with an iron instrument, and the person who was struck dies, then the attacker is guilty of murder; the murderer himself must be put to death.

verses.latin: Si lapidem jecerit, et percusserit, ac mortuus fuerit, reus est homicidii: morietur.
verses.english: If someone throws a stone, and it strikes a person and that person dies, then the thrower is guilty of murder; he must be put to death.

verses.latin: Si ligno percusserit, et mortuus fuerit, reus est homicidii: morietur.
verses.english: If he strikes with a wooden object and that person dies, he is guilty of murder; he must be put to death.

verses.latin: Proximus sanguinis interficiet homicidam: statim ut eum apprehenderit, occidet.
verses.english: The avenger of blood —the victim’s relative— is to kill the murderer; as soon as he catches him, he is to execute him.

verses.latin: Si per odium et insidias quemquam impulserit, aut jecerit in eum quippiam cum inimiitias,
verses.english: If someone pushes another person out of hatred, or throws something at them with hostile intent—

verses.latin: aut per manum inimiitias percusserit, et ille mortuus fuerit, percussor homicida erit: et proximus sanguinis, statim ut invenerit, occidet eum.
verses.english: —or strikes him with a hostile hand, and that person dies, then the attacker is a murderer. The avenger of blood, as soon as he finds him, is to execute him.

verses.latin: Si autem casu, et non per odium, et absque inimicitiis quidquam horum fecerit,
verses.english: But if someone does any of these things by accident, not out of hatred, and without any hostile intent—

verses.latin: nec volentem, nec videntem, et lapidem super eum ceciderit, unde mori posset:
verses.english: —for example, if a person accidentally drops a stone that could kill someone, without intending to hit anyone, or without even seeing anyone there, and it falls upon someone who then dies:

verses.latin: et hoc casu acciderit, et non fuerit inimicus ejus, nec voluerit ei malum:
verses.english: —if this happens by accident, and the person who caused the death was not an enemy of the deceased, nor did he intend any harm to him:

verses.latin: et judicio cœtus erit reus, et liberabitur de manu ultoris sanguinis, ac revertetur per sententiam in urbem ad quam confugerat, manebitque in ea donec sacerdos magnus, qui unctus est oleo sancto, moriatur.
verses.english: Then the assembly shall judge the case. The person who caused the death, having been found innocent of intentional murder, will be protected from the avenger of blood. He must return to the city of refuge to which he had fled and must remain there until the death of the High Priest, who was anointed with the holy oil.

verses.latin: Si transgressus fuerit terminos urbium in quibus fuerat profugium,
verses.english: However, if the one who has fled to a city of refuge goes outside the boundaries of that city and its pasture lands,

verses.latin: et invenerit eum proximus sanguinis, extra fines locorum fugii, et occiderit, non erit reus.
verses.english: and the avenger of blood finds him outside the limits of the city of refuge, and kills him, the avenger will not be guilty of murder.

verses.latin: Debet enim in urbe refugii permanere, usque ad mortem pontificis: post cujus obitum, ad possessionem suam revertetur.
verses.english: For the one who caused the death must remain in the city of refuge until the death of the High Priest; only after the High Priest’s death may he return to his own inherited land and property.

verses.latin: Haec vobis sancta erunt et legitima per omnia generationes vestras, in cunctis habitationibus vestris.
verses.english: These regulations shall be a sacred and binding ordinance for you throughout all your generations and in all the places where you dwell.

verses.latin: Si quis hominem occiderit, sub duobus aut tribus testibus morietur: si uno fuerit teste convictus, non occidetur.
verses.english: If anyone kills a person, the murderer shall be put to death only upon the testimony of two or three witnesses. No one is to be put to death on the testimony of a single witness alone.

verses.latin: Non accipietis pretium ab eo qui reus est sanguinis, ut moriatur, sed statim et ipse morietur.
verses.english: You shall not accept any ransom or payment from a person who is guilty of murder in exchange for his life; the murderer himself must be put to death immediately.

verses.latin: Nec refugii locum qui profugus est, usque ad mortem sacerdotis, pecunia redimet, ut ante revertatur ad sedem suam.
verses.english: Nor shall you accept any ransom to allow a person who has fled to a city of refuge to return to his home before the death of the High Priest.

verses.latin: Ne polluatis terram habitationis vestrae, quae sanguine polluitur: nec potest aliter expiari, nisi per ejus sanguinem qui fudit.
verses.english: Do not pollute the land where you live with bloodshed. The land is polluted by blood, and it cannot be cleansed or atoned for except by the blood of the person who shed it.

verses.latin: Et mundabitis terram habitationis vestrae, et ego Dominus commorabor apud vos: ego enim sum Dominus qui habito inter filios Israel.
verses.english: You must cleanse the land where you live from this pollution, for I, the Lord, will dwell among you. Indeed, I am the Lord, who makes His dwelling among the children of Israel.

verses.latin: Accesserunt autem principes familiarum Galaad, filii Machir filii Manasse, de stirpe filiorum Joseph: et locuti sunt coram Moyse, et coram principibus Israël, capitibus familiarum, atque dixerunt:
verses.english: The chiefs of the Gilead families approached. These were the descendants of Machir, Manasseh’s son, from the lineage of Joseph’s sons. They spoke before Moses, and before the leaders of Israel, who were the heads of their families. They said:

verses.latin: Domine, tibi jussit Dominus, ut terram sorte divideres filiis Israël: et ut dares filiabus Salphaad fratris nostri hæreditatem patris earum.
verses.english: Our Lord, the Commander of all, the Lord, had commanded you to distribute the land by lot among the sons of Israel. He also commanded that you give to the daughters of Zelophehad, our kinsman, their father’s inherited land.

verses.latin: Quæ si nupserint cuilibet alterius tribus, transibit possessio earum ad tribum ad quam pertinent, et de nostra hæreditate imminuetur.
verses.english: Now, if these daughters marry anyone from a different tribe, then their inherited land will transfer to the tribe to which their new family belongs. This would reduce the amount of land allotted to our own tribe.

verses.latin: Cumque jubilæus, id est, quintus et quinquagesimus annus remissionis advenerit, jungentur hæreditati alterius tribus, et de nostra proprietate transibunt.
verses.english: Furthermore, when the Jubilee comes—that is, the fifty-fifth year of remission of debts and return of land—their inherited land will become permanently joined to the inheritance of that other tribe. It will permanently pass out of our possession and ownership.

verses.latin: Respondit Moyses filiis Israël, juxta verbum Domini, atque ait: Tribus filiorum Joseph recte locuta est.
verses.english: Moses responded to the sons of Israel according to the word of the Lord, saying: “The tribe of the sons of Joseph has spoken correctly in this matter.”

verses.latin: Et iste est sermo Domini, quem præcepit de filiabus Salphaad, dicens: Nubant quibus volunt, tantum ut non in alterius tribus hominem, sed in suæ cognationis virum.
verses.english: This is the Lord’s decree, which He has commanded concerning the daughters of Zelophehad. He said: “Let them marry whomever they wish, but only to a man from their own tribe and their own family lineage, not to a man from another tribe.”

verses.latin: Ne commisceantur hæreditates filiorum Israël de tribu in tribum: sed singuli viri de sua stirpe uxores accipiant.
verses.english: This is so that the inherited lands of the sons of Israel do not get mixed up or transferred from one tribe to another. Instead, each man should take a wife from his own clan and lineage.

verses.latin: Et omnis mulier, quæ possessionem acceperit, de altera tribu viro jungatur, et tunc ad suam jussus est reverti cognationem, ut hæreditas maneat in sua tribu.
verses.english: Any woman who receives inherited land as her possession must marry a man from within her own clan, so that the land does not transfer to another tribe, but remains with her ancestral tribe.

verses.latin: Nec transferatur possessio de tribu in tribum, sed in sua maneant singulæ tribus possessionibus.
verses.english: This ensures that no inherited land is transferred from one tribe to another, but that each tribe keeps its own inherited possessions.

verses.latin: Sicut præcepit Dominus Moysi, ita fecerunt filiæ Salphaad.
verses.english: Just as the Lord had commanded Moses, the daughters of Zelophehad did exactly that.

verses.latin: Nupseruntque Maala, et Thersa, et Hegla, et Melcha, et Noa, filiæ Salphaad, ad filios patruorum suorum.
verses.english: So Mahlah, Tirzah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Noah—the daughters of Zelophehad—got married. They married their cousins on their father’s side.

verses.latin: De familia Manasse, quæ fuerat filii Joseph, nupserunt: et mansit possessio earum in tribu ac familia patris sui.
verses.english: They married within the family clan of Manasseh, which was from the lineage of Joseph’s son. And so, their inherited land remained within the tribe and family clan of their father.

verses.latin: Hæc sunt mandata atque judicia, quæ præcepit Dominus per manum Moysi ad filios Israël in campestribus Moab, super Jordanem contra Jericho.
verses.english: These are the commands and legal decrees that the Lord commanded through Moses to the sons of Israel, in the plains of Moab, across the Jordan River, opposite Jericho.
